speaker: Soldier
text: All troops are at their posts and ready for battle, Lord Murdock.

speaker: Murdock
text: Good.

speaker: Murdock
text: Galle. So it begins.

speaker: Galle
text: Yes, my lord. We are prepared.

speaker: Murdock
text: Your squad will be the key to winning this battle. Understood?

speaker: Galle
text: Of course, my lord. I will not let you down.

speaker: Murdock
text: Yes. We shall show them the power of Bern’s main forces. Still...that general from the Lycia Alliance Army made it this far.

speaker: Galle
text: General Roy?

speaker: Murdock
text: Yes, him. I wish to see how he fights...by going up against him in person.

speaker: Yoder
text: Ah, General Roy! I have found you at last.

speaker: Roy
text: Bishop Yoder! What brings you all the way from Etruria? Is something wrong?

speaker: Yoder
text: I did some research after receiving your letter. I have come to the conclusion that Bern has indeed resurrected the Dark Dragon!

speaker: Roy
text: Is that true!? ...But Hartmut defeated the Dark Dragon in the war. How could Bern have brought it back to life?

speaker: Yoder
text: Apparently, Hartmut did defeat the Dark Dragon, but he did not finish it off.

speaker: Roy
text: What!?

speaker: Yoder
text: Instead of killing it, he sealed it away in the mountains of Bern. And the sword he used to seal it was...

speaker: Roy
text: The Binding Blade?

speaker: Yoder
text: Oh, did you know?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. I have done a little studying myself...

speaker: Yoder
text: Even if the Dark Dragon has been released, if we can obtain the Binding Blade, then we may be able to seal it again, or even kill it once and for all. That is the Church’s conclusion, and they sent me to ask for your assistance.

speaker: Roy
text: Do you know where the Dark Dragon is?

speaker: Yoder
text: Yes, that is my next point. As the the fire-breathing Dragons can change into human form, is highly possible that the Dark Dragon can as well. In fact, we have a suspect. There is a shaman called the Dark Priestess whom King Zephiel keeps at his side at all times.

speaker: Roy
text: The Dark Priestess...

speaker: Yoder
text: We have no solid evidence, but it is true that she appeared at around the same time that the other fire-breathing Dragons started to be seen.

speaker: Yoder
text: Apparently, the Dragons sealed away their power in gems called Dragon Stones to change into human form so that they could adapt to this environment. In that case, it would not be surprising if the Dark Dragon was in the form of a human woman as well.

speaker: Roy
text: In any case, we have to go see her to confirm the truth.

speaker: Yoder
text: Yes. I shall accompany you.

speaker: Roy
text: You would fight alongside us? That would be most helpful!

speaker: Yoder
text: Also, take these. These are the Divine Weapons that the Church found on its own. I have instructions to give them to you.

speaker: Roy
text: Divine Weapons, too!?

speaker: Yoder
text: If the Dark Dragon has really been released, this would be the greatest danger mankind has faced since the Scouring!

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. We will face it with all our strength!

speaker: Galle
text: All right, let’s go! Crush them all. Leave none alive! Show the enemy the wrath of the Dragon Masters of Bern!

speaker: Saul
text: Ah, Bishop Yoder.

speaker: Yoder
text: Saul, it is good to see you are well. And thank you. The Church has been saved countless times because you and Dorothy fought alongside Roy.

speaker: Saul
text: ...If one such as I was to be of any help at all, then I am truly proud.

speaker: Yoder
text: Oh? It seems I have never seen you so...serious.

speaker: Saul
text: Bishop Yoder, even I am a priest. I have as much concern for the common good as anybody.

speaker: Yoder
text: I see. I am sorry. Then let us fight together, shall we?

speaker: Zeiss
text: Sir Galle...

speaker: Galle
text: Zeiss. You seem well.

speaker: Zeiss
text: Sir Galle... Must we fight?

speaker: Galle
text: Yes. We must.

speaker: Zeiss
text: I... I don’t want to fight you! You’re the last person...

speaker: Galle
text: Zeiss! Don’t be a child!

speaker: Galle
text: Did you have only so much resolve when you left Bern? Is that all the resolve you had when you decided to fight against Bern!?

speaker: Zeiss
text: No! My mind is...set... Even now, it hurts to point my blade toward Bern, my homeland... But I believed with my heart that the path I chose wasn’t a mistake...!

speaker: Galle
text: Then cast away your hesitation! Focus on crushing those who block the path that you have chosen. ...No matter who it is.

speaker: Zeiss
text: Sir Galle...

speaker: Galle
text: Zeiss... Were you not a knight of Bern?

speaker: Zeiss
text: ...Of course I am!

speaker: Galle
text: Good! When we meet next time, neither of us will speak. We will fight!

speaker: Melady
text: Galle...

speaker: Galle
text: Melady...

speaker: Melady
text: Galle... I...

speaker: Galle
text: Don’t speak... You and I are both loyal knights. We both fight for whom we have pledged our loyalty to. That’s all.

speaker: Galle
text: Melady... This is probably the end, so let me say this. Melady, I am truly grateful that I was able to meet you. We trained our skills together, and we fought alongside each other. Melady... The days I spent with you... Those were the happiest days of my life.

speaker: Melady
text: Me... Mine, too...

speaker: Galle
text: ...Goodbye, Melady... I always wish we had met in a more peaceful time.

speaker: Melady
text: Galle...

speaker: Melady
text: Wait...! Galle! Don’t go! Gaaaaaaaaaale!

speaker: Galle
text: I have no regrets… Zeiss… Take care…of Melady…

speaker: Murdock
text: Hm...you made it this far. I congratulate you. But can you defeat me?

speaker: Murdock
text: Gah...! You...are strong... Zephiel... My king... I cannot protect you...any further... Forgive me...!

speaker: Murdock
text: So! You are General Roy! I have always been looking forward to matching blades with you!

speaker: Murdock
text: Melady... I don’t want to fight you, but you stand here before me. It seems we have no choice. Come!

speaker: Murdock
text: You were one of Narshen’s troops... I heard the story from Galle. I do feel sorry for you, but you are currently an enemy. Come! We fight!

speaker: Elffin
text: Master Roy... There is a path leading underground.

speaker: Roy
text: Does that mean that the Binding Blade is in there?

speaker: Elffin
text: I don’t know... But I heard from a captive that two things are hidden inside the temple.

speaker: Roy
text: ! Does that mean that there’s another Divine Weapon?

speaker: Elffin
text: Possibly... Perhaps we should ask those from our army who are natives of Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: All right. I’ll check with them.

speaker: Elffin
text: Master Roy. This sword stuck in the altar...

speaker: Roy
text: This must be the Binding Blade.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Let’s see... ...I can’t seem to draw it from the stone.

speaker: Roy
text: It’s sealed. You have to use the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Use it? How?

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere said that you just have to stick it into the opening in the handle...

speaker: Roy
text: Whoa! What the...

speaker: Merlinus
text: The blade is glowing!

speaker: Roy
text: Now I should be able to draw it... ...!

speaker: Roy
text: ...What...is this...? This is the Binding Blade’s... No, Hartmut’s... Memories...?

speaker: Roy
text: Who was that? What’s this feeling... It’s very...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy? Are you all right?

speaker: Roy
text: Yeah... I’m fine. So this is Hartmut’s sword, the Binding Blade... Am I allowed to use it...?

speaker: Elffin
text: It has been said for centuries that the best swords choose their owners. The sword is in your hands now. You were chosen by it.

speaker: Roy
text: But it’s only coincidence that I’m holding it...

speaker: Elffin
text: What we may think of as being coincidental... Even that might be part of our fate.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Anyway, now that we have the Binding Blade, all we need to do is head for the castle. We must hurry!

speaker: Roy
text: ...Right! We have to defeat Zephiel!

speaker: Roy
text: This is the Dragon Temple... The air is strange. Did the Eight Heroes fight under such pressure as well?

speaker: Jahn
text: You would stand before us again, humans?

speaker: Roy
text: What... Who are you! When did you...

speaker: Jahn
text: I am Jahn. I am the last remaining Dragon of the Dragon Temple.

speaker: Roy
text: The last Dragon? You seem...different from the other Dragons... Are you the Dark Dragon?

speaker: Jahn
text: The Dragons which you have been fighting are War Dragons who know nothing but battle. And the Dark Dragon is something completely different from me. I am a pure, full-blooded Dragon that fought you humans in the faraway past.

speaker: Roy
text: Different? Wasn’t the Dark Dragon supposed to be the leader of the Dragons?

speaker: Jahn
text: The Dark Dragon is an ‘object’ meant to bring hope to us Dragons again. It is no leader.

speaker: Roy
text: What? Then what is the Dark Dragon?

speaker: Jahn
text: It seems you have much to learn.

speaker: Roy
text: Tell us! What is the Dark Dragon? We...I have to fully understand my enemy before I fight!

speaker: Jahn
text: Well... I have no reason to tell you. And, yet, I have no reason not to tell you. What should I do?

speaker: Jahn
text: ...Very well. I shall test you to see if you are worthy of hearing the truth. I am deep inside the temple. Fend off our attacks and come to me. Then I shall explain everything.

speaker: Roy
text: But you’re right here!

speaker: Jahn
text: What you are seeing is just an illusion. If you wish to know the truth, then come to me. If you prove yourself worthy of my time, then you shall hear it all...

speaker: Roy
text: You... Are you real this time? Or...

speaker: Jahn
text: This is but the entrace. You have a long way yet to reach me. Still, you seem to be strong enough not to die immediately.

speaker: Roy
text: Of course. We’ve gone through many hardships.

speaker: Jahn
text: So I see. Very well, I shall tell you a little about the Dark Dragon. The Dark Dragon is not the leader of the Dragons as you thought. The Dark Dragon was created by us to bring us victory.

speaker: Roy
text: Created...? So it wasn’t the Dark Dragon that was making more Dragons...

speaker: Jahn
text: The Dragons you speak of are correctly referred to as War Dragons. As I said before, they are different from pure Dragons such as I. Indeed, the War Dragons are created by the Dark Dragon. And the Dark Dragon was created out of the Divine Dragon, the most powerful of our kind.

speaker: Roy
text: Created out of the Divine Dragon? Then the Dark Dragon is actually... The Divine Dragon agreed to become the Dark Dragon?

speaker: Jahn
text: Agreed? No. We destroyed its soul so that it would follow our leader’s every command.

speaker: Roy
text: What...!

speaker: Jahn
text: We desperately needed the power of the Divine Dragon. Our entire species was at stake.

speaker: Roy
text: You needed the power of the Divine Dragon... But...why did you have to destroy its soul!?

speaker: Jahn
text: Why, you ask. If you want that answer, then seek me out again. I shall witness more of your power...

speaker: Jahn
text: Not bad, not bad at all. I wonder how far you will come.

speaker: Roy
text: I want you to go on with your story.

speaker: Jahn
text: ...No matter how much we fought, you humans just seemed to multiply endlessly. Eventually, we began to lose because of the humans’ sheer numbers. Therefore, we created the Dark Dragon that would create War Dragons.

speaker: Roy
text: War Dragons... Dragons meant only for battle.

speaker: Jahn
text: That is correct. However, the Divine Dragons did not agree with us. They said that that would be defying the laws of nature. As we were discussing how we could persuade the Divine Dragons to help us, they suddenly disappeared.

speaker: Roy
text: Why?

speaker: Jahn
text: Most likely, they left us to prevent us from taking advantage of them. We were never able to find the Divine Dragons, but fortunately, we were able to capture one.

speaker: Roy
text: And that became the Dark Dragon?

speaker: Jahn
text: Yes. That Divine Dragon, Idunn, became the Dark Dragon. Apparently, she had hestitation in escaping with the rest of the Divine Dragons because she feared that we would go into conflict with each other. Hesitation...such nonsense is only for humans. We Dragons have no need for it.

speaker: Roy
text: Then that hesitation worked against her...

speaker: Jahn
text: When the Divine Dragons disappeared, she refused to go with them. That was when we were fortunate enough to find her. Idunn was still young, but she had no problems in fulfulling our purposes, except for one... Her heart was not with us. She would not follow our commands.

speaker: Roy
text: So you destroyed her heart...

speaker: Jahn
text: Exactly. We destroyed her soul to make her follow our every command.

speaker: Roy
text: That’s...terrible.

speaker: Jahn
text: That is enough for now. If you want to know more, then show me more of your power!

speaker: Jahn
text: You have taken another step forward. But the way is still long.

speaker: Roy
text: We shall reach you!

speaker: Jahn
text: You have a stout heart. What do you wish to hear next?

speaker: Roy
text: You succeeded in creating the Dark Dragon. The Dark Dragon produced War Dragons. Then why did you lose to the humans?

speaker: Jahn
text: Indeed, the Dark Dragon continued to produce War Dragons to use in the battlefield. We were able to turn the tables on the humans.

speaker: Jahn
text: However, the humans soon found out about the Dark Dragon. They concluded that their numbers alone would not be enough to defeat us. Therefore, they put their efforts into constructing powerful weapons that would pierce our scales. They are what you call the Divine Weapons.

speaker: Roy
text: That part is the same as our legends...

speaker: Jahn
text: The most powerful and potent were chosen out of the humans to wield their newly crafted weapons. They came and charged this temple. However, when the immense power of the weapons and our power clashed near Bern, something unexpected happened.

speaker: Roy
text: What happened?

speaker: Jahn
text: The laws of nature started to collapse. Snow began to fall in mid summer. Stars shone in the middle of day...

speaker: Roy
text: Is that the Ending Winter? I heard that that happened because you Dragons unleashed too much power into the world...

speaker: Jahn
text: Is that how your legends go?

speaker: Roy
text: The power in the Divine Weapons was then used to restore order to the world. That’s what our legends say.

speaker: Jahn
text: So, all the bad things that happened are our fault? I would have expected you humans to think like that. However, the truth is what I said.

speaker: Roy
text: Then... The Divine Weapons were sealed away so as to not let such a disaster happen again? Then all those traps that protected them were to warn us...

speaker: Jahn
text: You sealed them away? That was a good decision. But they seem to be in your hands right now.

speaker: Jahn
text: Do not worry. The weapons do not seem to have as much power as they did in the past. They are unable to bring about such a disaster again.

speaker: Jahn
text: The great disaster hurt us Dragons greatly.

speaker: Roy
text: How?

speaker: Jahn
text: The disaster was originally the reason that we lost to the humans. ..I shall continue when you advance a little further.

speaker: Jahn
text: You have come again. You are doing better than I expected.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Please continue the story.

speaker: Jahn
text: When the order of nature collapsed, we Dragons took a fatal blow. The forces of nature weakened, and it became difficult for us to retain our original Dragon form. Therefore, we decided to seal our powers in gemstones and take human form instead.

speaker: Roy
text: Those must be the Dragon Stones...

speaker: Jahn
text: Yes. We were rendered utterly powerless against the humans. We were just as weak, no, even weaker than the humans in their pathetic form. The humans took advantage of our handicap and started attacking the Dragons that had taken human form.

speaker: Roy
text: Why did you choose the human form?

speaker: Jahn
text: In the new order of nature, the human was the form that required the least amount of energy to transform into. The Eight Heroes mercilessly crushed us, helpless in our human form. I, too, suffered a deep wound.

speaker: Roy
text: Do you have hate for the humans who wounded you?

speaker: Jahn
text: Hate? Only humans have such ridiculous emotions. We battled to maintain our species, and we lost. That is all.

speaker: Jahn
text: This time, however, you humans might lose. Some human named Zephiel brought the Dark Dragon to life again.

speaker: Roy
text: ! Then Zephiel did break the Dark Dragon’s seal!

speaker: Jahn
text: That is correct. If you want to hear more, then show me your more of your worthiness.

speaker: Roy
text: Jahn! I know you’re there.

speaker: Jahn
text: Hm... It seems that you did indeed defeat Zephiel... You might make it far enough to be able to fight me.

speaker: Roy
text: What relation did the Dark Dragon have to Zephiel?

speaker: Jahn
text: You know that the founder of Bern is Hartmut, the leader of the Eight Heroes, do you not?

speaker: Roy
text: I know that.

speaker: Jahn
text: Then do you know that Hartmut didn’t kill the Dark Dragon, but only sealed it away?

speaker: Roy
text: I know. But I still don’t know why he did that.

speaker: Jahn
text: Hm...I see. The Eight Heroes eventually defeated our leader, and they made their way deep into the temple to find the Dark Dragon. However, when they arrived at the Dark Dragon’s chamber, all they saw was a human girl, looking off into space. It was Idunn.

speaker: Roy
text: They didn’t fight?

speaker: Jahn
text: The Dark Dragon had its soul destroyed to follow our leader’s commands. Since our leader had been killed, there were no further commands to follow.

speaker: Roy
text: Then what happened to the Dark Dragon?

speaker: Jahn
text: The Eight Heroes naturally hesitated. They had expected to see the most powerful Dragon, but all they saw was a girl who wouldn’t respond even if spoken to.

speaker: Jahn
text: But the Dark Dragon still had to be defeated, so the Eight Heroes prepared for battle. Idunn then must have reacted to their attacks. She changed into the Dark Dragon and fought back, just like the War Dragons who have no heart. Hartmut then used a blade even stronger than the Divine Weapons and slashed at the Dark Dragon’s scales.

speaker: Roy
text: The Binding Blade!

speaker: Jahn
text: I don’t know what you humans call it, but that must be it. Anyway, when that sword cut through the Dark Dragon’s flesh, it suddenly fell unconscious.

speaker: Roy
text: It didn’t die?

speaker: Jahn
text: Yes. Apparently, the sword reacted to its wielder’s feelings and changed its power accordingly.

speaker: Roy
text: So Hartmut didn’t want to kill it, so the Binding Blade reacted to his emotions and only knocked the Dark Dragon unconscious?

speaker: Jahn
text: I understand that Hartmut did know a little bit about the Dark Dragon. Then, after seeing it as the little girl, Idunn, he must have felt pity. It is another emotion that we Dragons cannot comprehend.

speaker: Roy
text: Pity...

speaker: Jahn
text: And thus, at the bottom of his heart, he didn’t want to kill her. In my opinion, I would never leave something that would be a danger to me alive.

speaker: Roy
text: So Hartmut’s feelings changed the sword’s strength...

speaker: Jahn
text: Hartmut persuaded his comrades and decided to seal the Dark Dragon. He built a temple deep in the forests of Bern and sealed Idunn away using the sword and a gemstone. They are what you call the Binding Blade and the Fire Emblem. He then created a nation near the temple that would watch over and protect the seal from being broken. That is Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: ...How do you know all this? Were you watching?

speaker: Jahn
text: No. I had been deeply wounded, so I was leading a hidden life healing myself. I heard the story about the seal from Zephiel. Although, he said that he had read about it in the ancient scrolls kept in the castle library.

speaker: Roy
text: How did you meet Zephiel?

speaker: Jahn
text: How did I meet him? Hm... If you reach me, I will tell you. It is not far now.

speaker: Jahn
text: You have come far. I am in the chamber right in front of you. It has been long since I last met humans in my true form. I have not left this place ever since the war.

speaker: Roy
text: You... You were always here?

speaker: Jahn
text: One thousand years... Having survived the Scouring, I waited, healing my wounds in the process. I waited for the resurrection of the Dark Dragon that would bring hope to us Dragons again. And that time finally came. The Dark Dragon’s seal was broken, and I felt power flowing in my veins again.

speaker: Roy
text: How does the Dark Dragon’s seal being broken make your strength recover?

speaker: Jahn
text: The Dragon Temple’s power depends on the Dark Dragon’s, and thus the Divine Dragons’, life force. If the Dark Dragon were to be sealed, then there is no way I could have recovered to full strength by using the temple’s power.

speaker: Roy
text: I see...

speaker: Jahn
text: After my strength fully recovered, I set out to look for the person who had broken the seal. I used my illusion to search him out and ask his intentions. I did not wish to go outside in my true form, knowing that you humans now ran the world.

speaker: Roy
text: Wait... I thought that Dragons in their human form lost most of their powers. Then how are you creating this illusion?

speaker: Jahn
text: This temple is for the Dragons. It is the only place that Dragons can use a little of their power even in human form. I am a fairly powerful Dragon. Even in human form, as long as I stay in here, creating an illusion is easy. Still, I am not able to create actual things like the Dark Dragon can.

speaker: Roy
text: So...you found Zephiel.

speaker: Jahn
text: Yes. I found Zephiel and asked him, ‘Why did you break the Dark Dragon’s seal?’ Zephiel was an odd man. He didn’t seem to be the least bit surprised. He looked me right back in the eye and asked who I was. After I told him that I was a Dragon, he started to smile mysteriously. He then said, ‘My intentions are to give the world to your kind.'

speaker: Jahn
text: I cannot say that I fully trusted him, but he was still the Dark Dragon’s new master, so I decided to work with him. Zephiel then ordered the Dark Dragon to lead the world in the place of foolish humans.

speaker: Roy
text: But Zephiel is dead. What is the Dark Dragon doing now?

speaker: Jahn
text: Although he is gone, the Idunn resides in the chamber behind me. She is waiting for the chance to free the world.

speaker: Roy
text: But her master is now gone! Are you her new master?

speaker: Jahn
text: I did not need to become her master. She was commanded to carry out Zephiel’s orders even if he were to die. Idunn has absolute obedience to her master. She will make sure that you humans are banished from this land.

speaker: Roy
text: What? Her soul was destroyed, and now she’s bound to orders given by a person long dead?

speaker: Jahn
text: Do you feel pity, like Hartmut did? ...You humans are truly difficult to understand. But let me tell you this. No matter how hard you try, humans and Dragons will never be able to live in harmony. The gap between our species is impossible to fill.

speaker: Roy
text: That’s not true! I know a place where Dragons and humans live together. Dragons and humans both were brought into the same world. They can, and will understand each other!

speaker: Jahn
text: Dragons and humans, living together in harmony? Rubbish... I have no intention of listening to such nonsense. Now, enter my domain. Let us see who has more power!

speaker: Jahn
text: One thousand years… My strength has long recovered. I can feel it…

speaker: Jahn
text: So, I have lost… Humans are truly unpredictable…

speaker: Roy
text: In the next chamber lies the Dark Dragon...

speaker: Roy
text: ? What’s wrong, Fa? You look like you’re about to burst into tears.

speaker: Fa
text: Is...is Fa also an enemy...?

speaker: Roy
text: Huh?

speaker: Fa
text: When... When Fa gets big, will Fa become a bad Dragon, too?

speaker: Roy
text: !? Wait, Fa. Tell me what you want to say, slowly.

speaker: Fa
text: That man said so... Dragons and people can’t live together...

speaker: Roy
text: But you were living in Nabata with people, weren’t you?

speaker: Fa
text: But the Dark Dragon is a Divine Dragon like Fa! And you’re going to fight the Dark Dragon, right? What about Fa? If Fa grows up and becomes like the Dark Dragon, then...

speaker: Roy
text: You don’t have to worry about that. Even if you grow up, you’ll always be Fa. You’ll always be together with humans, and with us.

speaker: Fa
text: ...Really?

speaker: Roy
text: Sure! And also, I actually want to help the Dark Dragon.

speaker: Fa
text: Help?

speaker: Roy
text: The Dark Dragon is not acting on her own will...she had her soul destroyed. I... I don’t want to kill her, if I can avoid it.

speaker: Fa
text: ...Fa doesn’t get it.

speaker: Roy
text: You’ll understand when you’re little older.

speaker: Roy
text: Hartmut posed a question. And I’ll give an answer to it!

speaker: Bandit
text: Boss! Our boys just got back from scouting the village.

speaker: Dory
text: Then let's go get our tribute.

speaker: Bandit
text: But Boss, something's different today. There's an army stationed real close to us! They say it looks like the Lycian Army.

speaker: Dory
text: Lycia? Then there's nothing to worry about. They were almost wiped out by Bern. We can handle a few battered soldiers.

speaker: Bandit
text: You're right, boss!

speaker: Boss
text: They've probably got some valuables on them too! Still, don't get careless. Ready then? Let's mop up these losers, boys!

speaker: Merlinus
text: A villager is here to see you, Lord Roy. Hey, you, wait just a second...

speaker: Villager
text: Are you Lord Roy of House Pherae?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. How may I help you?

speaker: Villager
text: Milord, I beg you! Please, rid us of the bandits terrorizing our village!

speaker: Roy
text: Bandits?

speaker: Villager
text: There's a group of bandits that made their base in the castle near the cliffs.

speaker: Roy
text: Where are the castle guards?

speaker: Villager
text: They fled once they heard that the Lycian Army was defeated by Bern... We villagers were left on our own. Our days are spent in fear of bandit attacks.

speaker: Villager
text: We have no one else we can ask. Please, help us!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy, we must keep our pace towards Ostia...

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, I know. But we can't simply ignore people in need of help!

speaker: Merlinus
text: You're joking!

speaker: Villager
text: You will help us?! Thank you! Please use the gate to the west. It'll take you right to the castle.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you.

speaker: Villager
text: I'll arrange for the gate to be opened when you give the signal.

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus! We're going to the castle to drive off the bandits!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Sigh... Youthful energy. Where does it come from?

speaker: Yoder
text: Thank you, Dorothy. Please tell Brother Saul as well.

speaker: Dorothy
text: I will, Father Yoder.

speaker: Dorothy
text: But where did Saul run off to now? How am I supposed to guard him if he keeps disappearing?

speaker: Girl
text: Er... Brother Saul, I appreciate the offer, but not tonight...

speaker: Saul
text: Come now, don't be like that. We can sit by the fire in the dark of night as I soothe you with my calming sermons...

speaker: Dorothy
text: There you are! Saul!

speaker: Saul
text: Wonderful. Dorothy...

speaker: Girl
text: I'll take my leave now.

speaker: Saul
text: No, don't go! Oh my... Look what you've done now, Dorothy. That expression on your face scared her away.

speaker: Dorothy
text: This is my normal look! Saul, you can't try to woo every girl you meet.

speaker: Saul
text: You make it sound like a bad thing! I simply offer my helping hand to any poor souls in need.

speaker: Dorothy
text: Then why do you always offer to give your sermons at night?

speaker: Saul
text: ...Well, putting that aside... Did you have some good reason for interrupting my good work?

speaker: Dorothy
text: Oh, right. The Lycian Army is apparently somewhere around here.

speaker: Saul
text: Truly?! Is Princess Guinivere still with them?

speaker: Dorothy
text: Yes, if the reports from the St. Elimine Church are accurate.

speaker: Saul
text: Then we must make haste! Let us join them.

speaker: Saul
text: What's the matter, Dorothy?

speaker: Dorothy
text: You only want to join them because Princess Guinivere is said to be so beautiful.

speaker: Saul
text: Don't be ridiculous... Come now, hurry along.

speaker: Dorothy
text: Yes, let's go!

speaker: Village
text: Hold on. Before you go, take this lance with you. It was once wielded by a knight called Sir Gant. The stories say he bested many a foe with this lance!

speaker: House
text: If you can, try to occupy forts. That'll stop enemy reinforcements from showing up!

speaker: House
text: I was there when Araphen was taken... The wyvern riders of Bern were terrifying enough... But then a dragon engulfed the Lycian Army in flame... Oh Elimine, please tell me it was a dream...

speaker: House
text: This whole area is really perfect for bandits. It's no wonder they appeared. They can cross mountains and a bandit on a peak is a force to be reckoned with. Dreadful. Just dreadful...

speaker: Dory
text: No one's ever survived a blow from my axe! Hey, you. Wanna see why?

speaker: Dory
text: Gah...! No...I don't wanna...die...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy! A priest from the St. Elimine Church wants an audience with you...and Princess Guinivere!

speaker: Roy
text: He knew that Princess Guinivere was with us?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. I can't imagine how.

speaker: Roy
text: Me neither... I'll see him alone.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy, I will be fine. I wish to meet this priest.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Tensions between my brother and the church have worsened as of late. I do not believe they would attempt anything underhanded.

speaker: Roy
text: I see. Merlinus, allow this priest in.

speaker: Saul
text: Lord Roy, it is a pleasure to meet you at last. I am Saul, an acolyte of the St. Elimine Church.

speaker: Roy
text: Pleased to meet you.

speaker: Saul
text: Oh... And you must be Princess Guinivere! You are as beautiful as the rumors say!

speaker: Guinevere
text: Pardon me...?

speaker: Saul
text: Ahem... Forgive me. Your Highness, I wish to know the location of the Fire Emblem. You have it with you, do you not?

speaker: Guinevere
text: How did you know that?!

speaker: Saul
text: Bern's head church tells us the Fire Emblem disappeared from the Shrine of Seals. And you also went missing at exactly the same time.

speaker: Saul
text: I was sent by the Church to confirm the truth. Why did you take the Fire Emblem?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I wished to stop my brother.

speaker: Saul
text: Your brother... Zephiel, the king of Bern.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes.

speaker: Saul
text: Do you know what the Fire Emblem is used for?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...It's the key that awakens a sword that was used to slay the dragons long ago. That was what my father told me anyway. I am unsure how exactly the Fire Emblem or the sword work. My brother seemed to worry abut the Fire Emblem falling into enemy hands. ...Extraordinarily so.

speaker: Saul
text: So you took the Fire Emblem to make the king believe it fell into enemy hands? All in an attempt to stop his conquest?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes...but the war continued anyway.

speaker: Saul
text: And what will you do now?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Must I reveal my plan at this moment?

speaker: Saul
text: Ah, so Your Highness has a plan.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes. I have not given up hope of settling this war without further bloodshed.

speaker: Saul
text: I see. In that case, I will accompany you on your journey.

speaker: Guinevere
text: If Roy allows it.

speaker: Roy
text: I have no objections.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Thank you, Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: Of course, Princess.

speaker: Soldier
text: The Etrurian Army is here!

speaker: Thoril
text: They won’t stop until they make everything theirs... We will not let that happen. Tell our brothers that we will defend this land to the death. We will avenge our dead comrades!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes!

speaker: Roy
text: The Divine Weapon lies here... Sin, do you know about this place?

speaker: Sin
text: All I know is that the Divine Warrior Hanon’s bow, the Miurgre, or the Bow of the Winds, is kept here.

speaker: Roy
text: Hanon... She and Saint Elimine were the only two women among the Eight Heroes.

speaker: Sin
text: So it seems. ...Watch your back. The Djute will give us everything they’ve got to avenge their clansmen.

speaker: Roy
text: All right, we have to be careful. Let’s go!

speaker: Soldier
text: It’s here! The bow is hidden in the altar!

speaker: Roy
text: This is the Miurgre... It looks like an ordinary bow, but it must have incredible power.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, Bern’s troops are retreating.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh. All right.

speaker: Merlinus
text: All right? We must give chase.

speaker: Roy
text: No, don’t. They’re fleeing. They don’t have any more will to fight.

speaker: Merlinus
text: But...

speaker: Roy
text: They have families as well. There’s no need to fight more than necessary.

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus, I need you to send this letter to Bishop Yoder in Etruria.

speaker: Merlinus
text: A letter? May I ask what it says?

speaker: Roy
text: It’s the story we heard from Niime about the Dragons.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh? What did you discuss with her about the Dragons?

speaker: Roy
text: It’ll be long if I tell you. I haven’t sealed the letter yet, so you can look through it if you want.

speaker: Merlinus
text: All right. Let me see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess, is something wrong?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...We enter Bern now.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. We will attack Bern very soon. So...may I ask the rest of the story now...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Yes. That is why I came to you.

speaker: Roy
text: King Zephiel was an outstanding pupil is his studies, he was skilled in warcraft... He grew to be the perfect heir for the king.

speaker: Guinevere
text: That is correct.

speaker: Roy
text: But still, the former king did not look kindly at him.

speaker: Guinevere
text: In fact... Our father began to hate Zephiel because he grew to become such a brilliant and worthy youth.

speaker: Roy
text: What...is that supposed to mean...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Our father was a man of ordinary skill and intellect. Therefore, Zephiel’s outstanding skill made our father cold towards him.

speaker: Roy
text: Jealousy...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: And then one day, our father told Zephiel that ‘the next heir to Bern would be Guinevere’s husband.'

speaker: Roy
text: What! That’s awful!

speaker: Guinevere
text: But Zephiel was very patient. He said that he did not mind even if he could not gain the throne. But the people around us, who were looking forward to Zephiel’s ability to be a good king, would not allow anyone else to be the heir. Pressured by the public, our father lost his patience at last, and...

speaker: Roy
text: Decided to kill King Zephiel...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: At a banquet, our father gave Zephiel a poisoned drink from his own hands. And that was the first and last cup that Zephiel took from our father. After returning to his room, Zephiel started to get sick. For ten days and nights, Zephiel lingered between life and death. But Murdock, Zephiel’s teacher and loyal general, saved his life.

speaker: Roy
text: ...The former king never did anything after that?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... But I have heard that he had plans to get rid of Murdock and Zephiel’s mother as traitors. He was scheming to murder them all along with Zephiel. After hearing that, Zephiel made believe that he was dead. Our father then checked the coffin to confirm Zephiel’s death. At that moment, Zephiel rose up from the coffin and...with his sword...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I was but a child then, so naturally I could not have understood what was going on. All I knew is that after our father died, Zephiel never smiled again. Until then, he was strict at times, but he was always a kind and loving brother to me. So...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess...

speaker: Guinevere
text: So I... At the bottom of my heart, I trust that Zephiel can change, that he can become that loving brother again. I...had to take action.

speaker: Roy
text: I...see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...But now, my brother is in a place where my words cannot reach him. Roy, please... Please stop him. Please stop him from inflicting pain and suffering to the people of Bern...and the rest of Elibe.

speaker: Roy
text: Even if it may resolve to the blade?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I have made my resolve when I entrusted this task to you.

speaker: Roy
text: I see. You have my word and loyalty, Princess Guinevere. I swear to the Fire Emblem that I will stop King Zephiel!

speaker: Soldier
text: The Etrurian Army has appeared from the west.

speaker: Monke
text: Good. Lure them into our territory as planned. We shall show them our strength. Have the other clans been notified?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes. Although there are many clans who are expressing their discontent toward our alliance with Bern, further invasion by Etrurian forces seems to require more attention.

speaker: Monke
text: I see. ...The Etrurian army should be easier to deal with than the Silver Wolf, since the Etrurian Army is a invasion force.

speaker: Soldier
text: The clans will unite to fight against invaders...

speaker: Monke
text: Right. That is the law of Sacae. When we were up against the Silver Wolf, no one aided us because they saw it as conflict between clans.

speaker: Soldier
text: But now that we have Bern behind us, we don’t need their help.

speaker: Monke
text: Exactly. Of course, there are many who don’t like the idea that it is Bern who has actual control of Sacae’s politics.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes. I hear that there are many clans who agree with the Silver Wolf and joined forces with him.

speaker: Monke
text: He is too stubborn. His clan was defeated, so he should join us. It is not as if he doesn’t know what happens to those who try and fight a head-on battle with Bern.

speaker: Soldier
text: Even large cities like Bulgar have been attacked and taken over by Bern since they resisted.

speaker: Monke
text: From now on, those who are strong enough to manipulate the situation around them will survive, like us. And right now, we must take advantage of the law of Sacae to do so.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere... We are getting closer to Bern.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Yes.

speaker: Roy
text: Since we are getting closer, we are claSing with soldiers from Bern more and more often. It will not be long before we engage in full combat with Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: I wish to ask you something before we do.

speaker: Guinevere
text: What is that?

speaker: Roy
text: I have been hearing rumors...that King Zephiel rose to the throne because he murdered the former king.

speaker: Roy
text: I couldn’t believe it. You tried to stop him even by casting away your nationality. If King Zephiel is such a mad individual as the rumors say, then why did you try so hard to find a peaceful way to end the war?

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, I accepted the Fire Emblem not to use it in battle, but to try and find a use for it to end this war peacefully.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: Therefore, please tell me the truth about the rumors...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I...I’m sorry. Please...give me some time.

speaker: Monke
text: Yes... That’s right! Closer...closer... Right into our trap!

speaker: Monke
text: Argh...! How could you defeat us... My calculations...were...flawless...

speaker: Monke
text: You are the Silver Wolf’s granddaughter...

speaker: Monke
text: ...A survivor of the Kutolah clan?

speaker: Sin
text: Monke! Feel the Kutolah’s wrath!

speaker: Merlinus
text: That was no easy feat.

speaker: Roy
text: But now we have given a telling blow to our strongest enemy in Sacae. Although I’m sure that there are remaining forces somewhere...

speaker: Merlinus
text: They must be meeting to plan a retaliation.

speaker: Roy
text: Can we find out where they are meeting?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Well, I sent out a spy earlier, so he should be returning soon. I shall go check.

speaker: Roy
text: Is something wrong, Princess Guinevere?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I have come to speak about my brother.

speaker: Roy
text: ! ...Are you sure?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes... I want you to know before we enter Bern...about the tragedies that have occurred. You asked earlier if my brother murdered the former king.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes...

speaker: Guinevere
text: In short...it is true.

speaker: Roy
text: ! Then King Zephiel indeed killed his own father to seize the throne...

speaker: Guinevere
text: No!

speaker: Roy
text: No? He didn’t kill his father to get the throne?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... Our father was the one who tried to kill Zephiel first.

speaker: Roy
text: What!? Then King Zephiel...

speaker: Guinevere
text: He...couldn’t bear the abuse he was taking from our father. And so he...

speaker: Roy
text: What... Why did...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! We have found where the enemy is meeting! ...? What is the matter?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No...it is nothing. Perhaps later...

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...Did I appear at a bad time?

speaker: Roy
text: No, it’s okay. Where is the meeting place?

speaker: Merlinus
text: It is in a city called Bulgar.

speaker: Roy
text: Bulgar...I’ve heard of it.

speaker: Merlinus
text: It is the largest city in Sacae. Of course, it is now under Bern’s control.

speaker: Roy
text: I see... All right, we’ll be heading there soon.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Why did the former king try to murder his own son...?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Teck! The enemy is advancing!

speaker: Teck
text: There is no need to panic. These ruins are surrounded by thick walls. They won’t be able to come in so easily.

speaker: Soldier
text: But the enemy has defeated the Ilian troops and our troops one after another! We do not have a high chance of winning...!

speaker: Teck
text: We do not have to win. Lord Murdock said that all we must do is defend this place. We must hold out until the enemy gives up and leaves.

speaker: Roy
text: The Divine Weapon lies in here... Elffin, have you heard about this place?

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes. I believe that the Malte, the Frozen Spear, in hidden in these ruins.

speaker: Roy
text: Frozen Spear...

speaker: Elffin
text: Barigan the Faithful used it during the Scouring.

speaker: Roy
text: Barigan? All knights know about him. I used to hear a lot about him during my studies. He is the finest example of knighthood. ...This building seems to have walls everywhere. Is there a path leading inside?

speaker: Elffin
text: Probably the remaining forces of Bern buried the pathways to defend themselves.

speaker: Roy
text: Then they must not have had much time to do it... Maybe the walls are weak in certain places.

speaker: Elffin
text: That is possible.

speaker: Roy
text: All right. Let’s do what we can.

speaker: Teck
text: No… I must be dreaming. How did you come through those walls?

speaker: Teck
text: Pass, strong ones… And know Bern’s true power…

speaker: Soldier
text: It’s here! The spear is here!

speaker: Roy
text: ... This is Barigan’s spear, Malte... It’s beautiful, as if it’s made of crystal and ice.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, Bern’s troops are escaping.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh. All right.

speaker: Merlinus
text: All right? We must give chase.

speaker: Roy
text: No, don’t. They’re fleeing. They don’t have any more will to fight.

speaker: Merlinus
text: But...

speaker: Roy
text: They have families as well. There’s no need to fight more than necessary.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, we will attack Bern now. So may I ask...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...The rest of the story.

speaker: Roy
text: King Zephiel was an outstanding pupil is his studies, he was skilled in warcraft... He grew to be the perfect heir for the king.

speaker: Guinevere
text: That is correct.

speaker: Roy
text: But still, the former king did not look kindly at him.

speaker: Guinevere
text: In fact... Our father began to hate Zephiel because he grew to become such a brilliant and worthy youth.

speaker: Roy
text: What...is that supposed to mean...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Our father was a man of ordinary skill and intellect. Therefore, Zephiel’s outstanding skill made our father cold towards him.

speaker: Roy
text: Jealousy...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: And then one day, our father told Zephiel that ‘the next heir to Bern would be Guinevere’s husband.'

speaker: Roy
text: What! That’s awful!

speaker: Guinevere
text: But Zephiel was very patient. He said that he did not mind even if he could not gain the throne. But the people around us, who were looking forward to Zephiel’s ability to be a good king, would not allow anyone else to be the heir. Pressured by the public, our father lost his patience at last, and...

speaker: Roy
text: Decided to kill King Zephiel...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: At a banquet, our father gave Zephiel a poisoned drink from his own hands. And that was the first and last cup that Zephiel took from our father. After returning to his room, Zephiel started to get sick. For ten days and nights, Zephiel lingered between life and death. But Murdock, Zephiel’s teacher and loyal general, saved his life.

speaker: Roy
text: ...The former king never did anything after that?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... But I have heard that he had plans to get rid of Murdock and Zephiel’s mother as traitors. He was scheming to murder them all along with Zephiel. After hearing that, Zephiel made believe that he was dead. Our father then checked the coffin to confirm Zephiel’s death. At that moment, Zephiel rose up from the coffin and...with his sword...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I was but a child then, so naturally I could not have understood what was going on. All I knew is that after our father died, Zephiel never smiled again. Until then, he was strict at times, but he was always a kind and loving brother to me. So...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess...

speaker: Guinevere
text: So I... At the bottom of my heart, I trust that Zephiel can change, that he can become that loving brother again. I...had to take action.

speaker: Roy
text: I...see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...But now, my brother is in a place where my words cannot reach him. Roy, please... Please stop him. Please stop him from inflicting pain and suffering to the people of Bern...and the rest of Elibe.

speaker: Roy
text: Even if it may resolve to the blade?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I have made my resolve when I entrusted this task to you.

speaker: Roy
text: I see. You have my word and loyalty, Princess Guinevere. I swear to the Fire Emblem that I will stop King Zephiel!

speaker: Zephiel
text: So... Murdock was defeated...

speaker: Brunnya
text: ...I am sorry.

speaker: Zephiel
text: ...How is the Etrurian Army behaving?

speaker: Brunnya
text: They have captured the Temple of Seals. They are currently headed this way.

speaker: Zephiel
text: I see... Then we shall face them inside this castle.

speaker: Brunnya
text: Yes. I will protect you to the death, your Majesty.

speaker: Zephiel
text: No. Brunnya, I have a very important task for you.

speaker: Brunnya
text: What...?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Idunn. Where is Idunn?

speaker: Idunn
text: ...Here, your Majesty.

speaker: Zephiel
text: I will stay here and defend the castle from the Etrurian Army. Idunn, you must escape and hide until this battle is over.

speaker: Idunn
text: If his Majesty wishes.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Brunnya, I want you to escape as well. Protect Idunn.

speaker: Brunnya
text: What!? Please! Let me fight by your side!

speaker: Zephiel
text: No. ...This will be a harsh battle. I cannot afford to lose Idunn now. If Idunn were lost...this whole war would be meaningless.

speaker: Brunnya
text: But! I, I...!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Enough, Brunnya! This is an order. Are you telling me that you cannot follow your king’s commands?

speaker: Brunnya
text: No... I’m not saying that...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Idunn, even if I fall... I trust you understand.

speaker: Idunn
text: Yes... I will free the world, as you commanded.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Right. I will not give up my dream now.

speaker: Idunn
text: Yes.

speaker: Hero
text: The Etrurian Army has come... I will not let you invade the throne room!

speaker: Hero
text: I shall protect this device with my life!

speaker: Roy
text: This is the king’s castle...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, Zephiel is residing in the throne room at the center of the castle. However, there seem to be some special devices that protect the throne room when invaders appear.

speaker: Roy
text: What kind of devices?

speaker: Merlinus
text: One of the captives said that at the west end of the castle, there are switches that need to pulled before one can access the throne room.

speaker: Roy
text: It’ll be a long detour...

speaker: Merlinus
text: There is more. After hitting the switches, you must hold the ‘Gem’ in front of the throne room door to make it open.

speaker: Roy
text: Gem? Is it the Fire Emblem?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Most likely.

speaker: Roy
text: I have that with me. So I should head to the throne room while leaving the switches to the others...

speaker: Merlinus
text: That would be the shortest way.

speaker: Roy
text: ...But would the captives leak that kind of information so easily? Perhaps it’s a trap...

speaker: Merlinus
text: I doubt it, Master Roy. The captive also said, ‘The switches and the door are all defended by Bern’s most powerful warriors. You wouldn’t be able to get to the throne room even if you knew how.'

speaker: Roy
text: We need to try, even if we’re going up against powerful enemies. We’ve gotten strong as well. We won’t lose!

speaker: Zephiel
text: So, you have come. Hmph...how ironic. A child, stepping in my path.

speaker: Roy
text: Zephiel...King of Bern... I will ask you this. Why did you start this war?

speaker: Zephiel
text: ...I wish to end the age of men.

speaker: Roy
text: ...What?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Humans... Humans are filthy. They flock to those with power and would not think twice about betraying trusted allies to obtain more power. You must have witnessed numerous traitors in your travels. Am I right?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Jealousy. Hate. Greed. Friends, even family members are driven to kill by such ludicrous emotions. Such emotions create fathers who try to kill their own sons to save their own flesh. As long as humans control, as long as humans dictate, as long as humans exist...this madness will never end.

speaker: Roy
text: But look at what you are doing! You are one of those humans who control others!

speaker: Zephiel
text: ...You know how the Scouring ended.

speaker: Roy
text: The Dark Dragon was defeated by Hartmut...

speaker: Zephiel
text: That was the mistake.

speaker: Roy
text: Mistake?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Mankind should not have won. Just because the humans came out victorious, this world came under their control, and transformed into a world of madness and evil, driven by accursed emotions!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Mistakes must be fixed with haste. I will give the world back to the Dragons. I will free the world from the evil grasp of men. History must be redone from the beginning to save this world from everlasting evil!

speaker: Roy
text: Then...it is true that you resurrected the Dark Dragon.

speaker: Zephiel
text: You may see that for yourself.

speaker: Roy
text: You said you would give the world to the Dragons. Then rule by humans would just be replaced by similar rule by Dragons!

speaker: Zephiel
text: The Dragons you see now are weapons for battle. They have no ‘self.’ They have no cruel emotions to be driven by, unlike foolish humans. The world under the Dragons’ control would be fair and peaceful.

speaker: Roy
text: I cannot agree that such a world would be for the better good! It is true that humans have many evil emotions and do terrible things, but it has always been us humans who have corrected such wrongdoings!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Hmph...you are indeed naive.

speaker: Roy
text: I have faith in mankind. I will not lose to a man who has lost faith in his people and even in himself!

speaker: Zephiel
text: You shall not bar my path!

speaker: Zephiel
text: …So, you have defeated me… But remember… My dream shall never die… As long as…humans retain control…madness will persist…

speaker: Guinevere
text: Zephiel...

speaker: Roy
text: ...Princess Guinevere.

speaker: Guinevere
text: I’m sorry... Please leave me alone for a while...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess...!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy... We should let her be.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Allow me.

speaker: Roy
text: Elffin!

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes?

speaker: Roy
text: ...Thank you. I knew you had your own problems with your own nation... But you helped us. I must thank you...

speaker: Elffin
text: ...I don’t quite understand what you mean...but if I have been helpful, then you are most welcome.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Control over humans by humans...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Zephiel’s words? Perhaps he was right...in a way.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Has the Dark Priestess been found?

speaker: Merlinus
text: No... Apparently she disappeared before the battle.

speaker: Roy
text: I see... Do you think she’s really the Dark Dragon?

speaker: Merlinus
text: I wouldn’t know unless I actually saw her. It’s going to be difficult to find her because she is said to clad in a black robe, and no one has ever seen her up close.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh... But the battle is now over.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What are you saying, Master Roy! The hard part has yet to come. We must help the land recover from the war. There are people out there who need our assistance.

speaker: Roy
text: Right! We have work to do. The real battle may be just beginning.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. We are alive, so we must think about the future.

speaker: Roy
text: No matter what hardships are to come, I will never give up. We have to show that even humans can construct a beautiful and peaceful world!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, you will have me at your side, always. Now, let us leave the castle for now. We must spread the word of victory!

speaker: Roy
text: The king of Bern is finished...

speaker: Merlinus
text: We’ve done it, Master Roy.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Perhaps it is a bit early to rejoice.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?

speaker: Roy
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Elffin
text: We still haven’t found the Dark Priestess yet.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hm, perchance she escaped?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Wh-What is happening!?

speaker: Roy
text: Zephiel’s sword just flashed! What was its name...

speaker: Elffin
text: Exaccus... A sword that can only be used by the heirs to Bern’s throne...

speaker: Merlinus
text: W-Wait! One of the legends of the Scouring said... When all of the Divine Weapons meet in one place, thus appears the Dragon Temple...

speaker: Roy
text: Dragon Temple...

speaker: Merlinus
text: It was the Dragons’ headquarters during the Scouring, I believe.

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes, that is what the legends say.

speaker: Roy
text: Then the Exaccus was the last Divine Weapon? I thought Hartmut’s sword was the Binding Blade.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...The Binding Blade may be different. Perhaps it is even more powerful than the Divine Weapons...

speaker: Roy
text: More powerful...? What kind of power does this blade possess...?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! The sword is glowing again! Look, a beam of light is pointing to the south!

speaker: Roy
text: Does this mean that the Dragon Temple is located where this light is pointing?

speaker: Merlinus
text: If the legends are true, then I would assume that as well.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...If the Dark Priestess is indeed the Dark Dragon... There is a high chance that she is there.

speaker: Roy
text: All right! Let’s go to the Dragon Temple!

speaker: Arcard
text: S-S... Sir Flaer!

speaker: Flaer
text: Lord Arcard. Why do you fret so?

speaker: Arcard
text: It's the Lycian Army! They come for my blood!

speaker: Flaer
text: Yes, they have been a thorn in Bern's side for some time... We knew it would be difficult if they became too friendly with Etruria. That's why we had you send them here. It seems, however, they fight even better than expected.

speaker: Arcard
text: You don't understand the gravity of this situation! Do you realize how much I've lost thanks to their meddling? All the riches I've gotten from these islands are gone! ...And on top of that, now they want my life! Once they arrive, my legacy is finished! My hands are shaking. I don't know what to do...

speaker: Flaer
text: My, how you worry. I suggest you flee to Etruria.

speaker: Arcard
text: You will allow it?

speaker: Flaer
text: Warfare is Bern's strong suit. We also have our secret weapon ready to brandish. With it we shall erase the Lycian Army once and for all.

speaker: Arcard
text: But...

speaker: Flaer
text: Lord Arcard. Once Bern and Etruria join forces, we will have nobody to fear. Am I wrong?

speaker: Arcard
text: No... No! You're right. I leave them to you.

speaker: Flaer
text: Hmph, cowardly Etrurian nobles. If we defeat the Lycian Army here, the Isles shall be ours...

speaker: Roy
text: This is the capital... Once we take it, we can finally go home.

speaker: Elffin
text: I have already sent someone in to unlock the gate... Oh, there she is.

speaker: Roy
text: The one over there dressed like a dancer?

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes, that's her.

speaker: Larum
text: Your Majesty! Over here!

speaker: Roy
text: Your Majesty?

speaker: Elffin
text: ...I know not of what she speaks.

speaker: Larum
text: Your Majesty! You're late.

speaker: Elffin
text: Larum, why do you call me "Your Majesty"?

speaker: Larum
text: Huh? …Oh! Ah... er… Well, you know, you look like royalty, so it's your nickname!

speaker: Elffin
text: My apologies, Lord Roy. This is Larum, a member of the resistance.

speaker: Larum
text: You're Roy? Everyone on the Isles has heard of you! They all call you the Savior from the East. Nice to meet you! I'm Larum.

speaker: Roy
text: Whoa! Please leave a little distance!

speaker: Larum
text: Roy, your face is all red. How cute!!

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Larum...

speaker: Larum
text: Oh! R-right... There's something I should tell you. I've been hearing strange rumors. The people here say that an "unhuman" resides in this castle.

speaker: Roy
text: An "unhuman"...?

speaker: Larum
text: Oh, yes. They say he changes form into something that looks like a dragon!

speaker: Roy
text: A human? That can change into a dragon?!

speaker: Larum
text: I don't know... but that's what I hear.

speaker: Elffin
text: We must proceed with caution.

speaker: Flaer
text: Ah, there you are, Ain.

speaker: Ain
text: You called...?

speaker: Flaer
text: I will make a report about the Lycian Army to General Narcian. I want you to defend the castle while I am away.

speaker: Ain
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Flaer
text: Hm? Who's there?! …… Just the wind...? Ahem. I will take my leave now. I leave them to your discretion.

speaker: Ain
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Flaer
text: Ha ha… The Lycian Army will hardly be able to stand against this dragon. Normal weapons won't even scratch it's skin. These manaketes… They certainly are terrifying beasts.

speaker: Raigh
text: So that's what the "unhuman" is. Bern really has brought dragons into this world. ...What to do now...? I guess I'll pose as a soldier and observe the dragon's power.

speaker: Cath
text: La la la la la, la la la la la… All the way out here in the Isles West, folks work to death for nobles in their nest! This castle's sure to be brimming with treasure! All this loot was stolen anyway. Might as well take it off these nobles' hands.

speaker: Soldier
text: The reinforcements from the south will arrive shortly!

speaker: Soldier
text: ...Th-that's all, sir.

speaker: Soldier
text: That guy gives me the chills...

speaker: Soldier 1
text: Did you handle the cave on the outskirts of town?

speaker: Soldier 2
text: Yes, sir. The bandits have blocked off all entrance to it. No one will be able to get to the legendary weapon now.

speaker: Soldier 1
text: Excellent! Now all we have to do is clean up the Lycian Army.

speaker: Roy
text: That was not an easy battle... The dragons' power is truly... Horrific.

speaker: Elffin
text: An unhuman... Now I understand.

speaker: Roy
text: How many of these dragons does Bern have...? How can we be expected to be victorious against monsters like these?!

speaker: Elffin
text: Lord Roy! Keep a level head.

speaker: Roy
text: Ah...

speaker: Elffin
text: ...I understand your worries. But if you panic, that feeling will spread to the army. You must remember that.

speaker: Roy
text: ...I'm sorry.

speaker: Elffin
text: It is a perfectly understandable reaction after a fight like that. But... we also gained knowledge that we did not have before.

speaker: Roy
text: What knowledge is that?

speaker: Elffin
text: Don't you remember? I told you Arcard was rumored to be working with Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, that's right! If Bern's dragons are in an Etrurian castle...

speaker: Elffin
text: Arcard has indeed made a deal with Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: ...That means Lycia is in danger... We must return to the mainland. We have to contact General Cecilia and conceive a plan...

speaker: Elffin
text: Lord Roy, before returning to the mainland, there is a matter to take care of.

speaker: Roy
text: More bandits?

speaker: Elffin
text: No, thankfully. A legendary weapon is hidden in a cave not far from here. If we obtain it, we can fight the dragons more effectively.

speaker: Roy
text: A legendary weapon... You're right! If we can get all eight of them, we might have a chance of defeating Bern!

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes... We must find as many as we can.

speaker: Roy
text: Then let's go to the cave and get it!

speaker: Soldier
text: R-report! I have a message from Etruria... A revolution has broken out in Aquleia, the capital of Etruria.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?!

speaker: Soldier
text: The ones leading the revolution are High Chancellor Roartz and Lord Arcard. They have captured King Mordred. They also say they plan to divided dominion of the continent between Bern and Etruria!

speaker: Merlinus
text: The two strongest nations in Elibe joining forces...

speaker: Roy
text: Is General Cecilia all right?! And what of Princess Guinivere...

speaker: Soldier
text: We don't have any current information... But the three Etrurian Generals have parted ways and are working separately. Mage General Cecilia has fled Aquleia for the Missur Peninsula in the southwest.

speaker: Roy
text: And the other Generals?

speaker: Soldier
text: They're with the revolutionaries against their will because the king was taken hostage.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: We need to contact General Cecilia... Princess Guinivere… Please be safe...

speaker: Roy
text: Oh! You!

speaker: Cath
text: Hm? ...You again? You always come and mess up my plans. Do you have it out for me or something?

speaker: Roy
text: No! I just... wanted to apologize.

speaker: Cath
text: ...Excuse me?

speaker: Roy
text: The last time we met, I was pretty callous. I said you shouldn't steal, but I didn't even realize what you'd been through...

speaker: Cath
text: Oh that? Whatever. I don't care.

speaker: Roy
text: But I still think what you do is wrong.

speaker: Cath
text: You've got some nerve, you know that?

speaker: Roy
text: Just give me a chance.

speaker: Cath
text: A chance?

speaker: Roy
text: Once this war is over, I promise to help rebuild your village. I'll be sure the taxes are put to good use too. Just please, stop looting.

speaker: Cath
text: …… How long will that be?

speaker: Roy
text: Whenever this war ends. I can't say when...

speaker: Cath
text: And you expect me to wait patiently until then?

speaker: Roy
text: No. All I want is your faith.

speaker: Cath
text: ...Why are you so kind to me? I'm just a thief.

speaker: Roy
text: Without you, we wouldn't have escaped Wagner's trap. Maybe you didn't care about helping us, but the fact is that you did. You saved our lives. You're more than just a thief.

speaker: Cath
text: If things keep going like they have... I guess you'll get in my way no matter where I go.

speaker: Roy
text: As long as you appear in our path.

speaker: Cath
text: Fine, you win. I'll stop looting battlefields.

speaker: Roy
text: You will? Thank you.

speaker: Cath
text: But I'm coming with you.

speaker: Roy
text: What? Why?

speaker: Cath
text: Actions speak louder than words. Prove to me that you'll be true to your promise.

speaker: Roy
text: I won't disappoint you!

speaker: Lugh
text: Raigh? Raigh! It's so good to see you!

speaker: Raigh
text: Lugh...! What are you doing here?

speaker: Lugh
text: I'm glad you're OK. We were all worried about you. I know you wanted to train your magic skills, but you left so suddenly.

speaker: Raigh
text: I couldn't have learned magic if I'd stayed at that orphanage. It was a miracle I picked up as much as I did.

speaker: Lugh
text: Raigh… The orphanage is gone.

speaker: Raigh
text: What? What happened?

speaker: Lugh
text: Bern came... and burned it down.

speaker: Raigh
text: ...What happened to everybody?

speaker: Lugh
text: Poppa was killed trying to protect us... The young children are under the care of the St. Elimine Church now.

speaker: Raigh
text: ...I see. It's for the best... They'll be happier at the church than at that dilapidated orphanage.

speaker: Lugh
text: You don't have to be so callous about it.

speaker: Lugh
text: Raigh! Come with us. We'll defeat Bern, and then we can go back to the children!

speaker: Raigh
text: Sorry, not interested.

speaker: Lugh
text: But--

speaker: Raigh
text: Then again... the Lycian Army might be good company. They're sure to come across more dragons at some point. All right, you got me. I suppose I'll go with you.

speaker: Lugh
text: Raigh...

speaker: Raigh
text: I just want you to know one thing. I'm not joining to avenge Poppa or the orphanage!

speaker: Lugh
text: I know, Raigh.

speaker: Raigh
text: Then stop looking at me like that!

speaker: Chad
text: Raigh! What are you doing here?

speaker: Raigh
text: My thoughts exactly, Chad. What happened to the orphanage?

speaker: Chad
text: ...I knew you'd be concerned. You ran off, but I knew you'd never forget us.

speaker: Raigh
text: I was never concerned. I was just curious.

speaker: Chad
text: ...The orphanage is gone.

speaker: Raigh
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Chad
text: Bern's troops burned it to the ground when they invaded Lycia. Poppa... He couldn't...

speaker: Raigh
text: What?! They killed Poppa...?

speaker: Chad
text: I'm going to avenge him. We're stuck on these Isles now. But I know we'll go back and fight Bern full force some day...!

speaker: Chad
text: I suppose there's no point in telling you, though, is there?

speaker: Raigh
text: ...I'll go with you.

speaker: Chad
text: What?! Are you serious?

speaker: Raigh
text: Bern has a deep connection with the dragons. I want to learn more.

speaker: Chad
text: ...So that's it. Fine. Just don't get in my way.

speaker: Ain
text: ...Burn.

speaker: Bandit
text: Boss! Those guys from Lycia, they're here.

speaker: Scott
text: You sure?

speaker: Bandit
text: Yep. We just saw 'em arrive on the small island to the east.

speaker: Scott
text: Just as that other group said... All right, they're probably floundering around in the fog unable to see anything. Just sneak up on them from behind and kill 'em off.

speaker: Bandit
text: Sure thing, boss.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Roy, I'm sorry that I couldn't be of help.

speaker: Roy
text: Please don't worry about it. It isn't your responsibility, Lady Cecilia.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes. But even within Etruria, there are a lot of people voicing their discontent on how the adviser is treating Lycia like servants.

speaker: Roy
text: Adviser? I thought the king had made the decision to send Lycia to clear out the bandits.

speaker: Cecilia
text: No. Adviser Roartz had been working with Lord Arcard, who's in charge of the mining operation in the Western Isles, and they decided to do it on their own without consulting the king.

speaker: Roy
text: How can they do that?

speaker: Cecilia
text: ... Do you remember last year's tragedy in Etruria?

speaker: Roy
text: Of course. Etruria's next heir, Prince Mildain, suddenly passed away last year.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Right.

speaker: Roy
text: I never had the honor to meet him. I understand that he was a very bright individual.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes... If the prince were alive, Etruria wouldn't be like this. King Mordred couldn't bear the fact that his son had died. The shock was so great that he never completely recovered from it. And today, it seems like he's always in a different world, and he doesn't really pay attention to anything going on around him or in his country. Roartz took advantage of this. Now, he's basically in charge of what goes in the palace. Ever since then, he has kept the Three Etrurian Generals, Lord Douglas, Percival, and me, away from the king unless there's a great emergency.

speaker: Roy
text: But what about the time when you came to aid us in Ostia?

speaker: Cecilia
text: That event was an exception because Percival worked with me. But now...

speaker: Roy
text: Please don't worry yourself. We can return to Lycia when we complete this mission anyway. But may I ask you to take care of Lycia while we are away?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Of course. You can leave the Lycia Alliance, and also Princess Guinevere, to me.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy... I may not go with you?

speaker: Roy
text: The battles on these islands are likely to become slugfests. You can never know what will happen. I think you should hide in Etruria with protection from General Cecilia.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Your Highness, please trust me. I understand your intentions of suggesting a truce, and I also promised Roy that I would protect you. Trust me, I will defend you at all costs.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ... I understand. I apologize for being selfish. Roy, I pray for your safety.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you, my Lady. I will pray for yours as well.

speaker: Fir
text: Sir Scott!

speaker: Scott
text: Oh, it's Fir. Sorry I had to call you in.

speaker: Fir
text: What is all this noise about?

speaker: Scott
text: Well you see, some brigands are attacking this island. The people living here are in danger.

speaker: Fir
text: What!

speaker: Scott
text: I sent some guys over to try and stop them, but the invaders are pretty tough. The situation doesn't look good.

speaker: Fir
text: I can't believe...

speaker: Scott
text: If only I could go out there... but I can't leave the castle. So, Fir, I'm sorry, but...

speaker: Fir
text: Yes. I shall go and drive them off.

speaker: Scott
text: Thanks.

speaker: Fir
text: Leave it to me! Attacking innocent villagers... that's not forgivable!

speaker: Scott
text: I asked another guy too, so you can work with him.

speaker: Fir
text: Someone else?

speaker: Scott
text: Yeah, a nomad named Sin. He looks frail, but he's got a decent shot with his bow.

speaker: Fir
text: Are you... Sin?

speaker: Sin
text: That's me. I heard the story from Scott. Let's go.

speaker: Fir
text: Um...

speaker: Sin
text: What?

speaker: Fir
text: Um, did you also join the fight to protect the people living here?

speaker: Sin
text: No... I have no such interest in such things.

speaker: Fir
text: Then why?

speaker: Sin
text: I'm paid to fight. That's all.

speaker: Fir
text: ... I gotta keep the conversation going.

speaker: Fir
text: Um... you're from Sacae, right?

speaker: Sin
text: Right.

speaker: Fir
text: What took you all the way out here?

speaker: Sin
text: It's nothing new. You look like you're from Sacae, and you're also here.

speaker: Fir
text: Well, I'm traveling around Elibe to train myself, and... Oh, you weren't asking about me, were you...

speaker: Fir
text: ... Whew.

speaker: Sin
text: ... I'm looking for somebody.

speaker: Fir
text: Who?

speaker: Sin
text: ... My clan lost to Bern when they invaded Sacae.

speaker: Sin
text: Our clan leader let me escape, and he told me to find and protect his granddaughter. So I left the battlefield to fulfill his request.

speaker: Fir
text: I see... Well, I hope you find her.

speaker: Sin
text: ... Yes.

speaker: Bandit
text: Boss, you sure? I mean, letting a girl like that fight out there...

speaker: Scott
text: Yeah, I know what I'm doing. Once she's killed, we can get that sword she's carrying.

speaker: Bandit
text: Sword? That weird one she has?

speaker: Scott
text: That's no ordinary sword. That's the 'Wo Dao,' a famous katana. If we can get it from her and sell it, it'll be worth a fortune. Hehe...

speaker: Bandit
text: I see. That's why you were so generous to her at first.

speaker: Scott
text: I couldn't make a move up until now, but now's a chance. Listen, I want you to follow her. When you see the chance, grab the sword from her!

speaker: Bandit
text: Sure thing, boss!

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus, it looked like the enemy was trying to ambush us...

speaker: Merlinus
text: They must have known we were coming.

speaker: Roy
text: Something must be going on behind the scenes...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. Clearing out the bandits might be harder than we had expected. Ever since Bern started this invasion, something is different with Elibe.

speaker: Roy
text: I wonder what's going to happen from now... Dragons reappearing, Bern's sudden invasion, the collapse of the Lycia Alliance... All of these strange things happening at once. Still, we have to take things one at a time however tedious it may seem.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Now... where do we go from here?

speaker: Roy
text: How about moving north along the coast?

speaker: Merlinus
text: North... Towards the mines?

speaker: Roy
text: Right. I've heard that the people living on the islands are being forced into labor over there.

speaker: Merlinus
text: So we must rescue them first.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. Then we might be able to find out who's behind all this.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Well, we must start somewhere.

speaker: Roy
text: All right, then let's head north.

speaker: Roy
text: Let's head west.

speaker: Merlinus
text: West?

speaker: Roy
text: I've heard there's a rebel group based there. They're fighting the bandits to protect the villagers.

speaker: Merlinus
text: I see. So we can visit them and gather some information on what's going on these islands.

speaker: Roy
text: Right. If we just go searching blindly, we won't get anywhere.

speaker: Merlinus
text: I have no objections, Master Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: All right, then let's head west.

speaker: Sin
text: Lady Sue!

speaker: Sue
text: Sin... What are you doing here?

speaker: Sin
text: I was looking for you.

speaker: Sue
text: For me?

speaker: Sin
text: Yes. That was the clan leader's orders.

speaker: Sue
text: ... What happened to our clan after I left?

speaker: Sin
text: I'm sorry, we didn't stand a chance against Bern.

speaker: Sue
text: ... We lost.

speaker: Sue
text: What has happened to my grandfather?

speaker: Sin
text: He's continuing the struggle against Bern...

speaker: Sue
text: I see...

speaker: Sin
text: I was told by the clan leader to leave and look for you.

speaker: Sue
text: Then will you fight alongside us?

speaker: Sin
text: With you?

speaker: Sue
text: We will be helping Grandfather because this army is fighting against Bern. Also, this army saved my life earlier.

speaker: Sin
text: Understood, my lady. If that is your plan, then I am at your disposal.

speaker: Sue
text: Thank you.

speaker: Noah
text: Fir! It is you!

speaker: Fir
text: Sir Noah?! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Noah
text: Yes, I joined this army a while back... Whoa!

speaker: Noah
text: What are you thinking?! Put away your sword!

speaker: Fir
text: Sir Noah! I thought you were nobler than this!

speaker: Noah
text: What?

speaker: Fir
text: Just because you're a mercenary knight... Lending your services to pirates?! You should be ashamed!

speaker: Noah
text: ... Huh?

speaker: Fir
text: Don't play dumb! You're working with a band of pirates to attack the people living in this island! And you call yourself a knight?!

speaker: Noah
text: Um, can I have a sec? I think there's a really big misunderstanding...

speaker: Fir
text: Misunderstanding?! You still insist...

speaker: Noah
text: We're trying to help the villagers. We're supposed to go defeat the head of a pirate group. I think his name was Scott or something.

speaker: Fir
text: What? Scott is the head of a pirate band?

speaker: Noah
text: If you think I'm lying, why don't you ask the pirate over here? He's right behind you, hiding in the bushes.

speaker: Fir
text: Pirate? What pirate...

speaker: Bandit
text: Damn! I better go tell the boss!

speaker: Fir
text: Hey! Wait!

speaker: Noah
text: ... You didn't suspect at all?

speaker: Fir
text: No! Scott was really kind to me...

speaker: Noah
text: Really? Rumors say that he's a very cruel man...

speaker: Fir
text: Well, my mother used to say that you shouldn't judge people by their looks...

speaker: Noah
text: Well, that's true, but...

speaker: Fir
text: ... I was lending my services to pirates... What can I do now?

speaker: Noah
text: Then you want to come along with us?

speaker: Fir
text: What? Would it be okay?

speaker: Noah
text: We're always looking for more people to strengthen our army. I'll talk to Roy about it.

speaker: Fir
text: Thank you!

speaker: Scott
text: So the fog didn't stop you after all... But you gotta be pretty beat up by now! I'll finish you off!

speaker: Scott
text: Who the hell... are you? You're no ordinary army..

speaker: Village
text: Eh... The only people here are the women and children. Everyone else, the workers, have gone north to the mines. They aren't even allowed to sleep there, they just work until they die... My brother, who escaped, is as thin as an old man. That day, he drew his last breath. Now that I've told you this... Can you do... er, sorry... I've said too much. Please forget all of this. We're leaving this island now.

speaker: Village
