text: You saved us! Are you with the Resistance? No? Then you're just normal good people? Just as you've seen, this island is swarmed with pirates and bandits! But... what are we going to do? Rumors around here say there's a severe battle going on the west. Go ahead and tell them that we're leaving the island...

speaker: Village
text: This area basically belongs to the pirates. They just steal from us all the time. Resistance? That's useless. They can do whatever they want because they have lots of support. We can't fight against them like the resistance forces.

speaker: House
text: The resistance is doing quite well. In the north, and in the west-- they are always in the thick of battle. Which way will you go?

speaker: House
text: The nearby villages... Everyone in them are leaving the islands. It's very sad, really. If you want to visit, you'd better do it quickly. You don't have time to go to both, so you'll have to decide.

speaker: House
text: Geez, there's so much mist here... In these conditions, you have NO idea if anyone is lurking around! The Torch Staff is useful, even for those hard-eyed thieves.

speaker: Brunnya
text: Lord Jahn, here is Idunn. Please take care of her.

speaker: Jahn
text: What will you do, human?

speaker: Brunnya
text: We will stay here and face the Etrurian Army one last time.

speaker: Jahn
text: Do you have enough troops?

speaker: Brunnya
text: The Dragon Knights scattered around the continent have all returned under our cause.

speaker: Jahn
text: Do you have a chance of victory?

speaker: Brunnya
text: ...Our chances of winning are slim. Still, we are the Bern Army, the strongest standing force on the continent. We shall at the very least show them our unbending will.

speaker: Jahn
text: Will... You humans take actions incomprehensible to us at times. Would your will raise your chances of winning? ...Very well, I suppose. We all have our methods of battle.

speaker: Brunnya
text: ...Have you spread my message?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes. Those who leave the army now will not be tried for deserting. Whether to fight or to leave is up to each his own.’ That was your message, General Brunnya.

speaker: Brunnya
text: How many still remain with us?

speaker: Soldier
text: Nearly all of the troops are saying that they wish to fight by your side.

speaker: Brunnya
text: All? Our chances of victory are slim. I’m sure many of the troops have families waiting for them. They must not feel pressured to stay.

speaker: Soldier
text: We are knights of Bern, my lady. We have no intention of bowing our heads to Etruria.

speaker: Brunnya
text: ...I want you to expel those who are injured and those who have young children or aged parents. They must not stay here.

speaker: Soldier
text: But General Brunnya...

speaker: Brunnya
text: This is an order. Understood?

speaker: Elffin
text: Master Roy, our troops are ready.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Did the messenger return?

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes. ...As we suspected, the enemy has no intention of surrendering.

speaker: Roy
text: Did you make it clear that their safety would be guaranteed if they surrender?

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes. But they said, ‘We appreciate your offer, but we will not surrender.'

speaker: Roy
text: Why? Bern already officially surrendered...

speaker: Elffin
text: This person might understand...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere...do you understand why?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes. ...Bern recognizes itself as being the strongest force in Elibe. Their pride would not allow them accept defeat without fighting.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! The enemy is advancing!

speaker: Roy
text: ! ...We have no choice. We must fight! Merlinus, send Princess Guinevere to the back lines...

speaker: Guinevere
text: No. I will stay here. I...must hear their calls. That is all that a...traitor like myself can do...

speaker: Old Man
text: M-Master Karel! This will become a battlefield soon...

speaker: Karel
text: So I see. This place is not known to outsiders. I thought I could be free of warfare if I stayed here...

speaker: Old Man
text: What should we do?

speaker: Karel
text: Please do not worry. I will protect the village.

speaker: Old Man
text: Thank you! We have nothing to fear with the Sword Saint on our side.

speaker: Karel
text: I am just an ordinary swordsman. Rumors expand out of proportion with time, so they must not easily be trusted. ...But this battle seems to be bigger than I thought. Is my sister all right...?

speaker: Old Man
text: I never knew you had a sister.

speaker: Karel
text: I haven’t seen her in years, but I heard a while ago that she had fallen ill. I can only hope that she is leading a peaceful life with her husband and daughter...

speaker: Fir
text: Uncle!

speaker: Karel
text: That voice... Is it Fir? What are you doing here?

speaker: Fir
text: I never expected to find you here, either, Uncle.

speaker: Karel
text: After traveling around the continent, I decided to settle here. I thought I could train my sword skills peacefully in a quiet place like this...

speaker: Fir
text: Uncle... I must tell you something. Mother...she...

speaker: Karel
text: ...Died?

speaker: Fir
text: Yes...

speaker: Karel
text: ... So she didn’t survive the illness... I’m sorry. I wasn’t there when she needed me the most...

speaker: Fir
text: No...it’s all right.

speaker: Karel
text: But why are you here? You don’t seem like you have been searching for me just to say that.

speaker: Fir
text: Yes. I’m fighting against Bern now.

speaker: Karel
text: You...joined the war?

speaker: Fir
text: I know that you don’t like getting caught up in conflicts like this. But I couldn’t help but try and do something for those people who are suffering because of the war. Uncle...was I wrong? Did I make a mistake? Is this not good for training my sword...?

speaker: Karel
text: No, you have not made any mistakes. The path you choose on your own is never wrong. In fact, I shall assist you from now on.

speaker: Fir
text: Really!?

speaker: Karel
text: Yes. ...You are right. You have grown. The last time I saw you, you were still a toddler.

speaker: Fir
text: Uncle...

speaker: Bartre
text: Karel!?

speaker: Karel
text: Bartre? What are you doing here?

speaker: Bartre
text: I am currently enlisted in the Etrurian Army. I didn’t expect to see you here...

speaker: Karel
text: After traveling around the continent, I decided to settle here. I thought I could train my sword skills peacefully in a quiet place like this...

speaker: Bartre
text: ...I must apologize...

speaker: Karel
text: ...Is it about my sister?

speaker: Bartre
text: Yes... I tried my hardest, but...

speaker: Karel
text: She didn’t survive...

speaker: Bartre
text: I am truly sorry. My weakness couldn’t save her...

speaker: Karel
text: It is not your fault. I must apologize. I couldn’t be at her side when she needed me the most...

speaker: Bartre
text: ...I must ask you for something.

speaker: Karel
text: What is that?

speaker: Bartre
text: I want this battle to end. I know you dislike warfare... But would you help us...?

speaker: Karel
text: ...I see. Yes, I will try my hardest.

speaker: Bartre
text: Thank you! We have nothing to fear with such a skilled swordsman on our side!

speaker: Karel
text: This village has none who would wish to fight. Please leave us in peace.

speaker: Karel
text: Are you Roy?

speaker: Roy
text: Who are you?

speaker: Karel
text: I am Karel. I hereby have decided to assist your army.

speaker: Roy
text: You’re the Sword Saint... I have heard of your skills. You are most welcome in our ranks.

speaker: Brunnya
text: Bern will not lose! Even if I fall, Bern will rise back up and fight again!

speaker: Brunnya
text: Your...Majesty... Finally...I can go...to your side...

speaker: Brunnya
text: Melady... So, you have chosen the path with Princess Guinevere. That is one way... But I have chosen my own path, as you yours. I must fight to defend it!

speaker: Brunnya
text: You are a knight of Bern? So, you have chosen the path with Princess Guinevere. That is one way... But I have chosen my own path, as you yours. I must fight to defend it!

speaker: Roy
text: This is the Dragon Temple... The Dark Priestess is in here?

speaker: Elffin
text: We can count on that. But...something is bothering me...

speaker: Roy
text: What?

speaker: Elffin
text: In one of the legends of the Scouring, it is said that the Dragon Temple holds the power of the Dragons.

speaker: Roy
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Elffin
text: It is also said that the temple’s power protects the Dragon itself.

speaker: Roy
text: What...? I don’t understand.

speaker: Elffin
text: This is just my estimate, but perhaps it means that the Dragons inside the temple have much greater power than those on the outside.

speaker: Roy
text: So... Our tactics against the Dragons until now might not work?

speaker: Elffin
text: Perhaps... However, if those worthy of using the Divine Weapons use them to their fullest potential, then we may have a chance.

speaker: Roy
text: ...We have no other good ideas. All right. Then we’ll choose those who have the best skill to enter the temple.

speaker: Elffin
text: Be careful who you choose. We might not be able to leave once we’re inside...

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain! The enemy has arrived. They are on the other side of the mountain.

speaker: Sigune
text: So, they’ve arrived. ...The battle will start soon.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain, are you sure?

speaker: Sigune
text: About what?

speaker: Soldier
text: The Etrurian Army is saying that will liberate us from Bern. In that case, we could gain independence...

speaker: Sigune
text: Do you really believe what they say? What idiot would fight a war for the sake of others? Once they defeat Bern, they’ll just establish themselves as the next dictator.

speaker: Soldier
text: Well...

speaker: Sigune
text: Then it’s better to be with Bern. They’re better at warfare.

speaker: Sigune
text: Come now, we have more immediate problems. We’ve got to get rid of the enemy that’s right in front of us first. Are the ballistas ready?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes. The archers are all at their stations.

speaker: Sigune
text: Good! Shoot at them from a distance... They’ll be floundering around in the dark in this powerful blizzard. Observe nature’s wrath...

speaker: Roy
text: Such strong wind and hail... I can’t see three meters in front of me.

speaker: Niime
text: Ilia’s winters are always like this. This is expected if you’re fighting a battle at this time of the year.

speaker: Roy
text: We must attack now so that Bern doesn’t have the time to recover.

speaker: Niime
text: That’s true. It would be a disaster if the Dark Dragon really was brought back into this world.

speaker: Roy
text: I was thinking... Maybe the Dark Dragon is in human form as well.

speaker: Niime
text: Perhaps. Maybe all the Dragons are in human form now. I’ve also heard stories of Dragons in human form living with people.

speaker: Roy
text: Arcadia...

speaker: Niime
text: Hm? Did you say something?

speaker: Roy
text: No, nothing.

speaker: Niime
text: I don’t know anything specific, but I’ve read in an ancient scroll that Dragons started taking human form only after the Ending Winter.

speaker: Roy
text: The Ending Winter...

speaker: Niime
text: You’ve heard about it, right?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, only in legend. ‘At the Winder of Ends, the laws of nature were turned upside down. Day became night, and summer became winter.'

speaker: Niime
text: That’s it. These scrolls are so old and damaged so I couldn’t decipher all of them, but one thing is clear. The Ending Winter was a disaster powerful enough to bend and twist the planet.

speaker: Roy
text: What caused it?

speaker: Niime
text: Who knows... Popular belief says that the laws of nature were twisted when the Dragons unleashed vast amounts of magical power, but I have no idea about what really happened. But it does seem certain that Dragons started taking human form after the Ending Winter. It must be more than coincidence.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, I agree.

speaker: Niime
text: Well, either way, the truth lies in Bern.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain! Other Pegasus Knight squads are headed this way to assist us!

speaker: Sigune
text: Really? That would help. Too bad for the enemy... They’ll be in a panic if they suddenly get attacked from all directions when they can’t see in this snowstorm...

speaker: Sigune
text: So...you made it through this blizzard and cold? Congratulations. But it’s over. You shall end...right here, right now.

speaker: Sigune
text: ...Well, well... So I’m the one...to die... But maybe...I had already died...a long time...ago...

speaker: Sigune
text: You... You’re Juno’s youngest sister. You would fight me?

speaker: Sigune
text: By the honor of an Ilian knight... I won’t go easy on you. All right?

speaker: Shanna
text: Yes...

speaker: Sigune
text: Thea? What are you doing here? Oh...you’ve joined the Etrurian side.

speaker: Thea
text: Captain Sigune...

speaker: Sigune
text: You know the Ilian knightly code. I won’t go easy on you.

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus, I need you to send this letter to Bishop Yoder in Etruria.

speaker: Merlinus
text: A letter? May I ask what it says?

speaker: Roy
text: It’s the story we heard from Niime about the Dragons.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh? What did you discuss with her about the Dragons?

speaker: Roy
text: It’ll be long if I tell you. I haven’t sealed the letter yet, so you can look through it if you want.

speaker: Merlinus
text: All right. Let me see...

speaker: Roy
text: Is something wrong, Princess Guinevere?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I have come to speak about my brother.

speaker: Roy
text: ! ...Are you sure?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes... I want you to know before we enter Bern...about the tragedies that have occurred. You asked earlier if my brother murdered the former king.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes...

speaker: Guinevere
text: In short...it is true.

speaker: Roy
text: ! Then King Zephiel indeed killed his own father to seize the throne...

speaker: Guinevere
text: No!

speaker: Roy
text: No? He didn’t kill his father to get the throne?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... Our father was the one who tried to kill Zephiel first.

speaker: Roy
text: What!? Then King Zephiel...

speaker: Guinevere
text: He...couldn’t bear the abuse he was taking from our father. And so he...

speaker: Roy
text: What... Why did...

speaker: Merlinus
text: The Dragons are indeed are mysterious species... Hm? What is the matter?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No...it is nothing. Perhaps later...

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...Did I appear at a bad time?

speaker: Roy
text: No, it’s okay. Did you send the letter?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. I read through it, then sealed it and had it sent.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh... All right, thanks.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Why did the former king try to murder his own son...?

speaker: Narcian
text: Flaer! Hasn’t the castle gone down yet!?

speaker: Flaer
text: General Narcian, the Loyalists led by General Cecilia are fighting harder than we had anticipated...

speaker: Narcian
text: Cecilia...! That bitch again! Always interfering with my plans...!

speaker: Zephiel
text: I see you are having trouble, Narcian.

speaker: Narcian
text: Y-Your Majesty!? When...did you arrive?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Just now. The general from Etruria fights well, I see.

speaker: Narcian
text: Y-Yes... But fear not, I shall force her into submission...

speaker: Zephiel
text: No, let me. I will fight her myself.

speaker: Idunn
text: Your Majesty, there is no reason for you to fight...

speaker: Zephiel
text: No matter, I need the exercise. Narcian, show me to her.

speaker: Roy
text: What’s the story?

speaker: Merlinus
text: The castle hasn’t fallen yet, Master Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: Good! But we still have to hurry.

speaker: Zephiel
text: So... You are Cecilia, the Sorcery General.

speaker: Cecilia
text: !! ...King Zephiel...

speaker: Zephiel
text: For your prowess in battle, you have the honor to fight me one on one.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Too...powerful...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Down already? I would have expected more.

speaker: Narcian
text: Your Majesty! Invincible as always.

speaker: Zephiel
text: I suppose this is all one can expect from an Etrurian General.

speaker: Narcian
text: Your Majesty... If you would allow it, may I have her?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Hm?

speaker: Narcian
text: I have some certain...bad memories with this woman. I want to punish her for them.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Hmph, very well. Do with her as you wish.

speaker: Narcian
text: Thank you very much, Your Majesty. You there, make one of the prison cells ready.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, General Narcian.

speaker: Percival
text: What? Bern is attacking the castle?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, General Percival.

speaker: Percival
text: ...This isn’t what they promised. They said that they would leave Etrurian matters to us Etrurians.

speaker: Soldier
text: What should we do?

speaker: Percival
text: Was it General Narcian who commanded the attack?

speaker: Soldier
text: No, sir. It was King Zephiel himself.

speaker: Percival
text: ! The king himself... So, Bern had no intention of entrusting anything to us in the first place... We aren’t going to move right now. Tell everyone to remain at their posts.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Roy
text: The castle fell?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes... We were too late.

speaker: Roy
text: Is General Cecilia all right?

speaker: Merlinus
text: There is no report that she was killed, but probably...

speaker: Roy
text: Well, if there’s still a possibility that she’s alive, then I won’t give up. We have to hurry!

speaker: Narcian
text: Your Majesty! We have found Princess Guinevere.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Bring her to me.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Zephiel...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Guinevere. So good to see you.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Zephiel, why? Why did you start this war... Why are you killing innocent people?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Innocent, you say? Hmph, jealousy, vanity, greed... People have been fighting over such rubbish in any nation. And you call them innocent?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Well...

speaker: Zephiel
text: The world must liberated from such pointless things that men fight over. That is the purpose of this war.

speaker: Guinevere
text: But...people are being brutally killed in the process.

speaker: Zephiel
text: No radical change can come about without sacrifice.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Zephiel...!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Guinevere, you are my only sister. Therefore, I will forgive you this time. But not the next. Do you understand?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Narcian! Wasn’t the leader of Guinevere’s guards here?

speaker: Narcian
text: Yes. Her name is Melady.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Very well. Tell her to escort Guinevere back to Bern. Also tell her to make sure that the Fire Emblem is returned to the Temple of Seals.

speaker: Narcian
text: Yes, Your Majesty.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Zephiel...

speaker: Guinevere
text: Melady...

speaker: Melady
text: Princess Guinevere, I am glad to see you safe. Now, let us return to Bern on my mount... ...Princess?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Melady!

speaker: Melady
text: Wh-What are you doing!? Please put down that sword before you are hurt!

speaker: Guinevere
text: Melady, please! Let me go.

speaker: Melady
text: ! ...Should I oblige, what would you do next?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I understand that Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army is near here...

speaker: Melady
text: !? You would join the enemy!?

speaker: Guinevere
text: If we don’t do something, Elibe will be overrun by Bern’s forces... No matter what kind of reasoning my brother gives, what he is doing is obvious. He is forcing others into submission through power. I cannot agree that that will lead to anything good...

speaker: Guinevere
text: Melady... Please. Let me go.

speaker: Melady
text: ...There is one thing...

speaker: Melady
text: There is one thing that I cannot forgive you for, Princess. When you left Bern earlier, why did you not come to consult me...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Well... I thought that your reputation would be damaged, so...

speaker: Melady
text: ! Did you think that I would prioritize my reputation above you? I am your loyal knight more than I am a knight of Bern. That has not changed ever since I was knighted.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Melady...

speaker: Melady
text: If you told me to let you go, then I would follow your order with pleasure.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Melady... Thank you.

speaker: Melady
text: Please, halt your attacks! I am not an enemy!

speaker: Roy
text: What? Everyone, lower your weapons!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, she may be lying...

speaker: Roy
text: She may be a messenger. Killing a messenger goes against the knight’s code.

speaker: Melady
text: Are you General Roy?

speaker: Roy
text: ...Yes. And you are?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy!

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere!? You were safe.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes... I escaped with her assistance.

speaker: Melady
text: My name is Melady.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy, General Cecilia is alive.

speaker: Roy
text: R-Really?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes, she is alive, although she is severely wounded. She is being held captive in the castle.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you! We have to rescue her!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Are they ready?

speaker: Idunn
text: Yes. The Dragons are prepared to fight at your command.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Narcian, I will give you some Dragons to fortify your militia. I want you to send some of your forces to Nabata.

speaker: Narcian
text: Nabata? The desert lands located at the center of this peninsula?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Right. I hear that there is a hidden village in which Dragons have been staying ever since the Scouring.

speaker: Narcian
text: I see... Then there is a high chance that a Divine Weapon is hidden there.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Exactly. It must not fall into the hands of the enemy. I already sent some troops to start the attack, but they are outnumbered.

speaker: Narcian
text: Understood, Your Majesty. I shall send some mercenaries and Dragons there at once.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Good. You can also take the girl we captured in Nabata. She’s a Shaman from the hidden village. You can pry more information out of her if you need to.

speaker: Narcian
text: Yes, Your Majesty. I shall have the village taken in no time.

speaker: Zephiel
text: ...I shall remember those words.

speaker: Narcian
text: Of course!

speaker: Cecilia
text: ...Oh... Where am I... ...!

speaker: Sophia
text: You’re still not well... You shouldn’t move...

speaker: Cecilia
text: Did you treat my wounds?

speaker: Sophia
text: ...Yes... But I’m not...used to treating wounds... Perhaps...I didn’t do a good job...

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes, you did. Thank you. We must find a way out of here... ...Ow...!

speaker: Sophia
text: You shouldn’t move... The wound...will open again...

speaker: Cecilia
text: But I must do something...

speaker: Sophia
text: It will be all right... I can see...a light...that will soon be here to help us...

speaker: Cecilia
text: Light?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... That light...will aid us both... We must wait for it...

speaker: Cecilia
text: Who are you...?

speaker: Sophia
text: I am Sophia... A priestess of Arcadia...

speaker: Cecilia
text: Arcadia?

speaker: Sophia
text: I shall tell you more about it...later... For now...please trust me...

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, what is it, General Percival?

speaker: Percival
text: We’re leaving.

speaker: Soldier
text: What? Are you sure?

speaker: Percival
text: Bern’s behavior is clearly an act of insult to Etruria. I cannot aid Bern any further. We will return to Aquleia and inform Lord Douglas of this matter. Retreat at once!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Flaer
text: General Narcian! It’s them! The Lycia Alliance Army!

speaker: Narcian
text: What!? Flaer! I thought you had taken care of them at Djuto!

speaker: Flaer
text: I did! Well...I left a Dragon to deal with them, so... I never thought that they had survived!

speaker: Narcian
text: What!? You fool, then my reputation as your officer is also in jeopardy! If I let the Lycia Alliance Army live here, people will start to suspect my ability... I must do something... ...But, they defeated a Dragon. They seem to be tougher than I expected.

speaker: Flaer
text: General Narcian... What should we do...?

speaker: Narcian
text: I have no choice... Flaer, I will return to Aquleia and plan an attack on the Alliance Army. You stay here.

speaker: Flaer
text: ! M-Me... Stay here?

speaker: Narcian
text: You don’t have to defeat them. I just want you to hit them as hard as you can and decrease their numbers.

speaker: Flaer
text: General Narcian! You would use me as a cannon-fodder!?

speaker: Narcian
text: Flaer... To tell you the truth, you would have been executed a long time ago when you failed to defend Djuto. I’m giving you a chance to prove your worth again. You should be grateful. Hehehe...

speaker: Flaer
text: But!

speaker: Narcian
text: Or do you want me to carry out your execution right here?

speaker: Flaer
text: ...! ...Yes...sir... Understood.

speaker: Narcian
text: Good. Then I’ll leave the rest to you.

speaker: Elffin
text: Percival. It is good to see you again.

speaker: Elffin
text: Have you forgotten my face?

speaker: Percival
text: No...it cannot be. The prince...is dead.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...I understand your confusion. After all, a man who was pronounced dead is now standing before your very eyes.

speaker: Percival
text: Prince Mildain! You were alive...?

speaker: Elffin
text: I have troubled you for a long time now. ...It has been over a year since I was assassinated.

speaker: Percival
text: Assassinated!? Your Majesty, did you not fall off your horse in an accident?

speaker: Elffin
text: No. I was shot with a poisoned arrow. First to my horse...and then to me.

speaker: Percival
text: No...

speaker: Elffin
text: Douglas noticed first and made it public that I had been killed. A different corpse was placed in the coffin, and everything was set up as if the assassination had been successful. Douglas then entrusted me to his adopted daughter and let me escape to the Western Isles.

speaker: Percival
text: Lord Douglas did that...

speaker: Elffin
text: Even after I escaped to the west, I suffered from a high fever caused by the poison for many months. I was hovering between life and death so long that Douglas’ daughter gave up hope countless times.

speaker: Elffin
text: The rebel forces helped me by giving me medicine. Ironic, isn’t it? The very rebels who were fighting against the Etrurian court had saved the life the prince himself!

speaker: Elffin
text: I recovered...slowly. And then I saw the horrors being committed by the Etrurian nobles on the Isles. I was ashamed that I had not noticed when I was still residing on the throne.

speaker: Percival
text: Your Majesty...

speaker: Elffin
text: While aiding the rebels, I was looking for a chance to return to the mainland. Then General Roy came along, and I saw my chance. And that is how I ended up here.

speaker: Percival
text: Prince... I am truly thankful that you returned alive.

speaker: Elffin
text: I am with the Lycia Alliance Army right now, but I still must hide my true identity. And if I still have the loyalty that you pledged to me in the past...

speaker: Percival
text: I am at your service, Your Majesty. My master is only one, and he is you, Prince Mildain.

speaker: Larum
text: General Percival! It is you, isn’t it? I was looking for you! I am...

speaker: Larum
text: Wait! Wait! Stop your horse! Listen to me!

speaker: Percival
text: Who are you?

speaker: Larum
text: Don’t you know!? I thought we’d met before.

speaker: Percival
text: ...I sort of recall seeing you at Lord Douglas’ manor...

speaker: Larum
text: Yes! That’s me. You do know me, then!

speaker: Percival
text: But the girl I saw there was a little more...ordinary.

speaker: Larum
text: What’s that supposed to mean? Ah, no matter. Anyway, my name is Larum. I’m here under the command of Prince Mildain.

speaker: Percival
text: Prince Mildain...? Don’t be daft. The prince was killed in an accident the year before.

speaker: Larum
text: Well... Look at this!

speaker: Percival
text: !! That emblem... It belongs to the prince...!

speaker: Larum
text: Now do I have your attention? Then take a look at this letter, too. The prince told me to give it to you.

speaker: Percival
text: ...... This is the prince’s handwriting... So he is alive! Then I hesitate no more. If the prince has joined the Lycia Alliance Army, then I must do the same.

speaker: Larum
text: Wha-? That was quick... I was hoping things to get more dramatic... Like, ‘If you’re still going to stand against us, then you’re going to cut me down first!’ or something like that...

speaker: Flaer
text: Damn…! But I am a knight of Bern! I shall never surrender!

speaker: Flaer
text: Remember this… There are…plenty of warriors greater than I… Bern’s army shall annihilate you…for sure…

speaker: Roy
text: General Cecilia!

speaker: Cecilia
text: Roy... I have made a fool out of myself in front of you.

speaker: Roy
text: No, of course not! I am relieved that you are alive... But what of your wounds? Are you all right?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes. This girl treated them for me.

speaker: Roy
text: And you are?

speaker: Sophia
text: I am Sophia... A priestess of Arcadia...

speaker: Cecilia
text: She prophesized that you would be coming. Now, you said you would tell us more once we were safe...

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... Arcadia...our home...lies to the east...in the Nabata Desert... We tried to stay hidden...but Bern found us... And...

speaker: Roy
text: They attacked you?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... I was too slow...so I was captured...

speaker: Roy
text: I see... But why would Bern be interested in a little hidden village like yours?

speaker: Sophia
text: I...do not know... Perhaps...they found out...about the Dragons that live in Arcadia...

speaker: Roy
text: Dragons!?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... Arcadia...was built a long time ago...by Dragons and people who wished to live together...

speaker: Roy
text: Such a place existed...?

speaker: Sophia
text: Master Roy... Please, save our village...!

speaker: Merlinus
text: But the story does seem a bit unbelievable...

speaker: Roy
text: ...In any case, it’s probably true that her village is under attack by Bern. We should help them. We owe Sophia anyway because she helped General Cecilia.

speaker: Sophia
text: ...Thank you...

speaker: Roy
text: Then, can you tell us more about your village and the Dragons?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... I will gladly tell you what I know...

speaker: Soldier
text: General Percival, until further instructions are given, we will station ourselves in this castle and prepare for further attacks from the Revolutionaries.

speaker: Percival
text: Good.

speaker: Soldier
text: Here, we found this in the castle. Please take it. General Percival, please take care...of Etruria.

speaker: Percival
text: I know. Leave it to me.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes!

speaker: Gelero
text: This is the end of the caaave? Treasuuure… Where are yooouu…? Answer meee...

speaker: Bandit 1
text: Boss... Are you sure about this? The men from Bern just told us to block the entrance. If they catch us now, they'll surely have us back in chains!

speaker: Gelero
text: You foooool! We'll do as we're told in tiiime… They'll never know that we took the treasuuure… If we block the entrance without taking the treasure, it's all the same anywaaay… Do you really want that poor treasure trapped in here for all eternityyy?

speaker: Bandit 1
text: Well. when you put it that way... I guess you're right.

speaker: Bandit 2
text: Boss! There's an army stationed outside the cave!

speaker: Gelero
text: Whaaat? They want to take our treasure, do theeey? Have the boys near the entrance take them ooouut… And grab all the treasure cheeests… We rightfully stole them fiiirst!

speaker: Roy
text: A legendary weapon lies in this cave...? It's so dark in here.

speaker: Elffin
text: According to the scholar in Jutes I spoke to, the legendary weapon in this cave is most likely the Tunder Axe, Armads.

speaker: Roy
text: Armads… An axe this time.

speaker: Elffin
text: Armads was wielded by Durban the Berserker, who was said to be a colossus of a man. A single blow from his axe surely made short work of any opponent.

speaker: Roy
text: Elffin, you seem to know a lot about the Eight Legends and their weapons

speaker: Elffin
text: I'm a bard. It is my job to know myths and legends.

speaker: Roy
text: I'd like to hear some of them when we have the time.

speaker: Elffin
text: Of course. ...Lord Roy, it seems we are not alone in this cave.

speaker: Roy
text: We aren't?

speaker: Elffin
text: There are also noxious fumes coming from the cave walls. We must tread lightly.

speaker: Roy
text: Where is the legendary weapon?

speaker: Elffin
text: Hmm... I hear wind blowing from behind the throne.

speaker: Roy
text: What? I can't hear it... A niche... between the floor and the wall. Oh! It opened! ...So this is the legendary weapon? This axe is enormous.

speaker: Elffin
text: Armads… The very axe wielded by Durban the Berserker. It certainly appears fit for a warrior of his stature.

speaker: Soldier
text: R-report! I have a message from Etruria... A revolution has broken out in Aquleia, the capital of Etruria.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?!

speaker: Soldier
text: The ones leading the revolution are High Chancellor Roartz and Lord Arcard. They have captured King Mordred. They also say they plan to divided dominion of the continent between Bern and Etruria!

speaker: Merlinus
text: The two strongest nations in Elibe joining forces...

speaker: Roy
text: Is General Cecilia all right?! And what of Princess Guinivere...

speaker: Soldier
text: We don't have any current information... But the three Etrurian Generals have parted ways and are working separately. Mage General Cecilia has fled Aquleia for the Missur Peninsula in the southwest.

speaker: Roy
text: And the other Generals?

speaker: Soldier
text: They're with the revolutionaries against their will because the king was taken hostage.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: We need to contact General Cecilia... Princess Guinivere… Please be safe...

speaker: Nord
text: What can you tell me about that spy from the resistance?

speaker: Soldier
text: You mean the dancer called Larum? We threw her in the dungeon, sire.

speaker: Nord
text: Has she told you anything?

speaker: Soldier
text: No. She keeps insisting that she's not affiliated with the resistance.

speaker: Nord
text: A liar, is she? Perhaps I could interrogate her myself...

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir Nord!

speaker: Nord
text: What is it?

speaker: Soldier
text: There is a messenger here from the Lycian Army.

speaker: Nord
text: Ah, the army that was sent to clean up tthe bandits on the Isles.

speaker: Soldier
text: It seems that they want permission to pass through to Eburacum.

speaker: Nord
text: ...Lord Arcard told us to get rid of the Lycian Army in their time here. Heh heh heh... If we impress Lord Arcard he may see fit to reward us. Desploy the troops and finish them here!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sire... And the messenger?

speaker: Nord
text: Kill him.

speaker: Soldier
text: Understood, sire.

speaker: Nord
text: Be sure to deploy the ballista. Use it to defeat the Lycian Army before they even reach you.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Nord
text: Just make sure the enemy doesn't get hold of it!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy, soldiers are flowing out from the castle.

speaker: Roy
text: Are there bandits around here?

speaker: Merlinus
text: No, they seem to be heading towards us, actually.

speaker: Roy
text: ...What about the messenger?

speaker: Merlinus
text: He hasn't returned... Which may mean the worst...

speaker: Roy
text: He hasn't returned? Why is Sir Nord attack us?

speaker: Merlinus
text: The enemy draws near... Lord Roy, what are your orders?

speaker: Roy
text: ...I guess we have no choice but to fight. We might learn something if we can reach the castle.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, milord. You're right.

speaker: Roy
text: All right, storm the castle! But have mercy! Some of their soldiers may be willing to listen!

speaker: Woman
text: Geese... You're really leaving?

speaker: Geese
text: The lord of that castle killed my mates. I won't let their deaths be unavenged.

speaker: Woman
text: You mean that crew that was always with you...

speaker: Geese
text: Yeah... They were taken to the mines and told that they would be given work. But they were all worked like slaves until they... died.

speaker: Geese
text: Maybe they weren't the brightest bunch, but they were good people... And they were killed... just like that...!!

speaker: Woman
text: Do you intend to avenge them on your own?

speaker: Geese
text: Is there something wrong with that?

speaker: Woman
text: No... But I thought you were going to go back to your merchant business.

speaker: Geese
text: Yeah, well, I've got bigger problems now... Once my mates get their revenge, and once the war subsides, maybe I will.

speaker: Woman
text: ...We won't forget you, Geese. You and your crew risked your lives to get us food and supplies. If you ever need anything, we'll be here.

speaker: Geese
text: Maybe I'll take you up on that, if I'm still alive. ...Thanks.

speaker: Geese
text: Yeah? What? You got something to say to me?

speaker: Roy
text: I want to ask you why you're fighting against the soldiers.

speaker: Geese
text: Who wants to know?

speaker: Roy
text: Roy, leader of the Lycian Army. We're here on behalf of Etruria...

speaker: Geese
text: You're with Etruria?! Then you're the enemy. Get ready to die!

speaker: Roy
text: Slow down! We're fighting the castle's troops too.

speaker: Geese
text: And yet Etruria sent you? I don't understand.

speaker: Roy
text: I don't either. We were sent by Etruria to get rid of bandits here, but something's strange.

speaker: Geese
text: ...You say you're fighting the castle's troops. I'm for hire, if you'll take me.

speaker: Roy
text: What?

speaker: Geese
text: I'm a seafaring man, so I know both the land and sea around the Isles. You look a bit lost, so I could be a good guide for you.

speaker: Roy
text: That would help, but why?

speaker: Geese
text: I want to help with your mission. To be honest, I'm a pirate, so I'm probably the type you were sent to get rid of. But I only go after the rich. They have more than their fair share anyway.

speaker: Roy
text: Well then, if you'll join us, we're pleased to have you. We don't know this area at all, so it's been difficult thus far.

speaker: Geese
text: Sounds like we have a deal! Leave it to me!

speaker: Geese
text: ...This is it, lads. Can you taste it? You'll have your vengeance. And after you do, I might just tag along with this Roy fellow for a while...

speaker: Nord
text: Gonzalez! Gonzalez, where are you?!

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Here... I here...

speaker: Nord
text: There's a village to the north, right along the mountain. Do you understand?

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Understand.

speaker: Nord
text: It may be a resistance base. I want you to go and burn it to the ground, village and all.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Village and all...

speaker: Nord
text: Good. You understand. This is the only use I have for a lump such as you. Now get goung, you halfwit, before you forget your orders.

speaker: Nord
text: Forget how to speak? Are you trying to say something?

speaker: Gonzalez
text: N-no...

speaker: Nord
text: Such a monsterous face, and yet such a needlessly compassionate heart. He will learn the value of destroying a village firsthand!

speaker: Lilina
text: Excuse me!

speaker: Gonzalez
text: W-what you doing?! I am enemy!

speaker: Lilina
text: I know... But there's such a look of sorrow in your eyes.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: ...There is a village near mountain. You know?

speaker: Lilina
text: Yes, I know it.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Tell people escape. I have order. Destroy village. I...

speaker: Lilina
text: What? Don't! The villagers are innocent...

speaker: Gonzalez
text: No. It order. I must.

speaker: Lilina
text: It sounds to me like you should leave the person who gave you that order.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Leave?

speaker: Lilina
text: Yes! You can fight with us. We're protecting the villagers.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: No... I monster... People mean to me... People throw stones... People say "Go away!"... "You a monster!"... Not human...

speaker: Lilina
text: That's horrible! Of course you're human! You're a very kind-hearted man. I can tell. Please, come with us. Don't be afraid.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Me afraid? I never afraid! Everyone afraid of ME! I not afraid!

speaker: Lilina
text: No. You ARE afraid. You're afraid that people will throw stones and call you a monster.

speaker: Lilina
text: But you don't have to be afraid of us. Everyone in our army is nice. They won't do that to you. Be brave... Take that first step, and you'll never have to be afraid again.

speaker: Nord
text: You made it all the way here. But I shall take your pathetic lives...

speaker: Nord
text: Death? I feel...my life...draining...away...

speaker: Woman
text: I'm worried about Larum. I hope she's all right. She smuggled us weapons so we could defend ourselves. Even when we begged her to hide, she refused and kept helping us. Here's an axe that she brought us. It's a strange one... It's strong against swords, but weak against lances! I'd gladly trade it for her safety, though, so please, take it...

speaker: Old Woman
text: Brigands and pirates... They were all just as innocent as anyone when they were young. Maybe if you spoke to some of them, you could make them understand.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy... We couldn't find any evidence explaining Sir Nord's aggression.

speaker: Roy
text: But now we know for certain that somebody wants our heads.

speaker: Merlinus
text: I think we should contact Etruria about this.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, I'll send a message to General Cecilia.

speaker: Soldier
text: Excuse me, Lord Roy. We found a girl imprisoned in the dungeon. She wishes to speak with you.

speaker: Roy
text: To me? Let her pass.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Larum
text: You're Roy? The one who's here to clear out the bandits?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, that's me.

speaker: Larum
text: I beg you, Roy! Please rescue my friends!

speaker: Roy
text: Whoa, easy there!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hey! Get off of him!

speaker: Roy
text: C-calm down and tell me everything. You say your friends are in danger?

speaker: Larum
text: My name is Larum. I'm part of the resistance force on the Isles.

speaker: Roy
text: The force that's fighting against the bandits?

speaker: Larum
text: Yes. ...Actually, no!

speaker: Roy
text: No?

speaker: Larum
text: That's part of it, but the real enemy is Etruria! They work with the bandits to squeeze every bit they can out of the people here!

speaker: Roy
text: What?! Is that true?!

speaker: Larum
text: The lords living here take people into the mines and work them to death!! They're allowed no rest, even if they're sick or injured.

speaker: Roy
text: ...That's terrible...

speaker: Larum
text: We're fighting Etruria to stop the abuse! Our next plan was to attack the mine at Eburacum and rescue the people there! But...but...!

speaker: Roy
text: Calm down! You can tell me.

speaker: Larum
text: A villager here leaked the details of the plan! He was probably tortured... I have to go to the mines before the resistance is ambushed!

speaker: Roy
text: Then there's no time to spare! We'll backup the resistance force and rescue the people being forced into labor!

speaker: Larum
text: Truly, you will?! Thank you, Roy!

speaker: Roy
text: Whoa! L-Larum!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hey! I said get off of him!

speaker: Larum
text: Here, Roy. Use this sword.

speaker: Roy
text: What is it?

speaker: Larum
text: It's called a wyrmslayer. It's effective against wyvern riders, and it's said it was used against dragons, too. Who can say, though? It might come in handy. It belongs to Echidna, the leader of the resistance. You're helping us though, so you can have it for now.

speaker: Leygance
text: Devias, how is the city doing?

speaker: Devias
text: They've been quiet so far, sir. But the mercenary knights from Ilia that Hector hired are showing no submission.

speaker: Leygance
text: Hmph! What's wrong with them? We're telling them we'll pay more!

speaker: Devias
text: Well, Ilia's mercenary knights are known never to betray their masters.

speaker: Leygance
text: You fool! I know that! General Narcian is going to arrive soon! If we don't have Ostia under our control by then, he'll laugh at us!

speaker: Devias
text: O-of course, sir.

speaker: Leygance
text: We may have to use Lilina to bargain with the mercenary knights... If we use her as a hostage, they should surrender to us. But that must be a last resort. We will fight them ourselves with the help of Dragon Knights sent from Bern to crush Ilia's forces!! Devias, I want you to clear out the town and guard the castle gate. I will defend the inside of our castle.

speaker: Devias
text: Yes sir!

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus! Around how many of Ostia's troops have joined the rebellion?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Quite a few, I'm afraid. They have forgotten their loyalty towards Lord Hector, and are simply flocking towards the one with more power, which is Bern. How disgraceful!

speaker: Roy
text: I see...

speaker: Merlinus
text: But there is good news too, Master Roy! There is a band of mercenary knights from Ilia that are willing to join forces with us and attack the rebels.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Mercenary knights from Ilia?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. They said that they signed a contract with Lord Hector that they would fight Bern alongside Ostia's troops.

speaker: Roy
text: That's fortunate. But when the mercenary knights hear the news that Lord Hector has passed away, that contract would probably be broken. Do you think it's possible for us to officially hire them into our service?

speaker: Merlinus
text: I would have thought so too, Master Roy. However, they already knew of Lord Hector's death. They offered to fight alongside us anyway.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Why do they go that far, when they are mercenaries?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Ilia is a snowy area with a harsh temperature so the land isn't very arable. Therefore, sending out mercenaries to fight for pay is one of Ilia's main sources of economic input. I've also heard that mercenaries from Ilia put trust over anything else and that they never betray their employers. The rumors are true, I see.

speaker: Roy
text: Then they should be powerful allies.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes! Fortune is still with us, Master Roy! But... I heard from the mercenary knights that one of the Three Dragon Lords is coming here with a legion of Dragon Knights. If they should join the rebels, then our chances of defeating them would become extremely slim.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy, what are you going to do?

speaker: Roy
text: ... The Kingdom of Etruria might join us.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Etruria?! Would that be possible?

speaker: Roy
text: General Cecilia, the Sorcery General of Etruria was my teacher in battle arts while I was studying in Ostia. I have a feeling she would be willing to join forces with us.

speaker: Merlinus
text: I would object, Master Roy! If we depend on Etruria to solve our own matters in Lycia, we'll be sure to be their laughing stock for decades!

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, I know that... But this is truly an important matter for Lycia. I think that we should go for the safest and most definite option rather than worry about the consequences and do nothing, which would most likely lead to the extinction of Lycia.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ... Lord Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: We have to move quickly! I'll write a letter to General Cecilia. Merlinus, I need you to get the letter to her as quickly as possible.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ... Yes, Lord Roy! You are right. I shall send the letter to her as soon as you are ready.

speaker: Roy
text: Thanks. All right, everybody! Let's retake Ostia!

speaker: Zelots
text: It looks like the Lycia Alliance have started attacking the rebels. All right, we're going too. Let's go and drive off the rebel forces!

speaker: Trec
text: Will do, sir.

speaker: Zelots
text: Wait, where's Noah?

speaker: Trec
text: Ummm, I think he went to the arena a while ago. He said he's coaching a young girl in the sword arts.

speaker: Zelots
text: That Noah, a coach? That's unusual... Well, no matter. Once he finds out we're attacking the rebels, he'll catch up to us.

speaker: Trec
text: Yup.

speaker: Zelots
text: All right, let's go.

speaker: Noah
text: Looks like they've started attacking the rebels. Well then, Fir, I should get going soon.

speaker: Fir
text: Thank you for coaching me, Sir Noah.

speaker: Noah
text: No problem. But I must say you surprised me. You suddenly came up to me and said, "I want to fight a match with you!"

speaker: Fir
text: I-I'm sorry, Sir Noah. It was my first time in the arena...

speaker: Noah
text: If you asked another person, you would have been killed. You need to look your opponent over very carefully before choosing to fight.

speaker: Fir
text: And you must not hesitate to surrender if it looks like you're going to lose. Right?

speaker: Noah
text: Exactly. You can always win back your money, but if you lose your life, it's all over.

speaker: Fir
text: Yes!

speaker: Noah
text: What are your plans now? Are you going to stay here and work on your sword skills?

speaker: Fir
text: No. I'm planning to travel to the Western Isles.

speaker: Noah
text: The Western Isles? Why?

speaker: Fir
text: They're building a new mine there, and I heard that a lot of people are going there looking for work. They must be strong people if they're miners, so I thought it would be the ideal place to find people to fight for my training. And besides...

speaker: Noah
text: Besides?

speaker: Fir
text: The Western Isles is where my mother first met my father. She's dead now, but when she was my age she was also traveling around the world training her sword skills.

speaker: Noah
text: I see... You surprise me again.

speaker: Noah
text: All you were saying at first was, "I want to become strong, I want to become strong," right? So I thought swordplay was all you had interest in. But you were training because you wanted to be like your mother? I'm so happy that you do have a cute side!

speaker: Fir
text: What? ... Sir Noah! Please don't tease me!

speaker: Noah
text: Hahahaha!

speaker: Devias
text: The reinforcements should be arriving from the south soon. Hehe... That Lycia army'll be shocked when they get hit from behind!

speaker: Roy
text: Okay, the city should be under control by now. Now we have to recapture Castle Ostia and rescue Lilina!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, we are currently breaking down the gate to enter the castle. I understand that you want to get in quickly, but we are working as fast as we can, so please be patient!

speaker: Roy
text: ... Lilina.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Speaking of Lady Lilina... What do you think of Lord Hector's story, Master Roy?

speaker: Roy
text: You mean about the Dragons? They weren't myth, they were real... Lord Hector is one of the greatest battle tacticians in Lycia. And his army was decimated in such a short time...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Well, Bern's army is among the strongest in Elibe. I say, those Dragon Knights are indeed very formidable opponents.

speaker: Roy
text: Of course the Dragon Knights must have been tough enemies. But the real Dragons... I can't even imagine how powerful they must be. The weapons that are effective against Dragons... I wonder where they are?

speaker: Merlinus
text: I presume they must be the Divine Weapons.

speaker: Roy
text: So if we use those weapons, we can fight the Dragons effectively. But I wonder what a Divine Weapon is doing in Ostia?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Perhaps Lady Lilina knows that. Hmm, I do wish to know as well. Oh! Master Roy, our men have finished knocking down the gate. We can enter now!

speaker: Roy
text: All right! Charge! We will rescue Lilina, no matter what!

speaker: Roy
text: Excuse me, sir, are you Sir Zelots of the Ilia Mercenary Knights?

speaker: Zelots
text: And you are?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy. I'm the leader of the army that's fighting the rebels.

speaker: Zelots
text: You? Impressive... I was expecting somebody a little older.

speaker: Roy
text: I am here, respecting the will of Lord Hector.

speaker: Zelots
text: Lord Hector... We've lost a valuable person. He was a true warrior.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, and I want to retake Ostia, for Lord Hector's sake! And Lilina's sake...

speaker: Zelots
text: All right. Then we'll help you as much as we can.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you for your assistance.

speaker: Zelots
text: You can thank me after we've retaken the castle. Come, we must concentrate on the enemy right now.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes!

speaker: Roy
text: You're one of the Ilian mercenaries, right?

speaker: Trec
text: Hmmm? Yeah, so what?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy. I lead the Lycia Alliance Army...

speaker: Trec
text: Ah, then I'm going to be under your leadership from now.

speaker: Roy
text: What?? Is that okay?

speaker: Trec
text: Hm?

speaker: Roy
text: You don't have to check with your commander first?

speaker: Trec
text: Ah, don't worry about that. He said we were to join with the Lycia Alliance.

speaker: Roy
text: But did he really mean...

speaker: Trec
text: Really mean what? We're in the middle of a battle. If you take the time to check every little thing with your commander, you'll be dead. I'm not going against his orders, though.

speaker: Roy
text: .. All right.

speaker: Roy
text: You're one of the Ilian mercenaries, right?

speaker: Noah
text: Yeah. And what do you want?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy. I'm the leader of the Lycian Alliance Army.

speaker: Noah
text: Oh! I heard about you... From now on, is it all right if I join with you?

speaker: Roy
text: Are you sure that's all right?

speaker: Noah
text: What?

speaker: Roy
text: Don't you have to ask your commander if it's okay..?

speaker: Noah
text: He told us to join with the Lycia Alliance Army. That's enough for me.

speaker: Roy
text: But did he mean like this?

speaker: Noah
text: This is a battlefield. If you take your time to check everything with your commander, then you won't be able to act quickly in trouble. It's not good to disobey orders, but outside of that you can play it by ear.

speaker: Roy
text: I see... Thanks for telling me.

speaker: Zelots
text: Trec, we are going into the Lycia army's service.

speaker: Trec
text: Okay, sir.

speaker: Zelots
text: Hm, not the most enthusiastic response. You don't like the idea?

speaker: Trec
text: Eh? No, I have no problem with it.

speaker: Zelots
text: Oh, all right. Just thought I'd ask.

speaker: Trec
text: Lycia... Nah, we shouldn't have much trouble.

speaker: Zelots
text: Noah!

speaker: Noah
text: Sir Zelots, I'm sorry that I'm late.

speaker: Zelots
text: I heard you were coaching a young girl in the sword arts.

speaker: Noah
text: Yes... She was a little naive, so I couldn't help it.

speaker: Zelots
text: Is she not with you?

speaker: Noah
text: She said she was headed for the Western Isles.

speaker: Zelots
text: I see. Pity, I thought she might have been of some help if she were still here. But you, who ordinarily wouldn't start nosing around into other people's matters, a coach? Now that is unusual.

speaker: Noah
text: Do you think so, sir?

speaker: Zelots
text: Yes. Trec and I were joking around saying that you may have fancied the girl. But it is in the arena, so that probably wasn't the case.

speaker: Trec
text: General Zelots.

speaker: Zelots
text: Trec, what is it?

speaker: Trec
text: I just met with the Lycia Alliance leader.

speaker: Zelots
text: Ah, did you? Why didn't you tell me, then?

speaker: Trec
text: Oh, not like that. I just met with him now.

speaker: Zelots
text: That's fine. Then it's time for us to submit to his leadership. Trec, I leave the negotiations with the Lycian Alliance to you.

speaker: Trec
text: Yes sir!

speaker: Noah
text: General Zelots!

speaker: Zelots
text: Ah, it's Noah. You were at the arena, weren't you?

speaker: Noah
text: Yes, sorry I'm late.

speaker: Zelots
text: Doesn't really matter... We've just started fighting. I haven't talked to the Lycia Alliance army yet.

speaker: Noah
text: Oh? Don't worry, I just got done talking to their leader.

speaker: Zelots
text: Really! Then it's time for us to submit to his leadership. Noah, I leave the negotiations with the Lycia Alliance to you.

speaker: Noah
text: Yes sir!

speaker: Devias
text: You... you beat Bern's Dragon Knights!? Ergh... I'll not let you pass here!

speaker: Devias
text: General Leygance... Please be careful... These people are... strong...

speaker: Devias
text: Bors! You returned!

speaker: Bors
text: Causing a rebellion during Lord Hector's absence?! That is unforgivable!

speaker: House
text: This...? This is the Torch staff! It creates light in the foggiest places! If you're in a fog, you can't attack or see anything! It helps to have this when it works against you.

speaker: House
text: A while back, some unknown person was dying in the street. When I helped him, he gave me this sword. Really strange person, but nice... Hm? Here's the sword. You can have it! Just take good care of it.

speaker: House
text: Hey you, look at this great thing I made. It fires arrows MUCH further than a normal bow! It's very useful, right? Right. Just like I thought. I'll give it to you guys, I want it with someone that knows how to use it.

speaker: House
text: Are you going to help Lady Lilina? Here's something that can cure injuries from a distance! If Lady Lilina's hurt, please help her...

speaker: House
text: Be careful. General Leygance is allied with Bern now! He went and slaughtered all those who resisted him... But I saved my own hide. Please take this, it's proof for heroes. Give this to them, and keep fighting to protect Ostia...

speaker: House
text: This town used to belong to Lycia! But now, look at it... You guys are out to restore Ostia's former glory, right? Then, take this gem... If you sell it, it will catch a high price! Please, help Ostia!

speaker: House
text: Social Knights, Paladins, Nomads... All those guys riding on horses... This spear, the Knight Killer, is effective against them. There's a lot of horsemen in the rebel army, so use this against them!

speaker: House
text: Medicine! Medicine! This cures anything! No matter what kind of wounds you have, this will restore you completely! The contents are a secret, though... Can't tell you, or I'll get in trouble. Hmm? You don't want the medicine? Aww, I'll give you some for free, if you buy it next time!

speaker: Brunnya
text: Your Majesty, we have captured the enemy leader.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Good. Bring him before me.

speaker: Hector
text: You... Zephiel, the King of Bern!!! Damn you...!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Ah, Lord Hector. I must praise your ability of putting up such a good fight against two of our Dragon Lords. I suppose they do not call you the leader of the Lycia Alliance for nothing. However, you were not good enough. Pray while you can, for you end here.

speaker: Hector
text: Why...?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Hm?

speaker: Hector
text: Bern and Lycia... We were always on good terms with each other. Even when you took the throne, we have always paid our respects towards Bern...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Respect? Don't be ridiculous. Lycia... no, this entire continent must go under my rule. That is the only way to liberate this world. I lack the time to be worrying about such trivial matters as respect.

speaker: Hector
text: To liberate... this world? What do you mean...?

speaker: Zephiel
text: It is of no importance to you. You are going to die anyway. Someone! Take him away! Throw Lord Hector into the dungeon!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Brunnya
text: Your Majesty, I will now return to the Sacae Plains.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Yes, you may be on your way.

speaker: Brunnya
text: ... One thing before I leave, your Majesty. I beg your pardon, but I do not think that it is such a good idea to put too much trust into sinister people...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Do you mean Idunn?

speaker: Brunnya
text: Yes. Our soldiers call her the 'Dark Priestess' and do not approve of her presence. I understand she is a shaman of great powers, however...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Brunnya, do you not have faith in me?

speaker: Brunnya
text: ...! Yes, of course I do, your Majesty! I just thought that...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Then all you do is follow my orders. Understood?

speaker: Brunnya
text: ... Yes. I will do whatever his Majesty wishes.

speaker: Zephiel
text: 'Do you not have faith in me?' Dear, dear, the things I say sometimes...

speaker: Roy
text: So Lord Hector is still alive?!

speaker: Chad
text: Yeah, that's for sure. I saw some of Bern's soldiers take him into the castle.

speaker: Roy
text: Chad, was it? Do you know the inside of Castle Araphen well?

speaker: Chad
text: I guess... Wait, are you guys planning on going in to save Lord Hector? I wouldn't try that if I were you. The bulk of Bern's forces are gone, but there are still a decent number of soldiers in the castle, you know? It would be suicide to try and charge them with your army.

speaker: Roy
text: Perhaps. But we can't afford to lose Lord Hector. And you said that their main forces are gone, right? Then there is a chance we could win.

speaker: Chad
text: I see... Then I guess I'll go along too. I can show you around the castle.

speaker: Roy
text: What?! No, no, don't feel pressured! If you could just explain what the interior of the castle looks like...

speaker: Chad
text: I also want revenge against Bern. C'mon, let me go with you!

speaker: Roy
text: All right. Then I'll be counting on you.

speaker: Chad
text: Of course! Leave locked chests and doors to me!

speaker: Guinevere
text: ... Master Roy... I beg your forgiveness of my brother's doings... I didn't think he would invade Lycia so soon...

speaker: Roy
text: My Lady, there's no point in dwelling over the past. Please do not blame yourself. Besides, Lycia is still intact. If we could get our leader, Lord Hector, out of harm's way, we can unite Lycia once again and fight! We must recapture Castle Araphen for all of our sakes... and for Lilina's sake...

speaker: Roy
text: Let's go!

speaker: Lugh
text: Thanks for taking care of the children, Reverend.

speaker: Priest
text: Of course. We of the Elimine Church will take good care of the orphans. And what will you do, Lugh?

speaker: Lugh
text: I'm going to stay here. I still have some things to do.

speaker: Priest
text: I see... Please do not stress yourself.

speaker: Lugh
text: Yes, thank you.

speaker: Lugh
text: Make sure you listen to what the priest says, okay?

speaker: Boy
text: Aren't you coming with us, Lugh?

speaker: Lugh
text: I'm going to wait for Chad, and then we'll catch up with you...

speaker: Girl
text: Yay! Chad's coming too?

speaker: Lugh
text: That's right.

speaker: Boy
text: Then I want Raigh to come too!

speaker: Lugh
text: Yeah... It would be great if Raigh came back and we could all go together, wouldn't it?

speaker: Priest
text: Children, we must be off.

speaker: Boy
text: See you later, Lugh.

speaker: Girl
text: Hurry and catch up, okay?

speaker: Lugh
text: Sure...

speaker: Lugh
text: Sorry... But I've chosen not to run anymore.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Narcian! What is causing all that noise?

speaker: Narcian
text: Probably what's left of the enemy are trying to put up a fight in their last hope.

speaker: Idunn
text: Your Highness, should we use the Dragons?

speaker: Narcian
text: No, I do not wish to put the Dark Priestess through any trouble. Do not worry, we can handle them by ourselves...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Not this time, Idunn. Send the Dragons back to Bern, as we planned.

speaker: Idunn
text: Yes, if his Highness wishes it to be so.

speaker: Zephiel
text: I will be off to Bern soon as well. Narcian, I'm going to leave Lycia up to you.

speaker: Narcian
text: ... What shall I do with the remaining forces of the Lycia Army?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Kill all those that stand against us.

speaker: Narcian
text: ... Does that include women and children?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Of course. Annihilate them enough so that they would no longer even think about going against us.

speaker: Narcian
text: Leave that to me, sire. Hehehe...

speaker: Narcian
text: Hmph, I wonder what his Majesty sees in that Idunn girl. Well, I think I'll be going as well. Slater, I'm trusting this castle with you.

speaker: Slater
text: Are you leaving?

speaker: Narcian
text: Yes. One of the marquesses who turned against Lycia has a special gift for me. He says it's a girl from Etrurian nobility or something... Hehehe...

speaker: Slater
text: From Etruria? She must be very beautiful, then!

speaker: Narcian
text: Yes, the marquess tells me she's still young but very beautiful.

speaker: Slater
text: I would be looking forward to it if I were you, sir. Please be careful on your way there.

speaker: Narcian
text: You be careful too, Slater. Don't you dare get defeated by these remainders of Lycia's army. If you do, I will personally tear you apart.

speaker: Slater
text: ... Have mercy, sir...!

speaker: Narcian
text: Hahahaha...!

speaker: Lugh
text: Excuse me! You're from the Lycian Army, right? Please let me fight with you! I don't have any useful information, but I can use a bit of magic! Please let me help you!

speaker: Lugh
text: Chad! You're okay!

speaker: Chad
text: Lugh!? What are you doing here?

speaker: Lugh
text: We all fled to here.

speaker: Chad
text: Oh... Where's everybody else? Are they all right?

speaker: Lugh
text: Yeah. The Elimine Church is going to take care of them for a while.

speaker: Chad
text: What about you?

speaker: Lugh
text: What?

speaker: Chad
text: How come you're still here?

speaker: Lugh
text: ... The same reason as you.

speaker: Chad
text: !? Lugh, you're not thinking of...!

speaker: Lugh
text: I can use some magic! You know, when I borrowed the Fire spell from Father's room?

speaker: Chad
text: Lugh, don't force yourself. You can't hurt people, can you?

speaker: Lugh
text: But...

speaker: Chad
text: I'm going to avenge Father. Lugh, you should stay with the others.

speaker: Lugh
text: I'm not going to hide anymore! Everyone, everyone just disappears when I'm not looking! Father, you, even Lleu... I want to fight to protect the people that I care for. I want to protect and not be just protected!

speaker: Chad
text: Lugh... All right then, let's crush Bern as soon as possible and go meet everyone else!

speaker: Lugh
text: Yeah!

speaker: Village
text: You're the remnants of the Lycian Army, right? Here, take this and go quickly. There are a bunch of Bern soldiers here. Bern may govern this whole area, but we're friends of Lycia!

speaker: Slater
text: I-I won't lose! If I don't win... ... Oh... No...!!!

speaker: Slater
text: Sir Narcian... Please... have mercy...!!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! We have found Lord Hector in the dungeon level!

speaker: Roy
text: Really!? Is he all right?

speaker: Merlinus
text: He's severely wounded...

speaker: Hector
text: Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Hector! What an awful wound...! We must treat it! Here, lean on my shoulder..

speaker: Hector
text: It's all right... I won't last much longer...

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Hector...

speaker: Hector
text: I was taken by surprise... I never would have guessed that Bern had resurrected the Dragons...!

speaker: Roy
text: Dragons!?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes... The Dragons that we humans fought in the past...

speaker: Roy
text: The Scouring? I have heard of it. A long time ago, two races that each had half of Elibe, the humans and the Dragons, fought over total control of the continent...

speaker: Hector
text: Right... the "Eight Heroes"... defeated the Dragons and led us humans... to... victory...

speaker: Roy
text: How did Bern use the Dragons...?

speaker: Hector
text: I... have no idea... But... the Dragons had control of what is now Bern in the past... and Hartmut, one of the Eight Heroes... is the founder of Bern... Perhaps... the reason... lies there...

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: Roy... Go to Ostia...! ... You must... lead what is left of the Lycia Alliance Army... instead of me...

speaker: Roy
text: Me...? But...

speaker: Hector
text: Don't worry... in Ostia... are weapons that... are effective against Dragons...

speaker: Roy
text: Weapons?

speaker: Hector
text: I have already told this to Lilina... Please take care of her too... She... may seem strong... But she is still a child... Please... give... her support...

speaker: Roy
text: ... Yes, I will.

speaker: Hector
text: ... Lilina... Just... one... more...... time...!!!

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Hector!

speaker: Brunnya
text: So... Narshen fell at Aquleia.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, General Brunnya. It has been confirmed.

speaker: Brunnya
text: I see...

speaker: Roartz
text: L-Lady Brunnya... What will become of us?

speaker: Brunnya
text: Please do not worry, Lord Roartz. You have assisted us, so we will not abandon you. I shall assure that.

speaker: Arcard
text: Thank you...

speaker: Brunnya
text: Then, Lord Arcard, you will be assigned the defense of this land, Talas. Lord Roartz, your post will be the city of Bulgar.

speaker: Arcard
text: Talas!? W-Wait! This is too close to Aquleia. The enemy will be here in no time!

speaker: Brunnya
text: Then all must do is defeat them. This is an ideal post to set up a defense. Since it is so close to Aquleia, the enemy will be sure to attack. We can be most prepared here.

speaker: Arcard
text: Well, that’s true...

speaker: Roartz
text: Bulgar...that is deep in the foreign lands of Sacae. I hear that there is much rebellion among the nomads...

speaker: Brunnya
text: Then force them into submission. Is that not your specialty?

speaker: Roartz
text: Well...

speaker: Brunnya
text: Rumors say that the enemy commander, Roy, is still a boy. Still, he has prevailed through many scandals and conspiracies to rebuild the Lycia Alliance Army and strengthen it further than ever. Compared to his hardships, yours are close to nothing. Am I wrong?

speaker: Brunnya
text: Then I must be off. I will be praying for your success.

speaker: Soldier
text: ...Are you sure, my lady?

speaker: Brunnya
text: Those two are disgraceful cowards who cast away their homeland to save their own skins. We must not assist them any more than necessary. They should be thankful that they are getting the land and troops that they are.

speaker: Yoder
text: We are soon approaching the Etrurian border.

speaker: Roy
text: Bishop Yoder, thank you for everything. Thanks to the Church, we were able to proceed thus far with ease.

speaker: Yoder
text: Please. If you had not captured Aquleia, we would be suffering from persecution under Bern. This is nothing in comparison to what you did for us.

speaker: Roy
text: I am glad that I could be of use to you.

speaker: Yoder
text: Now... May I ask you a very important favor?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, anything that I am capable of.

speaker: Yoder
text: If you find out anything else about the Dragons...

speaker: Roy
text: I understand. If I discover anything new, I will report to you immediately.

speaker: Yoder
text: Thank you! ...Ah, yes, I must tell you something else. The lands around here... They are surrounded by high mountains and valleys. And now that night has fallen...

speaker: Roy
text: The perfect setting for an ambush...

speaker: Yoder
text: Exactly. Castle Talas up ahead is under Bern’s control.

speaker: Roy
text: All right. I will be careful.

speaker: Yoder
text: Yes, please. Then, may Saint Elimine bless the Etrurian Army!

speaker: Arcard
text: W-Why! Why is this happening to me!?

speaker: Arcard
text: I...am an Etrurian...noble! I must not...die...here... Guh!

speaker: Arcard
text: Klein! You would betray me?

speaker: Klein
text: You are the one who betrayed Etruria, Lord Arcard!

speaker: Arcard
text: D-Douglas! You had turned to the enemy...!?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Arcard... What a pathetic ending for one who became so powerful.

speaker: Roy
text: Well, last year, I didn’t think we would be fighting in Sacae, either. Fate can turn out in the most unlikely ways... And that might be true for Bern as well.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...? Master Roy, what is it that you are holding in your hand?

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, this? This is the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh... So this tiny gem is...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere wanted me to keep it. It seemed...difficult for her to give it to me... She must have been truly hoping to end the war peacefully until now...where this is no hope left...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hmm... Trust between siblings? It didn’t seem likely on the outside.

speaker: Roy
text: Why not?

speaker: Merlinus
text: The enemy is Zephiel, king of Bern! It is said that he murdered his own father, so I didn’t think that he would be moved by mere family relations...

speaker: Roy
text: What!? He killed his own father?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Didn’t you know, Master Roy? Zephiel took the throne because the former king had died. But because the former king’s death was so sudden, there are many rumors going around.

speaker: Roy
text: And one of them is...

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...That King Zephiel assassinated him.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Does Princess Guinevere know about this?

speaker: Merlinus
text: She must know something about it, if not all.

speaker: Windham
text: Lord Roartz fled!? Then what will happen to me, who turned against the Church?

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir, Lord Roartz’s message is that he ‘doesn’t want to waste time dealing with useless bishops who cannot even tame the Elimine Church.'

speaker: Windham
text: This is all because that damned Yoder got in my way...

speaker: Soldier
text: Well, yes... But even if you tell me about it...

speaker: Windham
text: ...All right, fine... This is our last mission. If we are to die, then the Lycia Alliance Army will be going down with us! Prepare the Heavenly Arrows!

speaker: Soldier
text: B-But Bishop Windham! If we use those, they may hit our allies as well!

speaker: Windham
text: Quiet! I do the ordering around here! ...I shall show them...hahaha...!

speaker: Douglas
text: This is the Tower of the Saint. Saint Elimine’s weapon, the Aerial spell book, lies here.

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Douglas, thank you for helping us when we were your enemies just a while earlier.

speaker: Douglas
text: You do not have to thank me. The king ordered me to help you. Do not worry about it.

speaker: Douglas
text: Besides, you are the saviors of Etruria. It is an honor to be able to fight along your side.

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Douglas...

speaker: Windham
text: Die! All of you! Everything shall be destroyed!

speaker: Windham
text: Hahaha! Haha…ha…

speaker: Soldier
text: Master Roy, I think we have found the spell book.

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Douglas, is this...?

speaker: Douglas
text: Yes, this is it. This is the Pinnacle of Light, the Aerial spell book, Saint Elimine’s weapon.

speaker: Roy
text: May we use it?

speaker: Douglas
text: The king told you to use anything in the tower that you might find useful. And the Elimine Church is on our side as well. If we still have trouble, then I can negotiate with them.

speaker: Roy
text: All right. Thank you, Lord Douglas.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, I must speak with you.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Is it that we must attack Bern as well after Etruria?

speaker: Roy
text: ! Did someone inform you?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No. ...But I knew that it would happen eventually.

speaker: Roy
text: ...We cannot leave Bern running around freely any longer. I know that it will be hard to see your nation invaded, but...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Roy, I will give this to you.

speaker: Roy
text: What is this?

speaker: Guinevere
text: It is Bern’s greatest treasure...the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Roy
text: What!?

speaker: Guinevere
text: In the south of Bern lies a temple called the Temple of Seals. In it lies the sword that our founder, Hartmut, used.

speaker: Roy
text: Is it...one of the Divine Weapons?

speaker: Guinevere
text: I believe so. It was a sword made to slay the Dark Dragon, the leader of the Dragons during the Scouring. However, it held power so immense that it was sealed away after the war. The Fire Emblem is the key to break its seal.

speaker: Roy
text: The key...

speaker: Guinevere
text: My brother...is trying to force the world into submission through power. That is not forgivable, no matter what the reason.

speaker: Guinevere
text: To stop him, all we can do is defeat the Dragon at his side.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...My name shall be stained in history, as the woman who betrayed her nation.

speaker: Roy
text: No...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I shall be hated all my life as a traitor. Roy, promise me one thing. When we invade Bern, promise me that you will not harm the civilians...

speaker: Roy
text: I promise. Please trust me.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Thank you.

speaker: Bandit
text: B-Boss! An army's invading our cave!

speaker: Henning
text: What! How many of them are there?

speaker: Bandit
text: Dunno, Boss. I hope there aren't too many of them...

speaker: Henning
text: That's strange... The Lycia marquesses should be having bigger problems than dealing with bandits like us.

speaker: Bandit
text: Well? What do we do?

speaker: Henning
text: They probably don't know much about this cave, anyway. Just lure them into stepping on the floor tiles where hot lava spurts and get rid of 'em.

speaker: Lilina
text: Roy, over here! The Divine Weapon is located on the other side of this lava pit.

speaker: Roy
text: Lilina, are you all right? Have you calmed down?

speaker: Lilina
text: Well... maybe I'm not fully all right, but now isn't the time to be sad. I need to protect Ostia, like my father before me.

speaker: Roy
text: All right... Good for you, Lilina.

speaker: Lilina
text: I'm okay because you're with me, Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: What? Did you just say something?

speaker: Lilina
text: No, nothing. Anyway, I'll tell you what I know about this Divine Weapon. The one here is the sword that was used by Roland, one of the 'Eight Heroes.'

speaker: Roy
text: That Roland... is that King Roland, the first king of Ostia?

speaker: Lilina
text: Right, he's our ancestor. This sword is called 'The Blazing Sword,' or the Durandal.

speaker: Roy
text: The Durandal... the name has a strange echo to it. So Roland used the Durandal to fight the Dragons during the Scouring.

speaker: Lilina
