text: That's how the legend goes. They also say that after the war ended, Roland returned to his hometown of Ostia. He raised the Durandal high above his head, and the land that had become barren after the war suddenly became lush with vegetation and life again.

speaker: Roy
text: Wow... that must be some sword.

speaker: Lilina
text: Well, it's a weapon that can defeat Dragons. It must have some special powers in it.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes... Oh yeah, I heard that a group of bandits has made its base here. Is it going to be all right?

speaker: Lilina
text: ? Is what going to be all right?

speaker: Roy
text: I mean, there's always the chance that they might have taken the Durandal.

speaker: Lilina
text: No, don't worry. Only those who are Roland's successors know how to remove the Durandal from its sheath.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, okay. Then everything is fine. All we have to do is to get rid of the bandits and obtain the Durandal.

speaker: Henning
text: Sigh. What are you guys doing in a place like this? Oh well, but since you're already here... I can't let you guys go, can I?

speaker: Henning
text: Crap... I knew this would happen...

speaker: Lilina
text: Roy! Here it is!

speaker: Roy
text: So this is the Durandal... It's a very large sword. I don't think many of us are going to be able to swing it.

speaker: Lilina
text: But history has it that Roland was a small man. I think it's the person's skill that determines whether he can use it or not.

speaker: Roy
text: Then if I become better with my sword, I can use it as well?

speaker: Lilina
text: Well... maybe.

speaker: Roy
text: Maybe? Come on... at least say 'probably.'

speaker: Lilina
text: Hee hee!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! Bern's Dragon Knights have appeared at Castle Ostia!

speaker: Roy
text: What! They're here already?

speaker: Narcian
text: Hehehe... Are you Roy? I must thank you for getting rid of that idiot Leygance for me. Now, you will leave Ostia to me.

speaker: Roy
text: Don't be ridiculous! Who would give Ostia to the likes of you..!

speaker: Narcian
text: Oh? Then do you wish to fight us with that sad little group of yours? I shall annihilate you, as I did with Hector!

speaker: Roy
text: Damn!
That's enough!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian! A legion has arrived from Etruria!

speaker: Narcian
text: I can see that, you fool! Why...

speaker: Percival
text: I am Percival, Knight General of Etruria. Yesterday, Mage General Cecilia informed me that Ostia had requested Etruria's protection.

speaker: Narcian
text: What...!

speaker: Cecilia
text: You seem discontent. We are prepared for battle. But can those Dragon Knights of yours stand a chance against all of us?

speaker: Narcian
text: You...!

speaker: Cecilia
text: I am Cecilia, Mage General of Etruria! Ostia is now under our protection.

speaker: Narcian
text: Argh... You... you...!!!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian, please control your temper! General Percival is one of the strongest warriors in Etruria! And with General Cecilia here as well we'll be slaughtered!

speaker: Narcian
text: I know! We're leaving! Cecilia, is it? Watch your back from now on!

speaker: Percival
text: Are you General Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army?

speaker: Roy
text: Y-Yes! I am in charge of the Alliance Army in the place of Lord Hector.

speaker: Percival
text: I see. Lycia is in a time of hardship. Our king also sends his words of regret for Lord Hector's death.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you for your consideration. If Etruria hadn't helped us... Ostia would be under Bern's control now. Thank you very much.

speaker: Percival
text: I'm not the one to thank. I simply followed my king's orders. You should thank Cecilia, who went against the king to help you.

speaker: Roy
text: She... disobeyed the king's orders?

speaker: Percival
text: Yes, now isn't that something? Well, I must be off. Two of the three Etrurian Generals shouldn't be leaving the country for so long. Cecilia, can you take care of the rest?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes. Thank you, Percival. You can leave the rest to me.

speaker: Roy
text: Whew... General Percival... Now he's someone.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Nervous, were you?

speaker: Roy
text: General Cecilia! It is good to see you again.

speaker: Cecilia
text: How are you doing, Roy? You look a little tired, but you seem okay.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, thanks to Etruria, we were able to avoid disaster.

speaker: Cecilia
text: I'm glad we made it here in time.

speaker: Roy
text: I'm sorry. I put you through a lot of trouble.

speaker: Cecilia
text: No. It's going to be beneficial for Etruria for Ostia to go under our protection.

speaker: Roy
text: Beneficial?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes. Bern's been acting aggressively these days, as you know. We also want to do something about it, but since we haven't been directly invaded, we have no reason to go to war with them. But if Bern gets any stronger, the balance of powers would be shattered.

speaker: Roy
text: So when Ostia requested protection, you saw it as a good reason to declare war on Bern?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Right. We just did what would be best for us. You don't need to feel that you're in our debt.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes.

speaker: Cecilia
text: So you shouldn't thank us.

speaker: Roy
text: Understood. I won't. Well anyway, come in and meet the rest of our army.

speaker: Cecilia
text: ... He's gotten so bold in the short time that I haven't seen him. Well, he is a boy, after all.

speaker: Ohtz
text: Haven’t you found the Divine Weapon yet!?

speaker: Soldier
text: We think it is inside this altar, but it won’t open...

speaker: Ohtz
text: Break it open, then! We don’t have much time.

speaker: Soldier
text: But we must also deal with the enemies that have entered the temple! We don’t have enough manpower to use force on the altar.

speaker: Ohtz
text: Very well, defeat the enemy first! Then we shall examine the altar with leisure.

speaker: Roy
text: This is the underground of the desert? There’s so much...water.

speaker: Sophia
text: This is close...to a large source of groundwater... That is why...plants and animals can live near here...

speaker: Roy
text: I see, so that’s why you were able to build a village here. Still, how did you find such a convenient place like this?

speaker: Sophia
text: Athos... Archsage Athos is the one...who led us here...

speaker: Roy
text: What? Do you mean Athos of the Eight Heroes?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... After the Scouring...Athos traveled around Elibe... At the end of his journey, he arrived at our village...in which men and Dragons were living in harmony... But he said that...it would only be a matter of time before we were found...

speaker: Roy
text: So he led you here...

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... And he hid his Divine Weapon...inside this temple...

speaker: Roy
text: Can we use his Divine Weapon?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... Athos told us...to use his weapon to protect Arcadia... And your fight against Bern...will lead to our safety...

speaker: Roy
text: All right. Thanks.

speaker: Sophia
text: Some of the temple’s passages...may suddenly sink into the water... Please be careful...

speaker: Ohtz
text: I…wasn’t expecting you to fight so well against all of us.

speaker: Ohtz
text: Where…did you learn to fight…like this…

speaker: Sophia
text: The Divine Weapon is here...inside this altar...

speaker: Roy
text: ... It won’t open.

speaker: Sophia
text: This altar is made...so that only those of the village may open it... Please allow me...

speaker: Roy
text: Okay.

speaker: Sophia
text: ...... Here... This is the Divine Weapon...

speaker: Roy
text: Athos’ Divine Weapon? Then...

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... The Infernal Element...Foreblaze...

speaker: Elder Of Arcadia
text: Who are you? How did you enter here?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy. I came with Sophia to protect this village.

speaker: Elder
text: With Sophia...? Then it was you who drove off Bern’s soldiers? Oh... Please forgive my impudence. I am the Elder of Arcadia.

speaker: Roy
text: Elder... Then are you the Dragon?

speaker: Elder
text: Dragon... They once called me that. But that is a story of a time long since past.

speaker: Elder
text: Let me see... The only real Dragon we have is Fa right here.

speaker: Fa
text: Hi...

speaker: Roy
text: This little girl is a Dragon?

speaker: Elder
text: Yes, although she is far from her mature form.

speaker: Roy
text: Elder, do you know anything about the Dragons in Bern?

speaker: Elder
text: What! There are Dragons in Bern?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, we have seen them.

speaker: Elder
text: Why...? Dragons do not exist anywhere except here.

speaker: Igrene
text: Elder, if I may.

speaker: Elder
text: What is it, Igrene?

speaker: Igrene
text: Sophia said that she could detect evil energy coming from Bern’s troops. That may have something to do with the Dragons Master Roy says he saw in Bern’s army.

speaker: Elder
text: Perhaps... But I am too old to detect such energy now.

speaker: Roy
text: Energy? What is that?

speaker: Elder
text: Sophia is half Dragon, half human. That gives her the ability to detect the pulses emitted from other Dragons. But because she can’t detect them clearly, she only said that she felt a force...twisted and unnatural.

speaker: Igrene
text: I think that we should look into it. Elder, if you would allow it, I would like to join Master Roy and look at Bern’s Dragons myself.

speaker: Elder
text: I really do not want to deal with matters of the outside... But this is a time of emergency. Well then, Roy, will you take her?

speaker: Roy
text: Certainly.

speaker: Igrene
text: I am Igrene, the Guardian of Nabata. I have confidence in my skills with the bow. I believe I may be of some help in battle.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you.

speaker: Fa
text: Fa’s going, too!

speaker: Elder
text: What are you saying? Of course you may not. There is no telling what could happen if your existence were exposed to the world!

speaker: Roy
text: Well then, let’s go.

speaker: Igrene
text: Yes.

speaker: Fa
text: ...Fine... Fa will just follow them anyway!

speaker: Pereth
text: So the battle above the ground was lost...

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes.

speaker: Pereth
text: I would have liked to be at Lord Murdock’s side when he fell.

speaker: Soldier
text: ...We share your feelings.

speaker: Pereth
text: However, we have an important mission from Lord Murdock. We must defend this Divine Weapon. The Silencing Darkness, Apocalypse, must not fall into the enemy’s hands!

speaker: Roy
text: There’s a Divine Weapon under here?

speaker: Melady
text: Yes, I believe so. I have only heard rumors within the army, but apparently there is a spell book here that was placed to protect the Temple of Seals from intruders.

speaker: Elffin
text: This place is guarded by Bern’s troops as well. It is highly probable that the spell book that she speaks of is a Divine Weapon.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. We’re going up against Zephiel soon. ...I want to have as many weapons as possible ready before we enter the castle. We have to get that book.

speaker: Melady
text: I have also heard rumors that there are traps all over the underground level.

speaker: Roy
text: Traps?

speaker: Melady
text: Yes. Apparently, they are crafted so well that we have no chance of finding them before they go off. Perhaps Thieves would be better at spotting the traps... Anyway, please be careful.

speaker: Roy
text: All right. Let’s be wary.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, is this where the Divine Weapon is?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Probably... I have only heard rumors that there is a spell book here that was placed to protect the Temple of Seals from intruders.

speaker: Elffin
text: This place is guarded by Bern’s troops as well. It is highly probable that the spell book that she speaks of is a Divine Weapon.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. We’re going up against Zephiel soon. ...I want to have as many weapons as possible ready before we enter the castle. We have to get that book.

speaker: Guinevere
text: I also understand that there are numerous traps placed in the underground level.

speaker: Roy
text: Traps?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes. They are designed so well that it would be impossible for us to find them. Perhaps Thieves would be better at finding them... Please be careful.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, Princess. We will be careful.

speaker: Pereth
text: Darkness from an age long forgotten… I will show you its power.

speaker: Pereth
text: Dark… It is getting so…dark…

speaker: Roy
text: Elffin, do you know what this spell book is?

speaker: Elffin
text: ...It is probably the Apocalypse spell book.

speaker: Roy
text: Apocalypse?

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes, it is also known as the Silencing Darkness. Brammimond... the most mysterious of the Eight Heroes...used it.

speaker: Roy
text: Brammimond... I only know his name.

speaker: Elffin
text: We don’t even know if Brammimond was male or female, old or young. None of the ancient scrolls say anything specific about Brammimond.

speaker: Roy
text: I see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy, is something wrong?

speaker: Roy
text: No, I was just thinking.

speaker: Guinevere
text: About what?

speaker: Roy
text: I was wondering why there’s always some kind of trap where a Divine Weapon lies.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Perhaps it is to warn people that their power is too great to be dealt with lightly.

speaker: Roy
text: But still... The traps are so carefully set. There must be other reasons.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...I wondered about the same thing. Perhaps I shall look into it.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes... Please.

speaker: Melady
text: I see... So Princess Guinivere is nowhere on the Western Isles?

speaker: Oro
text: We searched all over these islands, and we sent spies in to Lycian League, but we could not find the princess anywhere, I'm sorry.

speaker: Melady
text: I understand. I suppose I will search elsewhere. Bishop Oro, I thank you for your cooperation with Bern.

speaker: Oro
text: I will pray that you will be able to meet Princess Guinivere soon.

speaker: Melady
text: Thank you.

speaker: Etruria Soldier
text: Bishop Oro, who was that?

speaker: Oro
text: A Dragon Knight from Bern. Her name is Melady. She was looking for Princess Guinivere, who is her mistress.

speaker: Etruria Soldier
text: Did you tell her where the princess is?

speaker: Oro
text: Of course not. Princess Guinivere is a valuable hostage. When Advisor Roartz heard the news that Cecilia was hiding with Guinivere in Aquleia, he was as excited as the time when he reported the assassination of Prince Myrddin had been successful.

speaker: Etruria Soldier
text: Bishop Oro! You mustn't say he was assassinated...

speaker: Oro
text: Oh, I must watch my tongue. Anyway, Guinivere has much value.

speaker: Etruria Soldier
text: I see...

speaker: Oro
text: And now, why did you come before me? Did you not have something to say?

speaker: Etruria Soldier
text: Yes, my lord. It is about the village where the resistance leader is hiding. We are now prepared to launch an attack on the village, so I came to report.

speaker: Oro
text: All right, well done. Then start your attack immediately, before we have any unwanted interruptions...

speaker: Roy
text: So the resistance hideout is in one of these villages here?

speaker: Larum
text: Yes. But it's possible the landlord's troops have attacked it already.

speaker: Merlinus
text: I must say, that Oro is a despicable man. A bishop should be preaching the words of God to help the people. But in fact he is torturing his people! That is far from forgivable.

speaker: Roy
text: We should probably wait for General Cecilia's reply, but...

speaker: Lycia Solider
text: Master Roy! Troops from the castle are attacking the villages!

speaker: Merlinus
text: What! Master Roy, should we attack?

speaker: Roy
text: I guess we can't wait for her reply then... But I want to help the people here. Even if it means that we'll be on bad terms with Etruria.

speaker: Larum
text: Roy..

speaker: Roy
text: Let's fight!! So we can be proud of our actions when we return to Lycia!

speaker: Galle
text: Melady, did you find out anything about Princess Guinevere?

speaker: Melady
text: No... It looks like she left the Lycia Alliance Army. Just when I thought I had found her...

speaker: Galle
text: Well, then it’s no use looking here, I suppose.

speaker: Melady
text: Galle...I’m sorry. My squad was the only one assigned to look for the princess because King Zephiel wanted to keep it in secrecy. I’m sorry that I got you into this mess...

speaker: Galle
text: You have enough to worry about already... Don’t fret over things like that.

speaker: Melady
text: But you’re one of the captains working directly under General Murdock...

speaker: Galle
text: Don’t worry about that, General Murdock has agreed to my helping you. Anyway, Princess Guinevere must still be on the mainland. I guess we can ask General Narshen for help.

speaker: Melady
text: ...You’re going to bow down to Narshen?

speaker: Galle
text: ? Of course. He’s one of the Three Dragon Lords, and he’s leading the divisions in Lycia and Etruria.

speaker: Melady
text: Galle, aren’t you...mad?

speaker: Galle
text: About what?

speaker: Melady
text: I mean... You’re the one who should be a Dragon Lord. ...But Narshen accused you of not being a native of Bern, and he snatched the position away. And you’re going to bow down to him and ask him for help?

speaker: Galle
text: Well, what he said was true. I wasn’t born in Bern.

speaker: Melady
text: But...

speaker: Galle
text: Melady, don’t worry. I’m happy with the position I have now. King Zephiel and General Murdock put trust in me, even though I’m not a native of Bern. What more could I ask?

speaker: Melady
text: Galle...

speaker: Oro
text: Hahaha... I’ve got an idea... Someone!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Bishop Oro?

speaker: Oro
text: Tell the bandits that the villagers in chaos. I want them to ransack the villages and collect the valuables.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes. But... Are you sure? If this becomes public...

speaker: Oro
text: You forget that I speak for God Himself. If anyone tries to accuse me, he would be accusing God. There is no one on this island who can prosecute me! Now hurry. It will be a chance wasted if the crisis in the villages settles down.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes.

speaker: Klein
text: So that’s the Lycia Alliance Army...

speaker: Thea
text: They’re supposed to be fighting against the bandits...

speaker: Klein
text: I know. But Lord Arcard says that they are working with the bandits to attack innocent villagers. Why are they doing the opposite of what they were told...?

speaker: Klein
text: Thea, can you take your troops and attack from the north? I’ll start attacking from here.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes, General Klein.

speaker: Klein
text: Thea! Wait.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes?

speaker: Klein
text: I heard that you have some siblings.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes. I have two sisters, one older, one younger.

speaker: Klein
text: Are they both Pegasus Knights like you?

speaker: Thea
text: Yes. Why do you ask?

speaker: Klein
text: Well, you see, I have a younger sister myself...

speaker: Thea
text: You have a sister? She must be very beautiful.

speaker: Klein
text: Thank you. Yes, she is pretty. But I heard that she got tangled up in some, mess and I don’t know where she is now...

speaker: Thea
text: What? Oh my...

speaker: Klein
text: I’ve sent out some people to look for her, but they haven’t had any luck. If I weren’t on this mission, I would go search for her myself...

speaker: Klein
text: Thea, take care of yourself. For your family’s sake.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes, thank you.

speaker: Klein
text: All right, let’s go.

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir, are you sure?

speaker: Klein
text: About what?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Arcard said to leave the fighting to Ilia’s Pegasus Knights so that we Etrurians suffer the least casualties.

speaker: Klein
text: Don’t be ridiculous, they are our companions and trustworthy comrades. We will fight full-force to support them. Understood?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, General Klein.

speaker: Klein
text: ...Still, Lord Arcard’s story is strange... The Alliance Army just got here. Would they get tied in with the bandits so quickly...?

speaker: Bandit
text: So you’re sure we can raid the villages as much as we want?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes. But in return...

speaker: Bandit
text: Yeah, yeah, we’re supposed to take half of the loot to the castle, right? That’s one hell of a bishop you guys got yourselves over there.

speaker: Soldier
text: Thank you for your cooperation.

speaker: Bandit
text: All right, boys! Loot the villages! Grab all the treasure!

speaker: Soldier
text: Master Roy, bandits are appearing from the mountains in the east.

speaker: Roy
text: They’re thinking of attacking the villages during the confusion... We have to stop them!

speaker: Thea
text: Are you ready? We’re moving southward!

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain... Are you sure we’ll be all right?

speaker: Thea
text: Why?

speaker: Soldier
text: Perhaps the Etrurian army means to use us up front as pawns...

speaker: Thea
text: Who says that?

speaker: Soldier
text: One of our group heard rumors like that in the Etrurian army.

speaker: Thea
text: If you take rumors seriously all the time, you won’t be able to do anything in battle.

speaker: Soldier
text: But...

speaker: Thea
text: Besides, even if that were true, General Klein wouldn’t approve of it.

speaker: Soldier
text: Do you think so?

speaker: Thea
text: General Klein’s not like that. I trust him.

speaker: Soldier
text: ...All right. Then we’ll trust him as well, for we trust you, Captain.

speaker: Thea
text: Thanks. All right, let’s go!

speaker: Soldier
text: Echidna! We have surrounded this entire area! We know you’re hiding in there! Drop your weapons come out at once!

speaker: Soldier
text: Are you Echidna, the leader of the rebel forces?

speaker: Villager
text: Miss Echidna, I’m sorry! They took my family hostage to make me talk...

speaker: Echidna
text: Don’t worry, I understand. Leave this to me. Hurry home to your family now.

speaker: Villager
text: I’m sorry...really.

speaker: Soldier
text: If you surrender peacefully, perhaps Bishop Oro will have mercy on you.

speaker: Echidna
text: Sorry, but I’m sorta the stubborn type.

speaker: Soldier
text: Do you resist? Then we have no choice. Kill her!

speaker: Oro
text: What is taking so long!? Are the rebel forces that much of a problem?

speaker: Soldier
text: It’s the Lycia Alliance Army! They’re helping the rebels!

speaker: Oro
text: What!? The Lycia Alliance would turn against Etruria!?

speaker: Soldier
text: We have just received a message from the capital at Djuto! It says... ‘The Lycia Alliance Army is responsible for the murder of Duke Nord, and is suspected of treachery against Etruria. They may be allied with the bandits. Capture them!'

speaker: Oro
text: So they killed Nord... It looks like they’ve come up with a good excuse to get rid of the Alliance Army. Hahaha... Allied with the bandits. eh? How ironic...

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Arcard has also provided us with some reinforcements to help us defeat the Lycia Alliance Army. They should be arriving shortly.

speaker: Oro
text: How generous! He said to capture them, but he probably plans on killing them anyway. Let us do the job for him! Kill them all!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Bishop Oro!

speaker: Clarine
text: Klein!

speaker: Klein
text: Clarine!? You were safe! Thank goodness...

speaker: Clarine
text: I’m sorry I left without telling you... But I wanted to see you so badly.

speaker: Klein
text: The things you would do... Well, you’re safe, and that’s what matters. And what brings you out here? Did you find someone trustworthy to hire?

speaker: Clarine
text: No, I joined the Lycia Alliance Army and have been fighting alongside them.

speaker: Klein
text: The Lycia Alliance Army!?

speaker: Clarine
text: Yes, my healing staves have been very useful!

speaker: Klein
text: ..I see. I thought your eyes looked...sharper.

speaker: Clarine
text: I’m now a lady, I am.

speaker: Klein
text: ...Let me ask you this. What kind of an individual is General Roy?

speaker: Clarine
text: Hmm... He lacks a little finesse for a noble... I especially think that he has to take care of his hair a little better...

speaker: Klein
text: ...Let me rephrase the question. Is General Roy working with the bandits and attacking the people living on these islands?

speaker: Clarine
text: No, of course not! We are here to defeat the bandits!

speaker: Klein
text: I see...

speaker: Clarine
text: The Etrurians here are all malicious and evil people...it is so embarrassing! Klein...are you working for them?

speaker: Klein
text: No. At least not any after I heard your story.

speaker: Clarine
text: What?

speaker: Klein
text: I was sent here to protect the villagers. To fulfill my mission, I will hereby join the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Clarine
text: Klein!

speaker: Klein
text: Then let’s go, shall we? Will you introduce me to General Roy?

speaker: Clarine
text: Of course! I love you, Klein.

speaker: Klein
text: Thea!

speaker: Thea
text: General Klein! What is the matter?

speaker: Klein
text: I’ve made up my mind. We’re going to fight alongside General Roy in the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Thea
text: Understood, sir. Then we will as well.

speaker: Klein
text: Aren’t you going to ask why?

speaker: Thea
text: We are mercenaries. We follow our employer’s every order. Besides...

speaker: Klein
text: Besides...?

speaker: Thea
text: I trust your judgment, General Klein.

speaker: Klein
text: Thank you, Thea.

speaker: Larum
text: Echidna!

speaker: Echidna
text: Larum? You were all right? Good... If something happened to you, I wouldn’t know what to say to Elffin.

speaker: Larum
text: I’m sorry... If I hadn’t been caught, I could have told you about this earlier...

speaker: Echidna
text: It’s okay. Don’t worry.

speaker: Larum
text: But...

speaker: Echidna
text: Don’t cry over spilled milk. That’s not like you. And besides, I’m all in one piece. So everything’s fine, right?

speaker: Larum
text: ...Yeah.

speaker: Echidna
text: So anyway, who’s the army attacking the castle right now?

speaker: Larum
text: Roy and the Lycia Alliance Army! They came here to defeat the bandits.

speaker: Echidna
text: Lycia, eh? They’ve sure come a long ways to get here... And does it look like they’ll help us out?

speaker: Larum
text: Yeah! They helped me, too.

speaker: Echidna
text: All right, then I guess I’ll join, too! That’s okay, isn’t it?

speaker: Larum
text: Really? That would be great! I’m sure Roy would be glad, too.

speaker: Oro
text: Challenging me...is the equivalent of challenging God Himself. Take your punishment from my hands!

speaker: Oro
text: You…you heathen… I…represent God… Gah…!

speaker: Elen
text: You are...a priest, are you not?

speaker: Oro
text: What of it? Anything can go unpunished if done in the name of God! Convenient, is it not?

speaker: Elen
text: ...That’s unforgivable.

speaker: Saul
text: Well, we certainly have an evil bishop here, now, don’t we?

speaker: Oro
text: I am simply living life the way I see fit. Anything can go unpunished if done in the name of God. Convenient, is it not?

speaker: Saul
text: You disgrace God... You shall pay for that!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, there is a young man here to see you. He says he is a member of the rebels...

speaker: Roy
text: I’ll see him. Let him pass.

speaker: Elffin
text: Are you Master Roy? Pleased to meet you, my name is Elffin. I am a member of the rebel forces here.

speaker: Roy
text: I am Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Elffin
text: You have my thanks for saving our village here.

speaker: Roy
text: No, we simply did what we felt was right.

speaker: Elffin
text: But now you have rebelled against Etruria. Certainly you had thought of that before you took action?

speaker: Roy
text: Of course. As I said, we did what we felt was right. Although what we did is a sign of rebellion against Etruria, if the truth about these islands is made public, they will understand. I have sent a letter to a trustworthy member of the Etrurian court. If she takes the appropriate measures, I think we can tip the tables in our favor.

speaker: Elffin
text: I would not be so sure of that...

speaker: Roy
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Elffin
text: Did you ever think it odd...that Etruria sent you, in particular, to get rid of the bandits?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes... Of course we did.

speaker: Elffin
text: This is merely a theory... But I believe that the ones who requested your help are Advisor Roartz and Lord Arcard.

speaker: Roy
text: ...How do you know that?

speaker: Elffin
text: Why did they have to get your army off the mainland? Could there be some some sort of problem if you stayed in Lycia?

speaker: Roy
text: Oh... I never thought of it that way...

speaker: Elffin
text: There are rumors...that Roartz and Arcard are actually tied in with Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: What!? Then Lycia would be in danger!

speaker: Merlinus
text: M-Master Roy!

speaker: Elffin
text: Your country could be peril. Are you sure you want to be wasting your time on a little island like this?

speaker: Merlinus
text: He’s right! If Bern wanted to get us away from Lycia so they could invade, then we must return at once...

speaker: Roy
text: ...I’m not going back.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What!? Why!?

speaker: Roy
text: Right now, it’s very difficult to judge what information is true and what is false. The worst thing to do is is to simply jump to information presented in front of you. Sure, I’m worried about Lycia...but my father is there, and General Cecilia also promised to take care of our land. But our army is the only one stationed on these islands.

speaker: Merlinus
text: That’s true, but...

speaker: Roy
text: If we just leave without fully clearing out the bandits, then what we did so far would all be a lie...

speaker: Elffin
text: ...I see you are blessed with a wise leader.

speaker: Roy
text: What?

speaker: Elffin
text: Master Roy, I am sorry that I tried you so.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Tried us? So what you said was a lie!?

speaker: Elffin
text: I have not lied. But, I did present the rumor in such a way that you would easily jump to it. But Master Roy kept his head. I feel that I would like to serve an individual like you. Master Roy, please count me among your ranks.

speaker: Roy
text: ...I don’t like the idea that you were testing us, but if you’re willing to help, then we will welcome you.

speaker: Elffin
text: Then...

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, please fight alongside us. Well, then, back to business. What can we do to help the people on these isles?

speaker: Elffin
text: We must go to Djuto. The Etrurian capital is there. We must crush it to fully liberate the people.

speaker: Roy
text: All right. We’re going to Djuto! We will fight for the people living here, and to defeat our true enemy!

speaker: Man
text: Ah, are you General Roy?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes.

speaker: Man
text: You saved our village. Please take this as a token of our gratitude.

speaker: Soldier
text: General Klein, we will stay here and restructure the area, as you directed us.

speaker: Klein
text: Good.

speaker: Soldier
text: We wish we could fight alongside you. Oh, and here, here is the arrow that you had us keep. I will give it back to you. Farewell, and good luck, General Klein.

speaker: Klein
text: Thank you.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain! We will return to Ilia to make our report.

speaker: Thea
text: Thanks.

speaker: Soldier
text: Oh, and this... Your sister gave it to me before we left. Please be careful...

speaker: Thea
text: Thank you. You be careful too.

speaker: Zinc
text: Have you not found that resistance bard yet?

speaker: Soldier
text: We have a good lead, milord.

speaker: Zinc
text: Out with it then. Where is he?

speaker: Soldier
text: He's apparently in hiding in the nearby village.

speaker: Zinc
text: Removing Elffin the Bard will sever the brain behind the resistance force. Find him. Burn the village to the ground if you have to!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, milord!

speaker: Zinc
text: I apologize for the wait, Madam Melady.

speaker: Melady
text: You seem to have...a full plate.

speaker: Zinc
text: Oh, worry not, our obligations to Bern take priority over all. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask.

speaker: Melady
text: Then let's get to the matter we discussed earlier...

speaker: Zinc
text: Ah, the whereabouts of Princess Guinivere.

speaker: Melady
text: Have you found anything, Lord Zinc?

speaker: Zinc
text: I regret to say that I have not. Have you been to Djuto?

speaker: Melady
text: I have.

speaker: Zinc
text: Then I suggest you pay a visit to Father Oro. He resides in the castle at Mt Ebrakhm to the north. He knows the region better than any of us, so he may have some idea. However, if even he does not know where Princess Guinivere might be, then she is most likely not in the Isles.

speaker: Melady
text: Thank you. I will speak with Father Oro then. Farewell.

speaker: Roy
text: The resistance is supposedly very active in this area.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, that's what our sources say. But I also hear that Etruria's military is hunting down members of the resistance. Their numbers have apparently dwindled.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Etruria does nothing about bandits but oppresses the resistance? Something is very wrong with this picture...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Indeed it is.

speaker: Roy
text: Can we do anything to help the resistance?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Our hands are tied... To do so would directly oppose Etruria's nobility. We are here under Etruria's orders, remember.

speaker: Roy
text: I'll send a letter to General Cecilia and see what she has to say. Let's not do anything too rash just yet.

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Roy! Etrurian troops are attacking the village to find a member of the resistance force! They're under orders from Lord Zinc, the noble who controls this area.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh no!... But should we intervene?

speaker: Roy
text: We haven't the time to await General Cecilia's reply... But I want to help the people. ...Even if it means opposing an Etrurian noble.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: We fight! Our purpose is just! Make Lycia proud!

speaker: Galle
text: Were you able to ascertain Princess Guinivere's whereabouts?

speaker: Melady
text: Unfortunately, no. But a bishop named Orlo in charge of the mines in the north may know.

speaker: Galle
text: Very well. Then we head north.

speaker: Melady
text: Galle... I'm sorry. King Zephiel wanted to keep the matter of Princess Guinivere a secret, so only I was assigned to search for her. I'm sorry to get you mixed up in this...

speaker: Galle
text: Don't worry yourself.

speaker: Melady
text: But you work directly under General Murdock. Surely you have other duties.

speaker: Galle
text: General Murdock agreed to allow me to assist you. He thinks it's vital we find the princess and the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Melady
text: ...Do you think Princess Guinivere has the Fire Emblem?

speaker: Galle
text: That's what His Majesty the king thinks. And I think he's correct, all things considered.

speaker: Galle
text: Come now, don't be like that. I'm sure Princess Guinivere went with good intentions. Let's hurry now.

speaker: Melady
text: You're right...

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Where...am I...?

speaker: Mary
text: Are you awake?

speaker: Elffin
text: ...What...happened...?

speaker: Mary
text: We found you lying at the entrance to the village, covered in wounds. We took you home and have been taking care of you.

speaker: Elffin
text: Thank you... But you are...?

speaker: Mary
text: My name is Mary. I live in this village.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...You live here... Oh no! My very presence endangers this village... ...It may even be too late...

speaker: Mary
text: I'm sorry?

speaker: Elffin
text: I am Elffin... One of the resistance force. The lord here is sure to send troops in to capture me.

speaker: Mary
text: The resistance force...

speaker: Elffin
text: Lady Mary, you should leave here. The village is in danger.

speaker: Mary
text: ...No, I will stay.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Why?

speaker: Mary
text: I have a younger brother, but he left with his friend next door to find work. I'm taking care of his friend's sister. I can't abandon her.

speaker: Elffin
text: I understand... The most I can do to protect this village is leave. I thank you again for tending to my wounds. Please take care.

speaker: Mary
text: Yes, you too.

speaker: Zinc
text: What is going on out there? Why is it taking so long to find a single member of the resistance?!

speaker: Soldier
text: It's the Lycian Army! They've joined the battle on behalf of the villagers...

speaker: Zinc
text: The Lycian Army? They would betray Etruria?!

speaker: Soldier
text: Also, milord, we have received a missive from Djuto. They Lycian Army is suspected of working with the bandits. The missive says to take them dead or alive.

speaker: Zinc
text: Oh, really? They have ties with bandits? The irony! Those fools only want to save face...

speaker: Soldier
text: Excuse me, milord?

speaker: Zinc
text: This is not the mainland. The Isles are ruled by might.

speaker: Soldier
text: I'm not quite sure I understand...

speaker: Zinc
text: Pay it no mind. Was that all the message from Djuto said?

speaker: Soldier
text: There's more. Lord Arcard has provided us with reinforcements.

speaker: Zinc
text: What?!

speaker: Soldier
text: They should arrive soon.

speaker: Zinc
text: Confound it! We won't get credit for defeating Lycia if we're aided by reinforcements! We must wrap this up before they can join the fight... Ah, I've an idea! Get me Scollan!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Scollan
text: You called, Lord Zinc?

speaker: Zinc
text: Burn down the village. Kill any who resist.

speaker: Scollan
text: ...Can we take the loot?

speaker: Zinc
text: Do as you wish. Just do it quickly.

speaker: Scollan
text: You can count on us, Lord Zinc. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Scollan
text: Gonzalez! Where are you, Gonzalez?!

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Here... I here...

speaker: Scollan
text: There's a village to the south. With me so far?

speaker: Gonzalez
text: With you so far.

speaker: Scollan
text: Good. It might be a base for the resistance. Zinc says to burn it to the ground, village and all.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Village and all...

speaker: Scollan
text: Good, you understand. Now get goin'! Don't screw this one up, you dimwit.

speaker: Scollan
text: You got a problem? Does your head hurt from thinking too much?

speaker: Gonzalez
text: N-No...

speaker: Scollan
text: Heh, he's ugly as sin, but he's got a heart of gold. There's nothing wrong with tearin' down a few houses. Are we clear, wretches? No questions?

speaker: Bandit
text: We got it, boss!

speaker: Klein
text: That's the Lycian Army...

speaker: Thea
text: They were assigned to fight against the bandits...

speaker: Klein
text: I know. But Lord Arcard says they're allied with the bandits now. Why they're doing exactly the opposite of their assignment is beyond me...

speaker: Klein
text: Thea, take your soldiers and attack from the north. I'll commence the attack from here.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Klein
text: Thea! Hold on.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes, sir?

speaker: Klein
text: I hear that you have siblings.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes, sir, I have two sisters. One older, one younger.

speaker: Klein
text: Are they pegasus knights like you?

speaker: Thea
text: They are, actually. Why do you ask?

speaker: Klein
text: I have a younger sister myself...

speaker: Thea
text: Any sister of yours must be enchanting.

speaker: Klein
text: Yes, she is a sight. I heard, however, she got tangled up in some mess and now she's missing.

speaker: Thea
text: What? Oh my...

speaker: Klein
text: I have some people looking into it, but they've yet to find anything. If I didn't have this mission, I would search for her myself.

speaker: Klein
text: Thea, be careful out there. For your family's sake.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes, sir. Thank you.

speaker: Klein
text: Ready then? Let's move.

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir, are you sure?

speaker: Klein
text: Of what?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Arcard said Ilia's pegasus knights are expendable. They should be fighting on the front line, not us. Surely the lives of us Eturian soldiers are more valuable.

speaker: Klein
text: Don't be ridiculous. They are reliable companions. We will attack at the same time...or before them, if need be. Understood?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Klein
text: ...Lord Arcard's story is curious, though... The army from Lycia only arrived very recently. How could they create ties with the bandits so quickly...?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Zinque, the reinforcements from Jutes should arrive shortly.

speaker: Zinc
text: Blast! We have enough problems as it is...

speaker: Thea
text: Are you ready? We move southward!

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain... Are you sure we'll be all right?

speaker: Thea
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Soldier
text: The Etrurian army may consider us disposable and send us to the front...

speaker: Thea
text: Where did you hear that?

speaker: Soldier
text: One of the other riders heard a rumor from the Etrurian army.

speaker: Thea
text: Pay no mind to mere rumors.

speaker: Soldier
text: But...

speaker: Thea
text: I'm certain Commander Klein would never approve of that.

speaker: Soldier
text: Do you really think so?

speaker: Thea
text: Commander Klein's not like that. I trust him with my life.

speaker: Soldier
text: ...Very well. Then we'll trust him as well, for we trust you, Captain.

speaker: Thea
text: Good. Let's go!

speaker: Lilina
text: Excuse me!

speaker: Gonzalez
text: W-what you doing?! I am enemy!

speaker: Lilina
text: I know... But there's such a look of sorrow in your eyes.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: ...There is a village near mountain. You know?

speaker: Lilina
text: Yes, I know it.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Tell people escape. I have order. Destroy village. I...

speaker: Lilina
text: What? Don't! The villagers are innocent...

speaker: Gonzalez
text: No. It order. I must.

speaker: Lilina
text: It sounds to me like you should leave the person who gave you that order.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Leave?

speaker: Lilina
text: Yes! You can fight with us. We're protecting the villagers.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: No... I monster... People mean to me... People throw stones... People say "Go away!"... "You a monster!"... Not human...

speaker: Lilina
text: That's horrible! Of course you're human! You're a very kind-hearted man. I can tell. Please, come with us. Don't be afraid.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: Me afraid? I never afraid! Everyone afraid of ME! I not afraid!

speaker: Lilina
text: No. You ARE afraid. You're afraid that people will throw stones and call you a monster.

speaker: Lilina
text: But you don't have to be afraid of us. Everyone in our army is nice. They won't do that to you. Be brave... Take that first step, and you'll never have to be afraid again.

speaker: Roy
text: Wait! Aren't you an Etrurian commander? Why are you attacking us?!

speaker: Klein
text: I have specific orders from Lord Arcard to take you down.

speaker: Roy
text: Can't you see what's happening here? The people are suffering from the lords' abusive treatment! And you're helping them. You should be ashamed!

speaker: Klein
text: ...Wait. Are you saying that you're helping the villagers?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. The lord here is ransacking the village in search of the resistance. We're fighting to stop him. And you're apparently on his side.

speaker: Klein
text: I had no such intention. My orders stated that you were the ones working with the bandits.

speaker: Roy
text: What?! Why would we be working with bandits? We just want to clean things up here and get home to Lycia!

speaker: Klein
text: ...Such nerve.

speaker: Roy
text: What?!

speaker: Klein
text: Lord Arcard has made a fool of me. I have been so blind enough not to see through his thin veil of deceit.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Do you see what we see now?

speaker: Klein
text: I am Klein of House Reglay of Etruria. Forgive me for my misguided attack against you.

speaker: Roy
text: I am General Roy of the Lycian Army.

speaker: Klein
text: General Roy, I would advise you to be cautious. With you against Lord Arcard, I expect him to use every pawn at his disposal to have you dealt with.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you for the advice...

speaker: Klein
text: If you would allow it, I will join you.

speaker: Roy
text: You will?

speaker: Klein
text: Yes. I wish to monitor you as an Etrurian commander. I should prove useful as both a fighter and a diplomat.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you.

speaker: Clarine
text: Klein!

speaker: Klein
text: Clarine? You are safe!

speaker: Clarine
text: I'm sorry I left like I did. But I wanted so badly to see you!

speaker: Klein
text: Oh, the trouble you get into... Well, you're safe, and that's what matters. ...What brings you out here? Did you find a trustworthy mercenary for hire?

speaker: Clarine
text: No, I joined the Lycian Army.

speaker: Klein
text: The Lycian Army?!

speaker: Clarine
text: Yes! My healing staves have been most useful!

speaker: Klein
text: ...I see. I thought your eyes looked...sharper.

speaker: Clarine
text: I'm a lady now, I am.

speaker: Klein
text: ...Let me ask you this. What kind of individual is General Roy?

speaker: Clarine
text: Hmm... He's a tad rough around the edges for a noble... His hair especially is an absolute mess...

speaker: Klein
text: ...Let me rephrase that. Is General Roy working with the bandits?

speaker: Clarine
text: No, of course not! We've been sent here to vanquish the bandits!

speaker: Klein
text: So I heard...

speaker: Clarine
text: The Eturians here are malicious people... It is so embarrassing. Klein... Are you working for them?

speaker: Klein
text: No. Not anymore.

speaker: Clarine
text: What?

speaker: Klein
text: I was sent here to protect the villages. I hereby join the Lycian Army to fulfill my mission.

speaker: Clarine
text: Thank you, Klein!

speaker: Klein
text: Shall we, then? Will you introduce me to General Roy?

speaker: Clarine
text: Naturally! I love you, Klein.

speaker: Shanna
text: T-Thea! Sister!

speaker: Thea
text: Shanna...?

speaker: Shanna
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Thea
text: ...I have a contract with Commander Klein of Etruria. Shanna... Are you with the Lycian Army?

speaker: Shanna
text: Yes.

speaker: Thea
text: I see... Then this was inevitable. Draw your lance!

speaker: Shanna
text: No, Commander Klein said he would join us! We don't have to fight!

speaker: Thea
text: What? Really?

speaker: Shanna
text: Yes!

speaker: Thea
text: ...That's a relief. I will join you as well.

speaker: Shanna
text: Thanks, Sister!

speaker: Klein
text: Thea!

speaker: Thea
text: Commander Klein! What is the matter?

speaker: Klein
text: There's been a change of plans. We are going to fight under General Roy of the Lycian Army.

speaker: Thea
text: Understood, sir. We shall follow you without question.

speaker: Klein
text: I don't mind a question here or there, to be frank.

speaker: Thea
text: We are Ilian mercenaries, sir. We follow our employer's every order. And besides...

speaker: Klein
text: Yes?

speaker: Thea
text: I trust you to make proper judgments.

speaker: Klein
text: Thank you, Thea.

speaker: Shanna
text: T-Thea! Sister!

speaker: Thea
text: Shanna...?

speaker: Shanna
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Thea
text: ...I have a contract with Commander Klein of Etruria. Shanna... Are you with the Lycian Army?

speaker: Shanna
text: Yes.

speaker: Thea
text: I see... Then this was inevitable. Draw your lance!

speaker: Shanna
text: No... I don't want to fight you!

speaker: Thea
text: ...Shanna, you know the code of the Ilian mercenaries.

speaker: Shanna
text: ...Never betray your employer...

speaker: Thea
text: Precisely. And we must follow that code, even if it means we must fight our own kin.

speaker: Shanna
text: But...one of us could be killed!

speaker: Thea
text: I know that! But we must fight! Failing to do so would damage the reputation of the Ilian mercenaries. Our nation can't afford to lose its mercenary contracts!

speaker: Shanna
text: Thea...

speaker: Thea
text: Now, draw your lance, Shanna!...Why... Why does it have to be like this...?

speaker: House
text: I wonder how Mary's doing... Her brother and his friend are both traveling, trying to make money. It's too dangerous to go outside now... Can you go check on her? Here, I'll give you this for your trouble...

speaker: House
text: A few months ago, my granddaughter went missing. We all searched in the mountains and found her. She was with a hulking monster of a man, so we threw stones at him to drive him off... Afterwards my granddaughter told me that he was the one who led her to the village. ...If you ever find that man, would you give him this? It's a special axe that's effective against swords. And...tell him I'm sorry.

speaker: House
text: I hate the resistance! We civilians have to deal with the consequences of their actions. You know we stand no chance if we try to stand up to our lord. We just want to lead a normal life. Oh... I'm sorry. I'm just frustrated. I have no useful skills so I can't help you... but take this...

speaker: House
text: ...The resistance suffered a crippling defeat here. Here, take this. I'm going to look for other survivors. There is still hope if we can find our leader.

speaker: House
text: Ah, our heroes! I thank you on behalf of the village. This is made from the scale of a dragon. It's said it will protect the one who uses it from harm. Please, take it.

speaker: Myu
text: It's Wade!

speaker: Wade
text: Hey, Myu! ...Come on, can't you call me UNCLE Wade?

speaker: Myu
text: But... You're just Wade.

speaker: Wade
text: Ah, never mind. You look like you've gotten bigger.

speaker: Myu
text: Yeah!

speaker: Wade
text: ...It's dangerous here. Go hide in the hills.

speaker: Myu
text: ...Alone?

speaker: Wade
text: My sister's still here, right? She'll take you.

speaker: Myu
text: Yeah, Auntie Mary's here.

speaker: Wade
text: So she's Auntie Mary but I'm just Wade, huh?

speaker: Myu
text: Oh. Here you go.

speaker: Wade
text: What's this? A wing?

speaker: Myu
text: It'll make you like a bird!

speaker: Wade
text: Like a bird? What's that mean?

speaker: Myu
text: Like a bird. You know.

speaker: Wade
text: No, I don't know. But, uh, anyway, this is for me?

speaker: Myu
text: No, it's for Big Brother Lot.

speaker: Wade
text: And Lot is Big Brother Lot... Have you got it out for me?

speaker: Myu
text: Ha ha ha! I'll go see Mary. Here's the wing. Give it to Lot, OK, Uncle Wade?

speaker: Wade
text: And NOW she calls me Uncle... Woah, are you OK?! Don't trip...

speaker: Myu
text: Brother! You're home!

speaker: Lot
text: Myu! Have you been a good girl?

speaker: Myu
text: Yes, I was good! I didn't even wet my bed!

speaker: Lot
text: That's my girl.

speaker: Myu
text: Lot... While you were away, Mother...

speaker: Lot
text: Yeah, I know... She went to sleep...

speaker: Myu
text: Here... Mother left this for you. She said you might find a use for it.

speaker: Myu
text: Brother... You won't leave me, will you? You won't go to sleep like Mother...?

speaker: Lot
text: Of course not! In fact, next time you see me I'll have a whole wagon of presents. Just listen to Mary and stay good, all right?

speaker: Myu
text: OK!

speaker: Lot
text: Go hide in the hills with Mary. It's dangerous here.

speaker: Myu
text: I will... And Lot?

speaker: Lot
text: Yeah?

speaker: Myu
text: You promised! Don't leave me!

speaker: Lot
text: I won't...

speaker: Mary
text: Have you seen my brother? His name is Wade, and he's a mercenary... Have you at least heard of him? Well, take this for your trouble.

speaker: Mary
text: Wade!

speaker: Wade
text: Sis! It's good to see you.

speaker: Mary
text: You've returned?

speaker: Wade
text: Well, not exactly... We're here on a mission.

speaker: Mary
text: ...You're never coming back, are you?

speaker: Wade
text: No! Of course I will! ...Just not yet. Just you wait. When I come back I'll have more money than I can carry. Then all our problems will be a thing of the past.

speaker: Mary
text: I don't care about that... I just want you safe.

speaker: Wade
text: Sis...

speaker: Mary
text: I know how brash and hotheaded you can be, but always remember... There are people who care about you.

speaker: Mary
text: Here, take this.

speaker: Wade
text: What is it?

speaker: Mary
text: It's a special weapon. I nursed a traveler back to health, and he left it in return. You can use it, can't you?

speaker: Wade
text: Thanks, Sis! I've gotta go now.

speaker: Mary
text: Just be careful...

speaker: Lot
text: Mary...

speaker: Mary
text: Lot! You've returned?

speaker: Lot
text: No... We just stopped by on a mission.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh... Myu will be sad.

speaker: Lot
text: Ever since mother died, I've been making you take care of Myu. I'm sorry.

speaker: Mary
text: No... don't be...

speaker: Lot
text: Someday...

speaker: Lot
text: Someday I'll return. ...Can I leave Myu to you until then?

speaker: Mary
text: ...Can you promise?

speaker: Lot
text: ... Yes.

speaker: Mary
text: Don't lie... You're going to war. There's no saying you'll return.

speaker: Mary
text: But I'll be waiting. Without false hope...

speaker: Lot
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, take this.

speaker: Lot
text: What?

speaker: Mary
text: It's a magic weapon that will help you keep your promise.

speaker: Lot
text: Thank you, I appreciate it. Well then... I must be off.

speaker: Mary
text: Be careful...

speaker: Zinc
text: The people are suffering...? What concern is that to me? They live to serve me. Their wails are meaningless.

speaker: Zinc
text: This is my land... Mine alone... None...shall...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy, there is a young man claiming to be with the resistance here.

speaker: Roy
text: I'll see him. Let him pass.

speaker: Elffin
text: I am pleased to meet you. My name is Elffin. I am a member of the resistance force.

speaker: Roy
text: I am Roy of the Lycian Army.

speaker: Elffin
text: You have my thanks for saving the village here.

speaker: Roy
text: We simply did what we believe is right.

speaker: Elffin
text: But now you stand against Etruria.

speaker: Roy
text: Even so, I have no regrets. We may have opposed Etruria's immediate interests, but once the truth about the Isles is out, I'm certain they will understand. I sent a letter to a trustworthy Etrurian noble. If she takes appropriate measures, they will send us aid.

speaker: Elffin
text: I would not be so sure...

speaker: Roy
text: Why is that?

speaker: Elffin
text: Don't you find it unusual that Etruria sent you here in the first place?

speaker: Roy
text: Actually...yes, I do.

speaker: Elffin
text: This is merely conjecture... But was it High Chancellor Roartz and Lord Arcard who requested your help?

speaker: Roy
text: ...It was.

speaker: Elffin
text: Why were they so eager to get your army off the mainland, I wonder? Perhaps your presence in Lycia was undesirable to them.

speaker: Roy
text: I never even considered that...

speaker: Elffin
text: There are rumors...that Roartz and Arcard are working with Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: What?! Then Lycia is in danger!

speaker: Merlinus
text: L-Lord Roy!

speaker: Elffin
text: Your country may be in peril. Are you free to waste your time on the Isles as you are?

speaker: Merlinus
text: He's right! Bern wanted us out of Lycia so they could launch an invasion! We must head back at once!

speaker: Roy
text: ...We stay here.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?! Why?!

speaker: Roy
text: It's difficult to judge what may be hearsay and what may be truth. We can't simply jump on this information and run back to Lycia. I am certainly concerned, but my father and General Cecilia are there. The people on the Isles have only us to rely on.

speaker: Merlinus
text: That may be, but...

speaker: Roy
text: If we leave without finishing our mission, then all we've done here was for naught.

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Your army is blessed with a wise leader.

speaker: Roy
text: What?

speaker: Elffin
text: Lord Roy, I am sorry for testing you so.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Testing us? So that was a lie?!

speaker: Elffin
text: It was the truth. However, I presented the rumor in a way that you might take rash action. Your leader is an admirable individual. I would join you if you will allow it.

speaker: Roy
text: ...I don't like that you tested us. But if you can help, I welcome you. Now then, back to the topic at hand. What can we do to help the people of the Isles?

speaker: Elffin
text: You should head south...towards Caldonia.

speaker: Roy
text: Why?

speaker: Elffin
text: Castle Edina is located there. It is where workers are kept before they are sent to Eburacum.

speaker: Roy
text: Then we must save the people there!

speaker: Elffin
text: Lord Roy, please take this sword.

speaker: Roy
text: What is this?

speaker: Elffin
text: It is called a wyrmslayer. It was created during the Scouring to use against dragons. It is effective against wyverns as well.

speaker: Roy
text: Wyrmslayer? Is this a legendary weapon?

speaker: Elffin
text: No. Legendary weapons can only be used by those whose skill rivals the Eight Legends. This weapon, however, can be wielded by anyone with experience in swordplay.

speaker: Mary
text: Are you the leader of this army?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, I am.

speaker: Mary
text: I wish to thank you for protecting our village.

speaker: Roy
text: There is no thanks necessary... We did what we believe is right.

speaker: Mary
text: Regardless, I want you to have this as a token of our gratitude.

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Klein, we will stay and help with reconstruction as directed.

speaker: Klein
text: Good. These people need you.

speaker: Soldier
text: Would that we could fight at your side. Here is the bolt we were holding for you. You may need it more than we do. Farewell and good luck, Commander Klein.

speaker: Klein
text: Thank you. Good luck to you as well.

speaker: Soldier
text: Captain! We will return to Ilia to make our report.

speaker: Thea
text: Very good. Thank you for your service.

speaker: Soldier
text: Oh, and take this... Your sister gave it to me before we left. Please be careful...

speaker: Thea
text: Thank you. You too.

speaker: Bandit
text: Boss! They've all hidden themselves inside the castle!

speaker: Damas
text: Heh. Even Eliwood, the greatest knight in Lycia, is no match for an illness, it seems.

speaker: Bandit
text: Hee hee hee... You were right when you said there wouldn't be many soldiers. They're all getting ready to defend against Bern!

speaker: Damas
text: Of course I was right. I'm always right, you fool. But reinforcements could be here any minute. All right, you curs, listen up! Kill everyone in the castle while we still got time! Then we can waltz outta here with all the loot!

speaker: Bandit
text: Heh heh, castles ain't the only places with loot. Let's go ransack the village and take everything they've got!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Eliwood! We're under attack by bandits from Mount Bolm!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I understand. Thank you, Merlinus... Blast it! Were I not in this pitiful state, I would take care of them all myself...!

speaker: Lilina
text: Lord Eliwood...?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lilina, you must hide yourself. This castle is going to become a war zone.

speaker: Lilina
text: No, my lord. I can fight, too!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Don't be absurd. I couldn't face Hector if something happened to you in my own castle.

speaker: Lilina
text: My father? But...

speaker: Eliwood
text: It's going to be all right. Roy should be here any moment, so we just need to hold our own until then. He'll drive off these dastards. Merlinus! Send a messenger to Roy to let him know the current situation! We need his help!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Y-Yes, milord!

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, it's Lance! What's the matter? Why are you in such a hurry?

speaker: Lance
text: Lord Roy! Bandits have appeared and are attacking the castle as we speak!

speaker: Alen
text: No! Is the marquess unharmed?

speaker: Lance
text: He's inside, defending against the bandits' attack. But I don't know how long he can last with his illness...!

speaker: Bors
text: Excuse me. Lance, is it? Is Lady Lilina safe?

speaker: Lance
text: You must be a knight of Ostia. Lady Lilina is in the castle. She should be all right. She's with Lord Eliwood after all, but he can't last forever.

speaker: Roy
text: No... I shouldn't have let Lilina go to the castle before me.

speaker: Wolt
text: Lord Roy, regret won't solve anything! We must retake the castle!

speaker: Marcus
text: Wolt is right. We must make haste!

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, you're right. This is no time to despair. Very well. To arms then! Our target is the castle! We must rescue everyone!

speaker: Damas
text: Dammit! Reinforcements already?! But they ain't gettin' to the castle so easy!

speaker: Village
text: Hey! Aren't you knights going to the castle? I know this isn't much... But please accept this money on behalf of all of us. Use it well!

speaker: House
text: Money is important! If you don't have any, you won't be able to replace your broken weapons! And you can't fight without weapons!

speaker: House
text: Listen! If you wanna do well in battle you'd better use terrain wisely. For example, if you're in a forest the trees will cover you! That'll teach your enemies who they're dealing with.

speaker: House
text: We're all doomed... Soldiers from Bern have crossed the border... They laid an awful attack. And even if the allied lords strike back, Lord Eliwood... He can't even stand anymore...

speaker: Damas
text: You bumbling idiots! You can't take on a few pathetic knights?!

speaker: Damas
text: Wh...what the...?! S...so strong...

speaker: Roy
text: Father! Lilina!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Roy, is that you?

speaker: Lilina
text: Roy!

speaker: Roy
text: Father! Lilina! ... Thank goodness, you're all right.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Roy, thanks for coming this far.

speaker: Roy
text: Of course, father. How is your health?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm fine. I'm still alive, see? But Roy, you do know why I called you back here?

speaker: Roy
text: I am to take over your role of leading Pherae's military and join the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. As you know, Bern has started to conquer Lycia. We must follow the ancient rule and send out our military to protect the land of Lycia.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I really didn't want to send you out because you were still studying, but I'm not well... I would only be a hindrance to everyone else.

speaker: Roy
text: Father...

speaker: Lilina
text: Mister Eliwood, I will accompany Roy! My father is in charge of Lycia's main army. And I could use my magic to be of some help to Roy...

speaker: Eliwood
text: No, Lilina. You must return to Ostia.

speaker: Lilina
text: ... Why?

speaker: Eliwood
text: With Hector's absence, there is no one currently sitting on the throne of Ostia. The people must be feeling uptight as well. You, being the daughter of the marquess, must take the throne until Hector returns and ease the tension of the people. Am I wrong?

speaker: Lilina
text: ... No, sir.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Roy, first you must go to the Bern border and meet with the mercenary group that I have arranged a contract with. I'll send Merlinus along with you... He'll be very helpful with his knowledge.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you for everything, father.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You'll be fine. You can do it! Go and fight, and show them who you are, the next Marquess of Pherae!

speaker: Roy
text: Yes!

speaker: Lilina
text: Bors, I have something to ask of you.

speaker: Bors
text: I know, my lady. I will accompany Roy in his travels and swear to protect him with my life.

speaker: Lilina
text: Thank you, Bors. Roy, be careful.

speaker: Roy
text: I know. You too, Lilina.

speaker: Leygance
text: What?! The enemy has broken into the castle? What the hell was Devias doing out there?! Were those knights from Ilia so strong? ... Or was the Lycia Army larger than I expected... In any case, they have gotten into the 'unconquerable' Castle Ostia!

speaker: Leygance
text: We must drive them out, or Bern will look down upon us... You over there!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Leygance
text: Set up the troops all over the castle! Especially around the throne room! Prepare your defenses! We must not let the Lycia Army get any further into the castle!

speaker: Soldier
text: Understood sir!

speaker: Leygance
text: One more thing. I want you to discreetly kill Lilina during the battle.

speaker: Soldier
text: What? ... Sir, weren't we supposed to keep her alive?

speaker: Leygance
text: I was planning on using her as a hostage. But there are still many rebels that put faith in her. If we openly use her as a hostage, those soldiers might turn against us.

speaker: Soldier
text: But in that case sir, they would surely turn on us if we kill her!

speaker: Leygance
text: So I said to do it discreetly, didn't I?! Kill her quietly, and pretend that she was hit by a stray arrow. Then we can make the enemy responsible for it! Now go!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir...

speaker: Astore
text: ... General Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army, I presume.

speaker: Roy
text: ! Who are you? An enemy?!

speaker: Astore
text: No, I'm on your side. Greetings, my name is Astore. I used to work here in the service of Lord Hector.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Excuse me, but what kind of work were you doing? You certainly don't look like one of Ostia's servants...

speaker: Astore
text: My, my, aren't we a little rude, old man? See, I'm a spy. I go on secret missions to gather information, steal things, check on people... that kind of thing.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hmm, I see.

speaker: Astore
text: If people can tell that I'm working for a noble just by looking at me, then I'm not much of a spy, am I? Anyway, for a month now, I've been running around Lycia to gather the latest news. When I heard about Lord Hector's death in Araphen, I returned here as quickly as I could. Then I see that those idiots, Leygance and Devias, have caused a rebellion! I didn't make it in time to save Lord Hector, but I don't want to be too late for Lady Lilina.

speaker: Roy
text: Then you'll join us? Good, let's work together to rescue her. Do you know where Lilina is?

speaker: Astore
text: Of course, investigating into matters like that is my job. Lady Lilina is locked into a small room in the center of the castle. And that dastard Leygance is sitting on the throne like he owns the place.

speaker: Roy
text: We have to hurry then. We must defeat the rebels and rescue Lilina before Narcian arrives from Bern!

speaker: Lilina
text: What's all that noise? Is there a battle going on? I wonder what's happening outside...

speaker: Ogier
text: Sir Barth, this is a dead end!

speaker: Barth
text: Don't worry. This wall has cracks in it. We can break through it if we hit it a little with our weapons.

speaker: Wendy
text: I wonder where Lady Lilina is?

speaker: Barth
text: I have a pretty good idea where she is. We've known this castle for a long time. Hmm, I do wonder what's causing all the noise, though.

speaker: Wendy
text: The Alliance Army? Then my brother must be with them...

speaker: Barth
text: ... We don't know if he's still alive. You shouldn't have such high expectations.

speaker: Wendy
text: Oh... Yes.

speaker: Ogier
text: Sir Barth, you don't have to be so cold. He's Wendy's only brother, right?

speaker: Barth
text: You must never look away from reality.

speaker: Ogier
text: But...

speaker: Wendy
text: It's all right, Ogier. Sir Barth is right.

speaker: Barth
text: As an Armor Knight of Ostia, you must never panic, no matter what the situation. Understood, Wendy?

speaker: Wendy
text: ... Yes.

speaker: Cath
text: Yes! Just as I thought, they're at each other again. I mean, how stupid can these nobles get? I can never understand what the fun is in fighting all the time. Oh well, guess I'll swipe what I can.

speaker: Roy
text: We have finally recaptured the castle, Lilina.

speaker: Lilina
text: Thank you, Roy. I'm glad that my father didn't have to go through the trouble.

speaker: Lilina
text: Roy, is my father still in Araphen? I heard it was a tough battle there, but does it look like it's going to take much longer?

speaker: Roy
text: Lilina... haven't you heard anything?

speaker: Lilina
text: What?

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Hector... has passed away.

speaker: Lilina
text: What...?

speaker: Roy
text: I'm sorry... When we arrived at Castle Araphen... It was already under Bern's control.

speaker: Lilina
text: It's not your fault... Don't apologize.

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Hector was already severely wounded when we arrived. If only we had gotten there faster, maybe I could have helped him...

speaker: Lilina
text: No... it's okay. I... was prepared for this... I'm a warrior's daughter. I've been taught not to panic in times like this.

speaker: Roy
text: Lilina.

speaker: Lilina
text: So everyone should have told me... They're too considerate... I'm strong too, you know...

speaker: Roy
text: Lilina, you don't have to hold back in front of me.

speaker: Lilina
text: Roy... I...

speaker: Roy
text: It's okay... I'll be with you.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! Bern's Dragon Knights have appeared at Castle Ostia!

speaker: Roy
text: What! They're here already?

speaker: Narcian
text: Hehehe... Are you Roy? I must thank you for getting rid of that idiot Leygance for me. Now, you will leave Ostia to me.

speaker: Roy
text: Don't be ridiculous! Who would give Ostia to the likes of you..!

speaker: Narcian
text: Oh? Then do you wish to fight us with that sad little group of yours? I shall annihilate you, as I did with Hector!

speaker: Roy
text: Damn!

speaker: Unknown Person
text: That's enough!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian! A legion has arrived from Etruria!

speaker: Narcian
text: I can see that, you fool! Why...

speaker: Percival
text: I am Percival, Knight General of Etruria. Yesterday, Sorcery General Cecilia informed me that Ostia had requested Etruria's protection.

speaker: Narcian
text: What...!

speaker: Cecilia
text: You seem discontent. We are prepared for battle. But can those Dragon Knights of yours stand a chance against all of us?

speaker: Narcian
text: You...!

speaker: Cecilia
text: I am Cecilia, Sorcery General of Etruria! Ostia is now under our protection.

speaker: Narcian
text: Argh... You... you...!!!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian, please control your temper! General Percival is one of the strongest warriors in Etruria! And with General Cecilia here as well we'll be slaughtered!

speaker: Narcian
text: I know! We're leaving! Cecilia, is it? Watch your back from now on!

speaker: Percival
text: Are you General Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army?

speaker: Roy
text: Y-Yes! I am in charge of the Alliance Army in the place of Lord Hector.

speaker: Percival
text: I see. Lycia is in a time of hardship. Our king also sends his words of regret for Lord Hector's death.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you for your consideration. If Etruria hadn't helped us... Ostia would be under Bern's control now. Thank you very much.

speaker: Percival
text: I'm not the one to thank. I simply followed my king's orders. You should thank Cecilia, who went against the king to help you.

speaker: Cecilia
text: She... disobeyed the king's orders?

speaker: Percival
text: Yes, now isn't that something? Well, I must be off. Two of the three Etrurian Generals shouldn't be leaving the country for so long. Cecilia, can you take care of the rest?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes. Thank you, Percival. You can leave the rest to me.

speaker: Roy
text: Whew... General Percival... Now he's someone.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Nervous, were you?

speaker: Roy
text: General Cecilia! It is good to see you again.

speaker: Cecilia
text: How are you doing, Roy? You look a little tired, but you seem okay.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, thanks to Etruria, we were able to avoid disaster.

speaker: Cecilia
text: I'm glad we made it here in time.

speaker: Roy
text: I'm sorry. I put you through a lot of trouble.

speaker: Cecilia
text: No. It's going to be beneficial for Etruria for Ostia to go under our protection.

speaker: Roy
text: Beneficial?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Yes. Bern's been acting aggressively these days, as you know. We also want to do something about it, but since we haven't been directly invaded, we have no reason to go to war with them. But if Bern gets any stronger, the balance of powers would be shattered.

speaker: Roy
text: So when Ostia requested protection, you saw it as a good reason to declare war on Bern?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Right. We just did what would be best for us. You don't need to feel that you're in our debt.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes.

speaker: Cecilia
text: So you shouldn't thank us.

speaker: Roy
text: Understood. I won't. Well anyway, come in and meet the rest of our army.

speaker: Cecilia
text: ... He's gotten so bold in the short time that I haven't seen him. Well, he is a boy, after all.

speaker: Wendy
text: Bors! You're all right!

speaker: Bors
text: Why, is it Wendy? I'm glad to see you're okay too. ...!? What the... What are you wearing? Did you apply to become an Ostian Armor Knight or something?

speaker: Wendy
text: Ah... Actually, I did. I was knighted just yesterday.

speaker: Bors
text: What are you doing... I thought I told you to leave the fighting to us and live your life as you wished! You didn't need to become an Armor Knight...

speaker: Wendy
text: Yes, well, I thought about it, and what I truly want is to become a knight.

speaker: Bors
text: But...

speaker: Wendy
text: I don't want to just wait for you to return from battle. I want to become a knight as great as you.

speaker: Wendy
text: ... Bors?

speaker: Bors
text: Well, you were always stubborn, weren't you, Wendy?

speaker: Wendy
text: Bors...

speaker: Bors
text: You should live your life as you wish. If Mother and Father were alive, they would say that as well. But the way of the knight is no easy feat!

speaker: Wendy
text: Yes, I'm prepared! I shall never give up!

speaker: Roy
text: Lilina!

speaker: Lilina
text: ... Roy? Is it really you?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes!

speaker: Lilina
text: You came! Thank you.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank goodness you're all right. Here, take this spell book. Use it to defend yourself for the time being.

speaker: Lilina
text: Thanks.

speaker: Bors
text: Lady Lilina! You are safe!

speaker: Lilina
text: Bors, I am sorry that I worried you.

speaker: Bors
text: Not at all, my Lady! You were alive... That in itself...

speaker: Lilina
text: Thank you, Bors. And you kept your promise that you would protect Roy for me. I knew I was doing the right thing when I asked you.

speaker: Bors
text: Thank you, my Lady!

speaker: Lilina
text: Barth!

speaker: Barth
text: Lady Lilina! I am happy to see you are safe.

speaker: Lilina
text: Barth, you were right. Leygance was planning a rebellion.

speaker: Lilina
text: I'm sorry... If I had believed you in the first place, this wouldn't have happened...

speaker: Barth
text: No... Lady Lilina, you do not have anything to apologize about. The one to be prosecuted is Leygance, who insulted your kind and trusting heart toward him. It is your kindness that we respect the most, my Lady.

speaker: Lilina
text: Barth...

speaker: Roy
text: It's you!

speaker: Cath
text: Crap... Er, what a coincidence! Hahaha...

speaker: Roy
text: ... If you're in the battlefield just to steal, you shouldn't be. It's not right.

speaker: Cath
text: Don't worry. I only take from the rich who have plenty of money. No one's going to starve or anything.

speaker: Roy
text: That's not the point.

speaker: Cath
text: Oh really? Then let me ask you this. You nobles take food and money from the people living in what you call your territory. Who said that was your land, anyway? And you say you're collecting taxes, but what you're doing is the same. Looting!

speaker: Roy
text: What?! But we protect the people in return...

speaker: Cath
text: But you're not! You're killing your own people, causing a war like this!

speaker: Roy
text: Well... Bern started to invade, so we had to fight to defend our people...

speaker: Cath
text: So you can just do anything you want, as long as you say you're protecting us? You can burn down villages and ruin our crops?

speaker: Roy
text: Burned? We never...! Wait a minute, was your... ?

speaker: Cath
text: ... My village was burned to the ground by our marquess. He said that he had no choice because he needed to prepare for Bern's attacks.

speaker: Roy
text: Well... that's...

speaker: Cath
text: We always had just enough to eat and survive, and then we just lost everything... Our homes... our crops... And then you say not to take from other people? Ha! You shouldn't be talking! You dastards from the nobility take from us so you can live in luxury while we suffer!

speaker: Roy
text: I... don't know what to say.

speaker: Cath
text: Sigh. We're getting all gloomy now. I really don't like talking about 'I'm worse off so you should pity me' arguments. But you're the one who started it.

speaker: Cath
text: Ah, to heck with this. It's not fun stealing after a talk like that. Well, I guess I better bail out then. See ya!

speaker: Leygance
text: You vermin of the Alliance Army... Come. I shall cut down all of you!

speaker: Leygance
text: Why? You are only... to be trampled upon by Bern... How can you fight so hard...?

speaker: Leygance
text: Bors! So you were still alive.

speaker: Bors
text: Of course. Taking Ostia while we weren't around...

speaker: Leygance
text: Is that a problem? Then try and take it back with your own strength and skill

speaker: Leygance
text: Lady Lilina? Damn, you were supposed to be dead by now...

speaker: Lilina
text: Leygance... Why?

speaker: Leygance
text: Times are changing, my Lady. I'm just making sure I don't get left behind. I'm not like Lord Hector, who was too foolish to realize the change.

speaker: Lilina
text: Quiet! You will not insult my father any further!

speaker: Wendy
text: General Leygance! You shall rest here!

speaker: Leygance
text: Ah, Bors' sister, is it? It's nice to be brave and all, but can you really defeat me?

speaker: Barth
text: Leygance, you fool! Are you not ashamed that you betrayed Lord Hector?!

speaker: Leygance
text: Barth... Shut up. Lord Hector stupidly caused his death. I do not plan on falling with him.

speaker: Barth
text: Why, you...!

speaker: Melady
text: All I want to know is what happened to Princess Guinevere!

speaker: Rude
text: Y-yes, Captain Melady... I'm certain she was in her room this morning, but she simply vanished...

speaker: Melady
text: You told me that already, you buffoon! I don't want excuses! Are you so incompetent you can't understand that?!

speaker: Rude
text: Well... I... Er...

speaker: Melady
