text: Our forces are mobilizing to begin a full-scale war with Lycia. How are we to focus on the battle if the princess is missing?! Naturally, you will take full responsibility for her disappearance.

speaker: Melady
text: I never should have let Her Highness come to the border to begin with. I will return to Bern and inform the king of this matter. I'll try not to cause a panic, but I can't promise your life if the princess isn't found. I trust you'll take every measure to locate her as soon as possible.

speaker: Rude
text: Yes, Captain!

speaker: Rude
text: Is Princess Guinivere secure?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Commander. She's under constant surveillance in the cellar.

speaker: Rude
text: Good. Don't let her escape.

speaker: Soldier
text: But Commander... are you sure this is a good idea?

speaker: Rude
text: Of course I'm sure! The younger sister of King Zephiel... We're sure to get a hefty sum turning her over to one of Bern's enemies.

speaker: Rude
text: Loyalty to one's king. Bah. What a worthless notion. The world is ruled by neither king nor queen. It's ruled by gold!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, indubitably, Commander.... But there has been a snag, shall we say.

speaker: Rude
text: Hm? What do you mean?

speaker: Soldier
text: I just received a report... It seems that Princess Guinivere's lady-in-waiting has escaped...

speaker: Rude
text: What?! You lout, why didn't you say so earlier? Find her this instant! Don't let her get away!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy, this is the location.

speaker: Roy
text: This is where we're supposed to meet the mercenaries?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, though it seems they aren't here yet. Wait, who's that? Somebody's coming this way...

speaker: Roy
text: Be careful there!

speaker: Elen
text: Oh, forgive me! I'm in such a hurry...

speaker: Roy
text: No need for apologies. Are you hurt?

speaker: Elen
text: No, I'm fine. Thank you, good sir.

speaker: Roy
text: Farewell, then.

speaker: Elen
text: ...Are you from Lycia, by chance?

speaker: Roy
text: I am. I am the son of Marquess Pherae.

speaker: Elen
text: Oh, Saint Elimine! Thank you for guiding me to this boy!

speaker: Roy
text: Pardon?

speaker: Elen
text: Please, I need your help to rescue my mistress.

speaker: Roy
text: What happened?

speaker: Elen
text: My name is Elen. I am a cleric of Saint Elimine. My mistress and I came from Bern to seek an audience with the lords of Lycia. However, Commander Rude of the castle east of here trapped us. We were captured, imprisoned by our own countrymen.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy! We must avoid unnecessary entanglements with Bern!

speaker: Roy
text: But we can't neglect a noble of Bern who wants to speak with the lords of Lycia... Then again, we can't simply charge into enemy territory either... Wait, who's there?!

speaker: Soldier
text: There's the wench! Over here, boys! Get the girl! Our orders say dead or alive!

speaker: Elen
text: Oh dear...

speaker: Roy
text: Well, Merlinus, they provoked hostilities. I don't think we have any choice now.

speaker: Merlinus
text: You wouldn't listen even if we did, I'm sure. But no matter. Let me witness all you've learned about tactics in Ostia.

speaker: Roy
text: All right, everyone! We're going to charge the castle! Sister Elen, you should find a place to hide...

speaker: Elen
text: No, I will come with you. I cannot fight, but I can heal wounded allies.

speaker: Roy
text: But...

speaker: Elen
text: I'm the one that got you tangled up in this mess. Please let me do what I can to help.

speaker: Roy
text: OK, but just stay behind us so you aren't hurt.

speaker: Elen
text: Certainly. Thank you for the concern.

speaker: Dieck
text: They should be around here somewhere... Shanna, check around and try to find the soldiers from Pherae, will you?

speaker: Shanna
text: Sure!

speaker: Wade
text: So, Big Man, who's our client this time?

speaker: Dieck
text: House Pherae, one of the noble families of Lycia. The marquess's son is going to join the other armies of the Lycian League.

speaker: Lot
text: We're going up against Bern then?

speaker: Dieck
text: Looks that way.

speaker: Wade
text: Finally, a foe worthy of my axe! Let's show 'em what we're made of!

speaker: Lot
text: Bern, eh? This won't be easy, I can tell you that. We had best tread lightly.

speaker: Shanna
text: I think I've found them! But it looks like they're already caught up in a skirmish.

speaker: Dieck
text: What? The fighting's started already? Let's get a move on then. Time to earn our pay!

speaker: Dieck
text: Are you Lord Roy of House Pherae?

speaker: Roy
text: Who is it that's asking?

speaker: Dieck
text: Name's Dieck. You should've heard about me from an older man named Merlinus.

speaker: Roy
text: So you're the leader of the mercenary band?

speaker: Dieck
text: Just a small company, really. Sorry we're late. Didn't think the fighting would start so soon.

speaker: Roy
text: Well... There was a complication...

speaker: Dieck
text: Don't take it the wrong way. We don't blame you. Actually, quite the contrary. My boys are excited for a chance to show off their skills.

speaker: Roy
text: Brilliant. It sounds like you're just the caliber of fighters we need.

speaker: Dieck
text: Enough chitchat then. Let's wrap things up.

speaker: Village
text: Armored knights have nearly impenetrable defenses. But some weapons, like this sword, can pierce their armor. I'm sure you can get better use out of it than us. Please, take it.

speaker: House
text: Pegasi are useful for flying to hard-to-reach places. But woe to any rider who finds herself against an archer. An arrow can take a pegasus down in a single hit!

speaker: House
text: Forts are the key to a good defense. If you're in a fort, you can defend and even dodge more easily. On top of that, your wounds will heal slowly over time.

speaker: House
text: The weapon triangle... Swords, axes and lances. Remember, swords best axes, axes best lances, and lances best swords! Keep this in mind and things will be much easier for you!

speaker: Rude
text: Curse it all! Just when I thought things had finally turned my way...

speaker: Rude
text: Oof... Greed can only...bring you...an ill fate...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy! There was a woman locked in the cellar!

speaker: Roy
text: That must be Elen's mistress. Bring her here.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Elen
text: Your Highness!

speaker: Guinevere
text: Elen! I'm so relieved you're well. You put yourself in such danger running off like you did... I worried myself sick about you.

speaker: Elen
text: I am sorry, Your Highness, but I couldn't leave you in that dank cellar...

speaker: Guinevere
text: Don't worry yourself, Elen. It's thanks to you I am safe now. I am in your debt. May I ask your name...?

speaker: Roy
text: I am Roy, son of Eliwood, Marquess Pherae.

speaker: Guinevere
text: It's a pleasure... As for myself...

speaker: Elen
text: Your Highness... Are you certain you should?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes, Elen. It is fine. My name is Guinivere.

speaker: Roy
text: Guinivere?! That's the name of the Princess of Bern!

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes, that is I.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?! This was a trap, wasn't it?!

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus, hold.

speaker: Merlinus
text: I beg your pardon, Lord Roy, but...

speaker: Roy
text: I wish to hear her out. Give her a chance, will you?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Tsk. As you will...

speaker: Roy
text: Are you truly Princess Guinivere from Bern?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes, truly. I cannot blame you for doubting me, however.

speaker: Roy
text: Maybe you are the princess of Bern, and maybe you aren't. I can see from your actions and dress that you are at least of high status. If you are indeed Princess Guinivere, however, there's one thing I don't understand. Elen told me you intended to meet the lords of the Lycian League.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes, that is correct.

speaker: Roy
text: Why, if you are the sister of the King of Bern?

speaker: Guinevere
text: I want to find a peaceful way to end the war. If I can speak to the Lycian council, I'm certain we can come to a solution.

speaker: Roy
text: Your brother instigated this war. Is it in your power to stop it?

speaker: Guinevere
text: At the very least, I wish to do everything I can. No, I MUST do everything I can.

speaker: Roy
text: ...I see. For the time being, come with us to meet the Lycian League armies. I want to see what Lord Hector thinks of this affair.

speaker: Guinevere
text: You will allow me to accompany you?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. If there is any possibility to avoid further bloodshed, we must try. It matters not how small the chance.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Thank you! I truly am in your debt.

speaker: Soldier
text: Bishop Martel! We have brought Lady Niime, as you asked.

speaker: Martel
text: Good. Let her pass.

speaker: Niime
text: What do you need from me?

speaker: Martel
text: Are you Niime, the Hermit on the Mountain?

speaker: Niime
text: So, some have begun calling me that, have they? Then I must be that Niime.

speaker: Martel
text: I hear that you are capable of using the ancient spell book that we found in this castle.

speaker: Niime
text: I should be able to. I’ve been studying the dark arts and ancient magic for decades now.

speaker: Martel
text: I understand that this spell can change the weather around the caster...

speaker: Niime
text: It wouldn’t be entirely improbable.

speaker: Martel
text: Then I order you. Use the spell book and create rainfall. Make it rain so that the rivers will overflow and push back the advancing Etrurian Army.

speaker: Niime
text: Well, I can try, but I frankly can’t guarantee that it will work. Also, powerful spells like these can only be cast once. Are you sure?

speaker: Martel
text: Silence! All you must do is follow my commands. You were the one who came to us and said you wished to join our forces. Then make yourself useful.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere... We are getting closer to Bern.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Yes.

speaker: Roy
text: Since we are getting closer, we are clashing with soldiers from Bern more and more often. It will not be long before we engage in full combat with Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: I wish to ask you something before we do.

speaker: Guinevere
text: What is that?

speaker: Roy
text: I have been hearing rumors...that King Zephiel rose to the throne because he murdered the former king.

speaker: Roy
text: I couldn’t believe it. You tried to stop him even by casting away your nationality. If King Zephiel is such a mad individual as the rumors say, then why did you try so hard to find a peaceful way to end the war?

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, I accepted the Fire Emblem not to use it in battle, but to try and find a use for it to end this war peacefully.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: Therefore, please tell me the truth about the rumors...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I...I’m sorry. Please...give me some time.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess!

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...What is the matter? Princess Guinevere was running off...

speaker: Roy
text: ...No, it’s nothing. Did you need something?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, I have gathered some more information. We may have some trouble with this battle. A powerful dark magician by the name of Niime resides in the enemy ranks.

speaker: Roy
text: Dark magician... A Druid, probably.

speaker: Merlinus
text: She is apparently extremely learned in ancient sorcery. She has much more knowledge than any scholar could dream of.

speaker: Roy
text: But we can’t pull back now.

speaker: Merlinus
text: No, but we can always be careful.

speaker: Roy
text: I know. We must be wary.

speaker: Martel
text: Is the spell ready? Niime!

speaker: Niime
text: ...I’m warning you for the last time. I really have no idea what will happen...

speaker: Martel
text: Just shut up and cast the spell!

speaker: Niime
text: Sigh... All right...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Wh-What is going on...?

speaker: Roy
text: An enemy spellcaster? Everyone, watch out!

speaker: Martel
text: What... What is this!? The rivers... The rivers have frozen over!

speaker: Niime
text: My, my... Now isn’t this a surprise...

speaker: Martel
text: ! You! You did this on purpose!

speaker: Niime
text: What are you talking about... I warned you that I couldn’t predict what would happen.

speaker: Martel
text: Quiet! Someone! Throw her into the dungeon!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Niime
text: Sigh...

speaker: Roy
text: What...happened?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, we have a report. The rivers have apparently frozen over.

speaker: Roy
text: What?

speaker: Merlinus
text: The ice is think enough for knights on horseback to cross them safely.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh... Well, good, we can advance more quickly now. Charge toward the castle gate!

speaker: Martel
text: Blast! How could you have traversed through this snow… Curse that useless hag!

speaker: Martel
text: No… I, one of the most intelligent of the generals…can die…?

speaker: Niime
text: Ah, finally I’ve been released from the clutches of Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: You are?

speaker: Niime
text: My name is Niime. I live in the mountains and study arcane magic.

speaker: Roy
text: You say you were released. Did you not join Bern out of your own will?

speaker: Niime
text: Well, I did, but it was only a guise. Bern’s army had something that I wanted to study.

speaker: Roy
text: What is that?

speaker: Niime
text: The Dragons.

speaker: Niime
text: Well, well, that got you interested, didn’t it?

speaker: Roy
text: The Dragons you speak of... They are not the wyverns that Bern’s Dragon Knights ride, but the strange troops that are mixed in with Bern’s soldiers...

speaker: Niime
text: Exactly. Those are the Dragons that were supposedly defeated in the Scouring.

speaker: Roy
text: Why do you know this...?

speaker: Niime
text: I thought that this war was just another skirmish at first. But then I began to see strange...evil things among Bern’s troops, so I decided to investigate.

speaker: Roy
text: Were you able to find out anything?

speaker: Niime
text: The Dragons are indeed shrouded in mystery. I looked through many ancient books and scrolls, but I could only decipher so many of them. But...

speaker: Roy
text: ...But?

speaker: Niime
text: I have come to believe that Bern has resurrected the Dark Dragon.

speaker: Roy
text: Dark Dragon... That is the leader of the Dragons that Hartmut defeated.

speaker: Niime
text: Right. Dragons are a much more advanced species then us humans. They have much greater vitality and intellect than us. However, there was one thing that the Dragons lagged far behind the humans in. The Dragons’ reproductive system was much less efficient than that of the humans. But even then, the Dark Dragon...it had the power to create more Dragons. That is what I learned from my research.

speaker: Roy
text: It can make more Dragons...

speaker: Niime
text: The Dark Dragon can create more of its kind. That would explain where Bern has been getting all of its Dragons.

speaker: Roy
text: That is possible.

speaker: Niime
text: Now, that being said... I want to learn more about the Dragons. Let me accompany your travels. I wield Dark Magic...I’m sure I can be of some assistance.

speaker: Roy
text: Of course. We want to learn about the Dragons as well. It may be dangerous, but it that’s okay with you, you’re welcome to join us.

speaker: Villager 1
text: Hurry! This way!

speaker: Villager 2
text: A-Are you sure about this? If we get caught we're--

speaker: Villager 1
text: Don't be stupid! If we stay, we'll be worked to death! You're just going to lie down and take that? Don't you have a family or something back home?

speaker: Villager 2
text: Yeah...

speaker: Villager 1
text: There are people coming to help us from the northeast. We just have to make it there in one piece!

speaker: Arcard
text: More people escaped?! Where were the gaurds?!

speaker: Robarts
text: They were unconscious. Someone drugged their food...

speaker: Arcard
text: ...Then there must be a traitor amongst us. Morgan! Pursue and eliminate the escaped workers.

speaker: Morgan
text: Yes, Lord Arcard.

speaker: Arcard
text: I will return to Jutes. Don't let them escape. Send more hands to the mines as well. I can't afford to lose more workers!

speaker: Roy
text: Elffin, is that castle to the southwest our target?

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes, that is Castle Edina. The people kidnapped on the Isles are first sent there. They are then sent to Eburacum and forced to work in the mines. As it happens, today is the weekly shipment of captives to the mines. It will be difficult to rescue them once they've been sent off.

speaker: Roy
text: Then you're saying we have to rescue them now!

speaker: Elffin
text: Yes. I already had some spies infiltrate the castle and help the people escape.

speaker: Roy
text: What will the captives do once they're out?

speaker: Elffin
text: I told them to send the captives to the northeast. In other words, our present location.

speaker: Roy
text: Then we must rescue those people before sieging the castle.

speaker: Woman
text: Geese... You're really leaving?

speaker: Geese
text: The lord of that castle killed my mates. I won't let their deaths be unavenged.

speaker: Woman
text: You mean that crew that was always with you...

speaker: Geese
text: Yeah... They were taken to the mines and told that they would be given work. But they were all worked like slaves until they... died.

speaker: Geese
text: Maybe they weren't the brightest bunch, but they were good people... And they were killed... just like that...!!

speaker: Woman
text: Do you intend to avenge them on your own?

speaker: Geese
text: Is there something wrong with that?

speaker: Woman
text: No... But I thought you were going to go back to your merchant business.

speaker: Geese
text: Yeah, well, I've got bigger problems now... Once my mates get their revenge, and once the war subsides, maybe I will.

speaker: Woman
text: ...We won't forget you, Geese. You and your crew risked your lives to get us food and supplies. If you ever need anything, we'll be here.

speaker: Geese
text: Maybe I'll take you up on that, if I'm still alive. ...Thanks.

speaker: Bartre
text: They're imprisoned in that castle, you say?

speaker: Resistance
text: That's right.

speaker: Bartre
text: Then we've no time to lose. Let's begin this daring prison break, shall we?

speaker: Resistance
text: ...I'm sorry to ask for your help like this. I know you're looking for your daughter.

speaker: Bartre
text: Don't be absurd! Consider it payment for your hospitality. I won't let some blood-sucking lord take advantage of his people! I'm Bartre the Brave, and I'll smash these puny insects!

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir Morgan, the reinforcements are ready!

speaker: Morgan
text: Good. Deploy them immediately. Spread them around the castle to defend us on all sides.

speaker: Roy
text: Even though we've saved the people at Castle Edina, there are others still suffering in the mines.

speaker: Elffin
text: That is correct. To liberate the Western Isles, we must take the capital.

speaker: Roy
text: Then our next destination is Jutes. ...Elffin, may I ask you something?

speaker: Elffin
text: Of course, Lord Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: Pardon me if I am mistaken, but are you of high Etrurian nobility?

speaker: Elffin
text: What?!! ...What makes you think that?

speaker: Roy
text: I can't quite explain it, but... The way you talk sounds very educated. In Ostia, I learned how to study people and size them up. Am I right?

speaker: Elffin
text: What would you do if you are?

speaker: Roy
text: Oh. Nothing in particular. I'm sure you have a good reason to hide your identity. You can tell me when you feel the time is right.

speaker: Roy
text: Let's head for Jutes! To save the Isles and defeat the true enemy of the people!

speaker: Villager 1
text: Hey, you with the mustache!

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?! Who are you?

speaker: Villager 1
text: Here, give this to General Roy. Thanks to him, we can see our families again.

speaker: Villager 2
text: We of the Western Isles always pay our debts of gratitude!

speaker: Villager 1
text: Tell him thanks.

speaker: Villager 2
text: We're all grateful from the bottom of our hearts!

speaker: Geese
text: Yeah? What? You got something to say to me?

speaker: Roy
text: I want to ask you why you're fighting against the soldiers.

speaker: Geese
text: Who wants to know?

speaker: Roy
text: Roy, leader of the Lycian Army. We're here on behalf of Etruria...

speaker: Geese
text: You're with Etruria?! Then you're the enemy. Get ready to die!

speaker: Roy
text: Slow down! We're fighting the castle's troops too.

speaker: Geese
text: And yet Etruria sent you? I don't understand.

speaker: Roy
text: I don't either. We were sent by Etruria to get rid of bandits here, but something's strange.

speaker: Geese
text: ...You say you're fighting the castle's troops. I'm for hire, if you'll take me.

speaker: Roy
text: What?

speaker: Geese
text: I'm a seafaring man, so I know both the land and sea around the Isles. You look a bit lost, so I could be a good guide for you.

speaker: Roy
text: That would help, but why?

speaker: Geese
text: I want to help with your mission. To be honest, I'm a pirate, so I'm probably the type you were sent to get rid of. But I only go after the rich. They have more than their fair share anyway.

speaker: Roy
text: Well then, if you'll join us, we're pleased to have you. We don't know this area at all, so it's been difficult thus far.

speaker: Geese
text: Sounds like we have a deal! Leave it to me!

speaker: Geese
text: ...This is it, lads. Can you taste it? You'll have your vengeance. And after you do, I might just tag along with this Roy fellow for a while...

speaker: Bartre
text: Are you with Etruria?!

speaker: Roy
text: Y-yes...

speaker: Bartre
text: We fight for the people suffering under your tyranny! En garde!

speaker: Roy
text: W-wait! We're on your side!

speaker: Bartre
text: You aren't with the castle?

speaker: Roy
text: We're trying to capture it, actually.

speaker: Bartre
text: Oh! Sorry then.

speaker: Roy
text: I am Roy, leader of the Lycian Army.

speaker: Bartre
text: Lycia? You've come a long way...

speaker: Roy
text: We were sent by Etruria to rid the Isles of the bandits.

speaker: Bartre
text: What's that?! So you are with Etruria!

speaker: Roy
text: Please calm yourself! We share the same goal. We want to bring peace to the Isles.

speaker: Bartre
text: …You may end up against Etrurian nobility.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Our mission is to find and eliminate wrongdoers on the Isles. Social status matters not.

speaker: Bartre
text: You, my friend, are a man of conviction! Very well! I think I'll join your little army!

speaker: Roy
text: You'll help us? Thank you!

speaker: Fir
text: Father? What are you doing here?

speaker: Bartre
text: Fir! I've been looking for you.

speaker: Fir
text: Father, I've already made up my mind. I want to become a great master of the sword like mother...

speaker: Bartre
text: That is good. I don't intend to drag you home. In fact, I want to help you in your journey.

speaker: Fir
text: Help me?

speaker: Bartre
text: I know well the hardships one faces in a journey of self-improvement. I can help you out of a bind if things get rough.

speaker: Fir
text: But Father, if you keep helping me, my training is meaningless.

speaker: Bartre
text: Nonsense. With your old man around, we can practice sparring any time! Do you refuse your father's love?!

speaker: Fir
text: No! It's nothing like that, but...

speaker: Bartre
text: It's settled then. But first we capture the castle.

speaker: Fir
text: Sigh... I guess I should tell Roy that we have another member...

speaker: Morgan
text: What are you doing?! Hurry and kill the ones who escaped! Wait, you're not one of my men... Wh-who are you?!

speaker: Morgan
text: The resistance force has been eliminated in this area... Who... are you people...?

speaker: Villager
text: Are you the guys helping us out? Then please, take this. I grabbed it as I escaped from the castle. I hope everyone else made it out...

speaker: Roartz
text: They’re here...! And so quickly... Could they not have given me the time to at least set up a defense!?

speaker: Kel
text: We will try to stop the enemy from progressing any further. You can retreat to the palace and fortify your defenses there.

speaker: Roartz
text: ...Can you hold them back?

speaker: Kel
text: We must at least try.

speaker: Roartz
text: If you do not know whether you can win or not...

speaker: Kel
text: Then what would you do? Flee? Tell me, just where do you think you can hide?

speaker: Kel
text: General Brunnya has given me orders to protect you. I will do so with my life. But you must not be afraid to fight, either!

speaker: Roartz
text: ... A-All right... Then I shall fortify the inside and leave the outside to you.

speaker: Soldier
text: ...That is the highest advisor of the Etrurian court? Why should we fight for a coward like him?

speaker: Kel
text: Don’t say that. General Brunnya didn’t willingly tell us to protect him. She had no choice because Etruria joined forces with Bern. ...Therefore, we must fulfill our duties as warriors.

speaker: Kel
text: I have also gotten hold of information that the allies of the Silver Wolf are lurking around here. Keep your guard.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...We fight again today.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes... I am sorry that I cannot find the time to talk with you at leisure.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Please, do not worry. ...My brother started this in the first place.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Yes?

speaker: Roy
text: May I ask the reason why Bern’s former king tried to murder King Zephiel?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Zephiel and I were born from different mothers. I am actually only his half-sister.

speaker: Roy
text: I heard that Zephiel’s mother was the queen of Etruria.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes. It was an arranged marriage to strengthen the tie between Bern and Etruria. However, our father already had a woman he loved at that time. That was my mother.

speaker: Guinevere
text: The marriage between our father and Zephiel’s mother was forced. Therefore, our father didn’t love Zephiel’s mother, and always thought badly of Zephiel.

speaker: Roy
text: Then is that why the former king and King Zephiel had a bad relationship?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... Even then, Zephiel was always trying his best to gain our father’s affection. He excelled in his studies and military training, and he was always trying hard. He grew to become a proud heir to Bern’s throne.

speaker: Roy
text: Then why did the king try to...

speaker: Soldier From Off-Screen
text: Master Roy! We are ready for the attack!

speaker: Roy
text: All right, I’ll be there in a minute! Princess Guinevere, I’m sorry, but...

speaker: Guinevere
text: No, it is all right. Please be careful.

speaker: Niime
text: Well, well... So it has begun.

speaker: Dayan
text: So it seems.

speaker: Man
text: Just when we thought Bern had finished invading, now we have to deal with Etruria. Sigh...

speaker: Niime
text: Small wonder. This is a large trading city. Any army would want control of it. Well, then...

speaker: Man
text: H-Hey, wait, where are you going?

speaker: Niime
text: I’m going to watch the fight. Let’s see how worthy that Roy is.

speaker: Man
text: What, now? But...

speaker: Niime
text: Don’t you worry about me. Everything will be fine.

speaker: Man
text: What? Hey, wait! You’re leaving, too?

speaker: Kel
text: The reinforcements should be arriving soon... I want you to open the front gate to let the reinforcements in when they arrive.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Soldier
text: All right, they should be here soon... Open the gate!

speaker: Kel
text: Tell the troops to start attacking the guerilla forces hiding in the houses.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Kel
text: I am Kel. Behold my blade…as I swing it for the last time.

speaker: Kel
text: As a swordsman…this…is inevitable.

speaker: Niime
text: Hm. You’re not too bad, are you?

speaker: Roy
text: Wh-Who are you!?

speaker: Soldier
text: What the!? Hey! I said you couldn’t come in. Master Roy is very busy.

speaker: Roy
text: What’s the matter?

speaker: Soldier
text: Well, Master Roy, she kept pestering me that she wanted to see you. But you were busy, so I was trying to drive her away.

speaker: Niime
text: Listen to me first. Then you can decide whether you want to get rid of me or not. I think I have information that you might be interested in.

speaker: Roy
text: ...What is that?

speaker: Niime
text: It’s about the humans who change form into beasts.

speaker: Roy
text: ...I want to speak with her in private. Can you leave the room?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Niime
text: Well, well, that got you interested, didn’t it?

speaker: Roy
text: Those beasts you speak of...

speaker: Niime
text: Right. Dragons.

speaker: Roy
text: Dragons... They are not the wyverns that Bern’s Dragon Knights ride, but the strange troops that are mixed in with Bern’s soldiers...

speaker: Niime
text: Exactly. Those are the Dragons that were supposedly defeated in the Scouring.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Who are you?

speaker: Niime
text: I am Niime, a scholar of ancient Dark Magic. Some call me the Hermit on the Mountain. This war...at first, I thought it was just another skirmish, so I didn’t pay heed of it. But now...I can feel evil among Bern’s troops, so I’m investigating.

speaker: Roy
text: Were you able to find out anything?

speaker: Niime
text: The Dragons are indeed shrouded in mystery. I looked through many ancient books and scrolls, but I could only decipher so many of them. But...

speaker: Roy
text: ...But?

speaker: Niime
text: I have come to believe that Bern has resurrected the Dark Dragon.

speaker: Roy
text: Dark Dragon... That is the leader of the Dragons that Hartmut defeated.

speaker: Niime
text: Right. Dragons are a much more advanced species then us humans. They have much greater vitality and intellect than us. However, there was one thing that the Dragons lagged far behind the humans in. The Dragons’ reproductive system was much less efficient than that of the humans. But even then, the Dark Dragon...it had the power to create more Dragons. That is what I learned from my research.

speaker: Roy
text: It can make more Dragons...

speaker: Niime
text: The Dark Dragon can create more of its kind. That would explain where Bern has been getting all of its Dragons.

speaker: Roy
text: That is possible.

speaker: Niime
text: Now, that being said... I want to learn more about the Dragons. Let me accompany your travels. I wield Dark Magic...I’m sure I can be of some assistance.

speaker: Roy
text: Of course. We want to learn about the Dragons as well. It may be dangerous, but it that’s okay with you, you’re welcome to join us.

speaker: Roy
text: You’re the Dark Priestess... No, the Dark Dragon.

speaker: Idunn
text: ...Why do you hinder my path?

speaker: Roy
text: What...?

speaker: Idunn
text: I have been commanded to lead this world. I shall make the world a better place. Why do you stand in my way?

speaker: Roy
text: ...You’re wrong. You were only told that the world would become a better place. The person who ordered you is already dead. So stop! You no longer have any reason to fight!

speaker: Roy
text: You... No, we... We have no reason to fight.

speaker: Idunn
text: ...A long time ago... I have a feeling that I heard those same words. Soft words, like a warm breeze... But that was long ago... I have been asleep for too long. In the darkness, I was dreaming... An empty dream, white, colorless... But now I am awake. His Majesty willed me so.

speaker: Roy
text: Majesty... Zephiel!

speaker: Idunn
text: I have woken. I am no longer who I used to be. I now clearly understand what I must do.

speaker: Idunn
text: I must lead this world... No matter how many days or nights pass, I must. I must...

speaker: Roy
text: You insist on fighting us?

speaker: Idunn
text: If you stand in my path...

speaker: Roy
text: Such strong...will...

speaker: Idunn
text: His Majesty wishes it to be. And I was woken to answer his Majesty’s calls.

speaker: Alen
text: I will protect Master Roy with my life!

speaker: Lance
text: Master Roy, Lord Eliwood... I shall show you my gratitude now!

speaker: Marcus
text: Master Roy, please be careful.

speaker: Wolt
text: No matter what happens, I will protect Master Roy...

speaker: Bors
text: I must fight a worthy battle as an Ostian knight!

speaker: Elen
text: Saint Elimine... Give us strength!

speaker: Dieck
text: Whoo... Now there’s something you don’t see every day!

speaker: Wade
text: This is it! The great battle I’ve been waiting for!

speaker: Lot
text: We must be wary...

speaker: Shanna
text: All right! Chaaaaarge!

speaker: Lugh
text: ...I won’t lose. I can defend us all!

speaker: Chad
text: I have friends I can trust. There’s no way I could lose now!

speaker: Clarine
text: This is the end! We mustn’t lose now!

speaker: Rutger
text: ...It begins.

speaker: Saul
text: Well, well... Let’s go, I suppose.

speaker: Dorothy
text: Can we win...? No, we have to win!

speaker: Sue
text: Is this the end? Or is it the beginning...

speaker: Zelot
text: Now, Ilia will know peace...

speaker: Trec
text: Sigh... Give me a break...

speaker: Noah
text: Yeah, we’ll be fine.

speaker: Astolfo
text: This could be dangerous... Well, I’ve been in enough dangerous situations already.

speaker: Lilina
text: Father... Watch over us.

speaker: Wendy
text: You’ll be fine, Wendy... Just trust in yourself.

speaker: Barth
text: We cannot afford to make a mistake this time.

speaker: Ogier
text: I know I’ve become strong... Now’s the time to show it!

speaker: Fir
text: I will win. I will win!

speaker: Sin
text: ...We’ve finally come this far.

speaker: Geese
text: I hope this’ll be the last battle.

speaker: Gonzalez
text: I’m not afraid! This time I’m not afraid!

speaker: Klein
text: The long battle is about to end.

speaker: Thea
text: I...will not lose!

speaker: Echidna
text: This is the end... Finally, it’ll end...

speaker: Larum
text: It’s...huge...

speaker: Elffin
text: Let there be peace in your dying heart...

speaker: Bartre
text: Aaaaaarrrr! My blood boils!

speaker: Raigh
text: This is the Dark Dragon...! Such immense power...! Yes...!

speaker: Cath
text: Well, let’s go then, shall we?

speaker: Percival
text: If we take our time...we can win.

speaker: Melady
text: I will not lose... For the troops back in Bern... ...For Gale...

speaker: Cecilia
text: Roy, concentrate.

speaker: Sophia
text: I can sense...a sad heart...

speaker: Igrene
text: Now...peace shall come again...

speaker: Garret
text: A truly powerful enemy! Haven’t met one in years!

speaker: Fa
text: ...Do we have to fight...sniff...

speaker: Hugh
text: Whoa! We gotta fight that thing!?

speaker: Zeiss
text: I’ll focus all my strength into this one thrust!

speaker: Niime
text: This is it! Yes! This is the power that I have been searching for!

speaker: Juno
text: The time has come...

speaker: Dayan
text: This is the Dark Dragon...

speaker: Yoder
text: Finally, the battle between Dragons and men will end at last...

speaker: Karel
text: So, let’s see the power of the Dragon.

speaker: Roy
text: I won’t give up! I have the sword of Hartmut, who pitied you and did not kill you! Everyone, leave the final blow to me!

speaker: Idunn
text: I...I... Gah... I...alone... Dark... Alone... in... darkness...

speaker: Roy
text: What’s happening... The temple is starting to collapse! Everyone! Hurry outside!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! Are you all right!?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes... But the temple is gone.

speaker: Merlinus
text: It is over a thousand years old, and a lot of energy was released in the battles that we just fought. Probably the building couldn’t withstand it.

speaker: Roy
text: I see...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Well, Master Roy, this is the end.

speaker: Roy
text: No, it’s not over yet. This is just the beginning. We have to help the land and the people recover from the war. We have much work to do. The real battle is just starting!

speaker: Fa
text: Ah!

speaker: Roy
text: What’s happening... The temple is starting to collapse! Everyone! Hurry outside!

speaker: Fa
text: Roy...

speaker: Roy
text: I know. Leave the rest to me. Now go!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! Are you all right!?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes... But the temple is gone.

speaker: Merlinus
text: It is over a thousand years old, and a lot of energy was released in the battles that we just fought. Probably the building couldn’t withstand it.

speaker: Roy
text: I see...

speaker: Merlinus
text: So, times are changing again. And... Who is that you are carrying on your back?

speaker: Roy
text: Her? Oh, right. Merlinus, I need to ask you something...

speaker: Igrene
text: Hurry, Fa! There’s a place to hide if you follow this path. Can you make it there?

speaker: Fa
text: But Fa’s tired!

speaker: Igrene
text: Don’t be stubborn. Now go, or else Bern’s soldiers might find us.

speaker: Fa
text: What about Sophia?

speaker: Igrene
text: I don’t know... Maybe she was caught by Bern’s troops.

speaker: Fa
text: If we get caught by Bern, then can we see the outside world?

speaker: Igrene
text: Fa, no. The elders said that we mustn’t communicate with the outside.

speaker: Fa
text: Aww... Please?

speaker: Igrene
text: No. ...But I wonder how Bern found out about our village... Perhaps it has something to do with the ominous energy that Sophia detected from the soldiers...

speaker: Fa
text: What’s wrong?

speaker: Igrene
text: ! I shouldn’t be thinking about such matters now. Fa! Over here, hurry!

speaker: Fa
text: ...Fa wants to see the outside world, too.

speaker: Randy
text: Zeiss! Hasn’t General Narshen arrived yet?

speaker: Zeiss
text: A band of mercenaries and some Dragons have arrived as reinforcements, but General Narshen’s group hasn’t arrived yet.

speaker: Randy
text: What is he thinking? He must know that it’s impossible to conquer the village with a small army like this...

speaker: Randy
text: Anyway, we must inform the king about the Dragons living here. Zeiss, I want you to go to Aquleia and report to King Zephiel.

speaker: Zeiss
text: What shall I say?

speaker: Randy
text: Dragons do indeed inhabit this village. According to a captive, there are also signs of ‘Divine Dragons,’ the most powerful even among Dragons.

speaker: Zeiss
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Randy
text: Make it quick.

speaker: Roy
text: Wow... This is some sandstorm.

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... This sandstorm...has always protected our village from intruders...

speaker: Roy
text: It’s going to be a pain trying to look for a village in this mess. I can’t see three meters ahead... So in which direction should we be moving?

speaker: Sophia
text: Yes... Head to the northeast... But...

speaker: Roy
text: But?

speaker: Sophia
text: There may be things hidden in the sand...blown around by the sandstorm... Please be careful where you step...

speaker: Rose
text: Maggie, my dear, did we not see someone head towards the middle of the desert?

speaker: Maggie
text: Yes, Rose, you are most correct.

speaker: Rose
text: Then, Maggie, it must be true that there is a hidden village around here.

speaker: Maggie
text: Bless my soul, Rose, I believe you are correct.

speaker: Rose
text: But, my dear Maggie, we don’t want to get lost in the sandstorm, do we?

speaker: Maggie
text: Of course not, Rose. Then we wouldn’t be able to find our way home.

speaker: Rose
text: Well then, Maggie, do you think that we should pass up the hidden village?

speaker: Maggie
text: My dear Rose, you forget that there are rumors of vast treasures hidden in that village.

speaker: Rose
text: Well, we certainly don’t want to miss that, do we, Maggie?

speaker: Maggie
text: Of course not, Rose. We can make a lot more money through that than by mugging travelers.

speaker: Rose
text: But we don’t want to get lost, either, do we, Maggie?

speaker: Maggie
text: My dear Rose, I have an idea. We may follow the people whom we saw heading into the desert earlier.

speaker: Rose
text: That’s a wonderful idea, Maggie. And once we reach the village, we can thank them by mashing their heads in.

speaker: Maggie
text: Of course, my dear Rose.

speaker: Rose
text: Well then, Maggie, shall we be off?

speaker: Maggie
text: Why certainly, my dear Rose.

speaker: Roy
text: The sandstorm...it stopped.

speaker: Merlinus
text: This is our chance, Master Roy! We can see the village clearly now!

speaker: Roy
text: But so can the enemy. We have to hurry!

speaker: Sophia
text: Something…is glittering in the sand… Oh… A beautiful ring…

speaker: Rose
text: Bless my soul, Maggie… It hurts, does it not…?

speaker: Maggie
text: Hmm… My dear Rose, maybe we were wrong…

speaker: Randy
text: My sword is invincible. Now choose your death. By the blade…or by its light?

speaker: Randy
text: I am glad…that I could meet one as strong as you…before my death.

speaker: Roy
text: That was tough...but we won. Sophia, where are the inhabitants of the village? ...What’s wrong?

speaker: Sophia
text: ...The entrance to the temple...

speaker: Roy
text: This door... It looks like it was forced open. What lies inside this temple?

speaker: Sophia
text: A spell book... We call it...the Divine Weapon...

speaker: Roy
text: Divine Weapon!? There was one here, too? ...Then that must be what Bern was after! In that case, we might be too late...!

speaker: Sophia
text: ...The Divine Weapon is still here...

speaker: Roy
text: Really? How can you tell?

speaker: Sophia
text: It is there... I can feel it...

speaker: Roy
text: All right. Let’s go! We may still be able to stop Bern!

speaker: Elder Of Arcadia
text: Who are you? How did you enter?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy. I came with Sophia to protect this village.

speaker: Elder
text: With Sophia...? Then it was you who drove off Bern’s soldiers? Oh... Please forgive my impudence. I am the Elder of Arcadia.

speaker: Roy
text: Elder... Then are you the Dragon?

speaker: Elder
text: Dragon... They once called me that. But that is a story of a time long since past.

speaker: Elder
text: Let me see... The only real Dragon we have is Fa right here.

speaker: Fa
text: Hi...

speaker: Roy
text: This little girl is a Dragon?

speaker: Elder
text: Yes, although she is far from her mature form.

speaker: Roy
text: Elder, do you know anything about the Dragons in Bern?

speaker: Elder
text: What! There are Dragons in Bern?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, we have seen them.

speaker: Elder
text: Why...? Dragons do not exist anywhere except here.

speaker: Igrene
text: Elder, if I may.

speaker: Elder
text: What is it, Igrene?

speaker: Igrene
text: Sophia said that she could detect evil energy coming from Bern’s troops. That may have something to do with the Dragons Master Roy says he saw in Bern’s army.

speaker: Elder
text: Perhaps... But I am too old to detect such energy now.

speaker: Roy
text: Energy? What is that?

speaker: Elder
text: Sophia is half Dragon, half human. That gives her the ability to detect the pulses emitted from other Dragons. But because she can’t detect them clearly, she only said that she felt a force...twisted and unnatural.

speaker: Igrene
text: I think that we should look into it. Elder, if you would allow it, I would like to join Master Roy and look at Bern’s Dragons myself.

speaker: Elder
text: I really do not want to deal with matters of the outside... But this is a time of emergency. Well then, Roy, will you take her?

speaker: Roy
text: Certainly.

speaker: Igrene
text: I am Igrene, the Guardian of Nabata. I have confidence in my skills with the bow. I believe I may be of some help in battle.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you.

speaker: Fa
text: Fa’s going, too!

speaker: Elder
text: What are you saying? Of course you may not. There is no telling what could happen if your existence were exposed to the world!

speaker: Roy
text: Well then, let’s go.

speaker: Igrene
text: Yes.

speaker: Fa
text: ...Fine... Fa will just follow them anyway!

speaker: Murdock
text: So, Narshen has fallen.

speaker: Galle
text: Yes. Lord Murdock, did we really not have to aid him?

speaker: Murdock
text: Those were the king’s orders. Besides, the Bern army has no use for a man who cannot clean up his own messes.

speaker: Roartz
text: Lord Murdock... What will become of us?

speaker: Murdock
text: Lord Arcard, I will entrust this land of Raemy to you. Lord Roartz, I will have you take the land of Edessa. You must make preparations to retaliate.

speaker: Arcard
text: What!? Raemy is right on the border! The enemy will arrive in no time!

speaker: Murdock
text: True. But this position also allows us to easily launch attacks on Etruria. Make sure this castle does not fall.

speaker: Roartz
text: Edessa... It is deep in the wastelands of Ilia...

speaker: Murdock
text: That would give you plenty of time to prepare your forces, would it not?

speaker: Arcard
text: Could you not...take back Etruria for us?

speaker: Murdock
text: We could. However, when we do, Etruria will go under Bern’s rule.

speaker: Roartz
text: No! That won’t do.

speaker: Murdock
text: Then I suggest that you find a way to deal with the situation yourselves. Excuse us.

speaker: Galle
text: My lord, were we supposed to dispose of those two like that?

speaker: Murdock
text: Don’t worry. Bern’s code says that every individual must be able to deal with the consequences of his own actions. ...The enemy leader, was his name Roy?

speaker: Galle
text: Yes.

speaker: Murdock
text: I must admit, he has done a superb job of rebuilding the Alliance Army after we crushed it so... If I have the chance, I would like to have the honor of fighting him one on one.

speaker: Yoder
text: We are soon approaching the Etrurian border.

speaker: Roy
text: Bishop Yoder, thank you for everything. Thanks to the Church, we were able to proceed thus far with ease.

speaker: Yoder
text: Please. If you had not captured Aquleia, we would be suffering from persecution under Bern. This is nothing in comparison to what you did for us.

speaker: Roy
text: I am glad that I could be of use to you.

speaker: Yoder
text: Now... May I ask you a very important favor?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, anything that I am capable of.

speaker: Yoder
text: If you find out anything else about the Dragons...

speaker: Roy
text: I understand. If I discover anything new, I will report to you immediately.

speaker: Yoder
text: Thank you! ...Ah, yes, I must tell you something else. This land of Raemy... At a certain time of the day, the sea level drops, exposing a sand bar that can be crossed.

speaker: Roy
text: A sand bar?

speaker: Yoder
text: Yes. It will take long to traverse all the way around the bay to attack the castle. However, should you be able to cross the sand bar, you may be able to save some time.

speaker: Roy
text: I see.

speaker: Yoder
text: Still, please be careful. Rushing is not always the best tactic to win a battle.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. Thank you for your advice.

speaker: Yoder
text: Of course. Then, may Saint Elimine bless the Etrurian Army!

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Arcard! A path has appeared in the sea!

speaker: Arcard
text: What!?

speaker: Soldier
text: Well... According to the locals, the tide pulls at this time of day...

speaker: Arcard
text: What!? You didn’t know about this!?

speaker: Soldier
text: But, sir, we are not from these parts! We are not familiar with the geography of this land!

speaker: Arcard
text: Damn! Charge! Prevent the enemy from crossing that path!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, we have a report.

speaker: Roy
text: Did the path in the sea appear?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. Bishop Yoder was right.

speaker: Roy
text: Did the enemy know about this?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Actually, they seem to be a panicked state.

speaker: Roy
text: All right, then let’s not miss this chance! Charge!

speaker: Arcard
text: Wh-Why! Why is this happening to me!?

speaker: Arcard
text: I...am an Etrurian...noble! I must not...die...here... Guh!

speaker: Arcard
text: Klein! You would betray me?

speaker: Klein
text: You are the one who betrayed Etruria, Lord Arcard!

speaker: Arcard
text: D-Douglas! You had turned to the enemy...!?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Arcard... What a pathetic ending for one who became so powerful.

speaker: Roy
text: Well, last year, I didn’t think we would be fighting in Sacae, either. Fate can turn out in the most unlikely ways... And that might be true for Bern as well.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...? Master Roy, what is it that you are holding in your hand?

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, this? This is the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh... So this tiny gem is...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere wanted me to keep it. It seemed...difficult for her to give it to me... She must have been truly hoping to end the war peacefully until now...where this is no hope left...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hmm... Trust between siblings? It didn’t seem likely on the outside.

speaker: Roy
text: Why not?

speaker: Merlinus
text: The enemy is Zephiel, king of Bern! It is said that he murdered his own father, so I didn’t think that he would be moved by mere family relations...

speaker: Roy
text: What!? He killed his own father?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Didn’t you know, Master Roy? Zephiel took the throne because the former king had died. But because the former king’s death was so sudden, there are many rumors going around.

speaker: Roy
text: And one of them is...

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...That King Zephiel assassinated him.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Does Princess Guinevere know about this?

speaker: Merlinus
text: She must know something about it, if not all.

speaker: Erik
text: Ah, welcome, Genral Narcian.

speaker: Narcian
text: Lord Erik. I don't think I've yet praised your wisdom in joining Bern.

speaker: Erik
text: Thank you, sire. Ancient vows and traditions are nothing more than a burden anyway.

speaker: Narcian
text: You, my friend, are wise beyond your years. Now, where is that gift you promised me? She does not seem to be here.

speaker: Erik
text: Ah, yes! She is in her quarters. She is exceedingly naive, you see. When I told her she could meet her brother, she cooperated without question. You there! Bring her here!

speaker: Clarine
text: What is this hall? Klein? Where are you, Brother?

speaker: Narcian
text: Welcome, Lady Clarine.

speaker: Clarine
text: Who might you be?

speaker: Narcian
text: I am Narcian, one of Bern's three Wyvern Generals. My lovely little lass, I think you will enjoy my company more than your brother's... Hm hm hm...

speaker: Clarine
text: Heh... Ha ha ha!

speaker: Narcian
text: What? Why do you laugh?

speaker: Clarine
text: You compare yourself to my brother? You think too highly of yourself. Your garb, your hair - even your speech... All a painfully obvious guise to hide your true lowborn face.

speaker: Narcian
text: Lowborn?! Me?! You would compare ME to a peasant?!

speaker: Clarine
text: Oh, heavens no. I would sooner compare you to a filthy, disease-ridden mutt!

speaker: Narcian
text: Y-you vermin!! I'll see you suffer!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian, we just received word that Castle Araphen was retaken by the enemy!

speaker: Narcian
text: What?! Impossible! What of Slater?

speaker: Soldier
text: Err... His whereabouts are unknown, sire. The enemy is reported to be Roy, son of Marquess Pherae.

speaker: Narcian
text: Accursed interruptions! Lord Erik, lock the girl in a cell. I will give her the pleasure of my company when I return! You, blockade the highroad from Ostia. This Roy might just pass by. I want his head!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sire!

speaker: Clarine
text: They will pay dearly for this treatment...

speaker: Unknown Person
text: ...Hey.

speaker: Clarine
text: Who's there?!

speaker: Rutger
text: I'm a mercenary hired by Lord Erik. He wants to see you.

speaker: Clarine
text: I will not. I refuse to meet with such churlish people.

speaker: Rutger
text: ......Just get over here.

speaker: Clarine
text: Let go! You will regret this! Do you have any idea who I am?!

speaker: Clarine
text: Let go, I say!

speaker: Clarine
text: Let go! Let go, I say!

speaker: Rutger
text: Keep it down. You won't be able to make a clean escape making all that noise.

speaker: Clarine
text: Escape?! Then you're...

speaker: Rutger
text: I prepared a horse for you out back under a tree. Take it and go, while everyone's distracted.

speaker: Clarine
text: .......Why are you helping me?

speaker: Rutger
text: I despise Bern with all my soul.

speaker: Clarine
text: With all your soul?

speaker: Rutger
text: ...Never mind. Forget it.

speaker: Clarine
text: Saying that only piques my curiosity further.

speaker: Rutger
text: Time is short. Hurry!

speaker: Clarine
text: I've never met such a boorish man! This is a battlefield! A proper gentleman would escort a lady to her mansion! Well, it's hardly of concern now. Sigh, I only came here to see my brother, and now look at the mess I'm in... What am I to do now?

speaker: Pirate
text: Heh... Foolish nobility. Always involved in some petty dispute. 'Course, you'll hear no complaints from us. Turmoil's how we make a living. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Erik
text: Ah, there you are!

speaker: Rutger
text: What do you want?

speaker: Erik
text: We need some backup. Take some troops and prepare for battle.

speaker: Erik
text: Are you deaf? Go and fight!

speaker: Rutger
text: I heard you. I'll leave when I'm ready.

speaker: Erik
text: Tsk. Not the amiable sort, is he? If his sword arm is as skilled as the rumors say, though, then it's no matter.

speaker: Clarine
text: Pardon me, you there!

speaker: Roy
text: Me?

speaker: Clarine
text: Do you see anyone else? You are the leader of this little group, are you not?

speaker: Roy
text: I am.

speaker: Clarine
text: Most convenient. Very well then. You will protect me.

speaker: Roy
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Clarine
text: Hard of hearing? I said that you are going to protect me from harm.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Mind your mouth, young lady!

speaker: Clarine
text: Away with you, peasant. I was not addressing you.

speaker: Merlinus
text: What?! Who do you think-

speaker: Roy
text: Calm yourself, Merlinus... It looks like she's being pursued by the castle's soldiers. That's why she wants us to guard her. Right?

speaker: Clarine
text: Um, yes! That is correct...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Im...impudent child! We can't simply accept any useless girl into our army!

speaker: Clarine
text: You may call me Lady Clarine, peasant. And I am not useless! I can use staves to heal wounded allies.

speaker: Roy
text: So you'll help us fight?

speaker: Clarine
text: ...If that's what it takes! I suppose I can't simply demand protection without any kind of payment.

speaker: Roy
text: Thanks, we appreciate it! Our enemy is Bern, so we need everyone we can get. I'm Roy. Pleased to meet you, Lady Clarine.

speaker: Clarine
text: The pleasure is all- Ahem! Let's focus on the issue at hand.

speaker: Clarine
text: Oh! It's you...

speaker: Rutger
text: What? You're still here?

speaker: Clarine
text: Still here? You abandoned me in the middle of a battlefield! How can you have the nerve to say that?! I could have been killed!

speaker: Rutger
text: I guess you're lucky you're still alive then. Did you want something or can I go now?

speaker: Clarine
text: Just a moment! I shan't allow you to abandon me twice. A gentleman must take responsibility for his actions.

speaker: Rutger
text: Responsibility? For what? I saved you from that twisted sadist.

speaker: Clarine
text: If a gentleman rescues a lady, he must also escort her to her mansion! In what fairy tale does some barf of a man abandon his princess?

speaker: Rutger
text: ...What in the world are you on about?

speaker: Clarine
text: Besides, you said you "despise Bern with all your soul." If you ask me, you'd be better of joining us. We'll be fighting Bern, you know.

speaker: Rutger
text: What? Wait! Is that true? Is that army you're in really going to challenge Bern?

speaker: Clarine
text: Yes... Our leader, Floyd or whatever his name is, told me himself.

speaker: Clarine
text: Yes?

speaker: Rutger
text: I'll join your army. Satisfied?

speaker: Clarine
text: Ah... I suppose.

speaker: Clarine
text: Wait! My protection is more important than fighting Bern! Come back!

speaker: Village
text: If you don't have a thief, you won't be able to open chests and doors. Only a thief can use lockpicks. But I have a key called the door key, which can open any door if anyone uses it. You should thank me.

speaker: Village
text: Everyone here is your ally. We're not about to abandon the land in which we were born in and change sides. Please take this treasured sword. It was given to us generations ago. A gift from the king.

speaker: Village
text: I can't believe this war is happening... Under Bern's leadership, we will definitely wither. Here is something that will help you stand longer. Think carefully before using it.

speaker: House
text: The mountain bandits and pirates attack towns. Once they destroy a town, there won't be anything left. Save the towns!

speaker: House
text: In the Laus army, there are mounted soldiers who use bows. This is the nomad tribe. Everyone wants their military might nowadays...

speaker: House
text: Do you know the main point of combat? There are weapons known as Buster weapons, which defy the weapon triangle!

speaker: Erik
text: You fools are bound down by moldy, old tradition! Allow me to teach you the way of the world!

speaker: Erik
text: Ha...ha ha... Fools... There is no future for...those...who oppose...absolute power...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy! The remaining soldiers from Laus are retreating.

speaker: Roy
text: Thank you. Tell everyone to get some rest.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy... Are you all right?

speaker: Roy
text: I never would have thought Lord Erik would turn on Lycia. I thought the Lycian League's bond was stronger than this. Cowardly Bern! Underhanded tactics!

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I apologize.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh... I'm sorry. I wasn't even thinking about you.

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... You are right.

speaker: Roy
text: We'll now proceed west towards Ostia. But now we know that even the other marquesses can't be trusted. With Lord Hector gone, I fear there may be no peaceful end for this war. Princess, do you plan on returning to Bern? If you need anything-

speaker: Guinevere
text: No, please allow me to stay, if it would not be a burden.

speaker: Roy
text: You, a burden? Never! But why do you wish to stay?

speaker: Guinevere
text: My brother is wrong. He is pulling the dragons into a human war. If he thinks this is how he can free the world, I must stop him.

speaker: Roy
text: Free the world?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes, he has always been obsessed with "liberating the world." He said that's the purpose of this war.

speaker: Roy
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Guinevere
text: I do not know... My brother is not so power-hungry that he would attempt to conquer the world. I'm sure he believes strongly in what he's done to Elibe. Regardless, that doesn't excuse the violence he has caused...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinivere...

speaker: Roartz
text: They let the enemy inside!? Damn! If I am to go to Hell, then that Roy shall be going down with me!

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Roartz! The remnants of the Djute clan are saying that they will come to our aid once they have securely hidden the Miurgre.

speaker: Roartz
text: Miurgre? Ah, one of the Divine Weapons. Good, then we must hold our own until then!

speaker: Roy
text: This is Roartz’s manor...

speaker: Niime
text: I understand that this mansion holds methods of attacking through little cracks in the framework. You must not think you that are safe just because your back is to the wall.

speaker: Roy
text: Do you know much about this place?

speaker: Niime
text: Well, I am at least slightly known to know more than most people. The rumor about this manor is something I picked up back in the city.

speaker: Roy
text: ...Do you know what the Dark Dragon looks like?

speaker: Niime
text: Well, I can’t say I’m absolutely sure about that. But I would love to see it with my own eyes.

speaker: Roy
text: I was thinking... Maybe the Dark Dragon is in human form as well.

speaker: Niime
text: Perhaps. Maybe all the Dragons are in human form now. I’ve also heard stories of Dragons in human form living with people.

speaker: Roy
text: Arcadia...

speaker: Niime
text: Hm? Did you say something?

speaker: Roy
text: No, nothing.

speaker: Niime
text: I don’t know anything specific, but I’ve read in an ancient scroll that Dragons started taking human form only after the Ending Winter.

speaker: Roy
text: The Ending Winter...

speaker: Niime
text: You’ve heard about it, right?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, only in legend. ‘At the Winder of Ends, the laws of nature were turned upside down. Day became night, and summer became winter.'

speaker: Niime
text: That’s it. These scrolls are so old and damaged so I couldn’t decipher all of them, but one thing is clear. The Ending Winter was a disaster powerful enough to bend and twist the planet.

speaker: Roy
text: What caused it?

speaker: Niime
text: Who knows... Popular belief says that the laws of nature were twisted when the Dragons unleashed vast amounts of magical power, but I have no idea about what really happened. But it does seem certain that Dragons started taking human form after the Ending Winter. It must be more than coincidence.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, I agree.

speaker: Niime
text: Well, either way, the truth lies in Bern.

speaker: Dayan
text: Good, the mansion is in chaos. I shall fight those Bern troops alone, to the death!

speaker: Thoril
text: Those pigs from Etruria…! I shall avenge my Djute brothers right here, right now!

speaker: Dayan
text: Are you the Etrurian General leading this group?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. And you are?

speaker: Dayan
text: I am Dayan.

speaker: Roy
text: Dayan...? I’ve heard that name somewhere...

speaker: Dayan
text: I must first thank you. My clan was always fighting against Bern and the clans that submitted to them. We were forced to reside to guerilla warfare instead of going up against them honorably, face to face. However, now that you have attacked Bern, the tables are beginning to tip in our favor.

speaker: Roy
text: I see. I am glad that I could help.

speaker: Dayan
text: But I want to ask you one thing. Once this battle is over, do you intend to withdraw your troops right away?

speaker: Roy
text: After this battle?

speaker: Dayan
text: Yes. Sacae belongs to us Sacaeans. If authoritarian rule by Bern is only to be replaced by Etrurian rule, then we would have to fight you next.

speaker: Roy
text: Right after this battle... That would not be possible. We must have Sacae as a base to launch direct attacks on Bern.

speaker: Dayan
text: What... Directly into Bern’s lands?

speaker: Roy
text: Even if we could drive off Bern now, it would only be a matter of time until they strike back at us. We must destroy their roots. Right?

speaker: Dayan
text: Yes, you are right. I see...in that case, I shall aid you.

speaker: Roy
text: That would help us tremendously.

speaker: Dayan
text: But once Bern is defeated, you must withdraw your troops from Sacae. Is that all right with you?

speaker: Roy
text: Of course. You have my word.

speaker: Roartz
text: S-Someone! Come and defend me! It is all over if I am hurt!

speaker: Roartz
text: W-Wait... Be my servant! It is still not too late... I shall...forgive your crime of turning your blade...toward me... Guh...!

speaker: Roartz
text: Douglas... Hmph! After all that you said, you too are following those with power!

speaker: Douglas
text: Perhaps it may seem that way from the outside. But there is no hesitation in my heart now.

speaker: Roartz
text: Silence! I have just about had enough of you. Die here!

speaker: Roy
text: Next is Bern...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! We have reports that the remainders of the Djute clan are hiding in some ruins near here.

speaker: Roy
text: Ruins?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. And we also have a captive who says that a bow used during the Scouring is hidden there.

speaker: Roy
text: What? Then...

speaker: Merlinus
text: It’s highly possible that it is a Divine Weapon.

speaker: Roy
text: We must get to those ruins! Let’s go!

speaker: Roy
text: Merlinus, I need you to send this letter to Bishop Yoder in Etruria.

speaker: Merlinus
text: A letter? May I ask what it says?

speaker: Roy
text: It’s the story we heard from Niime about the Dragons.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh? What did you discuss with her about the Dragons?

speaker: Roy
text: It’ll be long if I tell you. I haven’t sealed the letter yet, so you can look through it if you want.

speaker: Merlinus
text: All right. Let me see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Roy.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess, is something wrong?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...We enter Bern now.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. We will attack Bern very soon. So...may I ask the rest of the story now...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Yes. That is why I came to you.

speaker: Roy
text: King Zephiel was an outstanding pupil is his studies, he was skilled in warcraft... He grew to be the perfect heir for the king.

speaker: Guinevere
text: That is correct.

speaker: Roy
text: But still, the former king did not look kindly at him.

speaker: Guinevere
text: In fact... Our father began to hate Zephiel because he grew to become such a brilliant and worthy youth.

speaker: Roy
text: What...is that supposed to mean...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Our father was a man of ordinary skill and intellect. Therefore, Zephiel’s outstanding skill made our father cold towards him.

speaker: Roy
text: Jealousy...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: And then one day, our father told Zephiel that ‘the next heir to Bern would be Guinevere’s husband.'

speaker: Roy
text: What! That’s awful!

speaker: Guinevere
text: But Zephiel was very patient. He said that he did not mind even if he could not gain the throne. But the people around us, who were looking forward to Zephiel’s ability to be a good king, would not allow anyone else to be the heir. Pressured by the public, our father lost his patience at last, and...

speaker: Roy
text: Decided to kill King Zephiel...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: At a banquet, our father gave Zephiel a poisoned drink from his own hands. And that was the first and last cup that Zephiel took from our father. After returning to his room, Zephiel started to get sick. For ten days and nights, Zephiel lingered between life and death. But Murdock, Zephiel’s teacher and loyal general, saved his life.

speaker: Roy
text: ...The former king never did anything after that?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... But I have heard that he had plans to get rid of Murdock and Zephiel’s mother as traitors. He was scheming to murder them all along with Zephiel. After hearing that, Zephiel made believe that he was dead. Our father then checked the coffin to confirm Zephiel’s death. At that moment, Zephiel rose up from the coffin and...with his sword...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I was but a child then, so naturally I could not have understood what was going on. All I knew is that after our father died, Zephiel never smiled again. Until then, he was strict at times, but he was always a kind and loving brother to me. So...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess...

speaker: Guinevere
text: So I... At the bottom of my heart, I trust that Zephiel can change, that he can become that loving brother again. I...had to take action.

speaker: Roy
text: I...see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...But now, my brother is in a place where my words cannot reach him. Roy, please... Please stop him. Please stop him from inflicting pain and suffering to the people of Bern...and the rest of Elibe.

speaker: Roy
text: Even if it may resolve to the blade?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I have made my resolve when I entrusted this task to you.

speaker: Roy
text: I see. You have my word and loyalty, Princess Guinevere. I swear to the Fire Emblem that I will stop King Zephiel!

speaker: Roartz
text: Well? Have we got enough troops?

speaker: Soldier
text: Well... We are requesting aid from Ilia’s knights, but all of them except those that have been given direct orders from Lord Murdock are hesitant to help us.

speaker: Roartz
text: Damn! How could this happen... ...Ah, we had captured Zelot’s wife and his family. How about Zelot’s group? Have they responded?

speaker: Soldier
text: No... They have been traveling all over the continent as mercenary knights, so we do not even know their exact location.

speaker: Roartz
text: Damn...

speaker: Soldier
text: Ever since Sigune’s group was defeated, all of Ilia’s militia have been reluctant to fight the Etrurian Army.

speaker: Roartz
text: Blast! Everyone, everyone is such a coward! They would have me, top advisor to the Etrurian Court, die in a place like this!?

speaker: Old Woman
text: Cough, cough...

speaker: Juno
text: Are you all right? Here, take my shawl.

speaker: Old Woman
text: N-No, then you would be cold...

speaker: Juno
text: It’s all right, I’m used to the cold. It’s far better than flying through the blizzards on a pegasus.

speaker: Old Woman
text: ...Thank you. Cough, cough...

speaker: Girl
text: Lady Juno... What’s going to happen to us?

speaker: Juno
text: ...I don’t know. But we must have hope. Perhaps the enemy might leave, or perhaps Zelot might return. We must not give up hope.

speaker: Girl
text: ...Where is Lord Zelot now?

speaker: Juno
text: In his last letter he said that he was joining the Lycia Alliance Army, but after that... Well, he could be closer that we think he is.

speaker: Girl
text: I hope you’re right.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...We fight again today.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes. When we take this castle, we can use it as a base to launch attacks on Bern.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Yes.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess... May I ask the reason why Bern’s former king tried to murder King Zephiel?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Zephiel and I were born from different mothers. I am actually only his half-sister.

speaker: Roy
text: I heard that Zephiel’s mother was the queen of Etruria.

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes. It was an arranged marriage to strengthen the tie between Bern and Etruria. However, our father already had a woman he loved at that time. She is my mother.

speaker: Guinevere
text: The marriage between our father and Zephiel’s mother was forced. Therefore, our father didn’t love Zephiel’s mother, and always thought badly of Zephiel.

speaker: Roy
text: Then is that why the former king and King Zephiel had a bad relationship?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... Even then, Zephiel was always trying his best to gain our father’s affection. He excelled in his studies and military training, and he was always trying hard. He grew to become a proud heir to Bern’s throne.

speaker: Roy
text: Then why did the king try to...

speaker: Soldier
text: Master Roy! We are ready for the attack!

speaker: Roy
text: All right, I’ll be there in a minute! Princess Guinevere, I’m sorry, but...

speaker: Guinevere
text: No, it is all right. Please be careful.

speaker: Roy
text: The blizzard is picking up… This might take longer than we expected. We should head for Bern as soon as we take the castle.

speaker: Zelot
text: Juno!

speaker: Juno
text: Zelot!

speaker: Zelot
text: Are you all right? You’re not hurt? They didn’t do anything terrible to you?

speaker: Juno
text: Oh, Zelot, I am no child. I am the ex-flightleader of the Pegasus Knight Fleet, you know.

speaker: Zelot
text: That’s true, but...

speaker: Juno
text: I’m all right. I’m not hurt or anything.

speaker: Zelot
text: Good...

speaker: Juno
text: Why are you in the Etrurian Army? I thought you were with the Lycia Alliance.

speaker: Zelot
text: Well, it’s a long story... Anyway, this is the Etrurian Army only by name. It is actually made up of troops from the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Juno
text: Oh... I see.

speaker: Zelot
text: I’m sorry. I couldn’t be at the castle when I was needed the most...

speaker: Juno
text: There’s no point in dwelling on the past.

speaker: Zelot
text: But you had to go out and fight...

speaker: Juno
text: Oh? Don’t you like my flightleader outfit?

speaker: Zelot
text: Of course I do! But...

speaker: Juno
text: Then there’s no problem. You’ll be seeing a lot of it from now on.

speaker: Zelot
text: What! Do you mean...

speaker: Juno
text: Yes. I will fight alongside you as well.

speaker: Zelot
text: No! No no no. You retired long ago. So just leave the fighting to us...

speaker: Juno
text: Even after I retired, I had to fight anyway. Zelot, there is no safe place in the world any more.

speaker: Zelot
text: Well...

speaker: Juno
text: So I will fight, so I can help bring a time of peace all the more quickly.

speaker: Thea
text: Juno!

speaker: Juno
text: Thea... What are you doing here?

speaker: Thea
text: It’s a long story... But anyway, I’m with the Etrurian Army now. I heard Edessa had fallen to Bern, and I was worried, but... I’m glad to see you’re all right.

speaker: Juno
text: ...I thought you were originally fighting for the people who were fighting against the Etrurian Army. You didn’t...

speaker: Thea
text: No! I didn’t go against the Ilian Mercenary Code. I fulfilled my duties as a mercenary and then joined the Etrurian Army.

speaker: Juno
text: Of course... You’re a good and diligent girl. You wouldn’t do something like that. I’m sorry.

speaker: Thea
text: No, it’s all right... And, um... What are you wearing?

speaker: Juno
text: This? Why, this is my military outfit, as you very well know. Well, what do you think? Don’t you think I can still go on as flightleader?

speaker: Thea
text: But... I thought you retired.

speaker: Juno
text: I can’t be saying that in this time of emergency! On my own, all I could do was rescue the people in the castle, but if I joined you, I could fight against Bern as well.

speaker: Thea
text: So you’re going to fight alongside us?

speaker: Juno
text: Yes.

speaker: Thea
text: Yes! I never thought I could fight alongside you again.

speaker: Juno
text: Don’t get cocky now. I haven’t gotten too rusty yet either!

speaker: Shanna
text: Big Sister Juno!

speaker: Juno
text: Shanna? Why are you here?

speaker: Shanna
text: I’ve been in the Etrurian Army. I was surprised when I heard that Edessa got taken by Bern, but I knew you’d be okay!

speaker: Juno
text: Oh? Why do you say that?

speaker: Shanna
text: You were captain of the Fleet! There’s no way Bern could defeat you.

speaker: Juno
text: Thank you. Well, you’ll be sorry to hear that I was captured.

speaker: Shanna
text: Well, that’s...

speaker: Juno
text: But I won’t stay defeated by Bern for long. On my own, all I could do was rescue the people in the castle, but if I joined you, I could fight against Bern as well.

speaker: Shanna
text: Then are you going to fight with us?

speaker: Juno
text: Yes.

speaker: Shanna
text: Really? Yes!

speaker: Juno
text: Does that make you so excited?

speaker: Shanna
text: Yes! I became a Pegasus Knight because I wanted to be like you. Fighting alongside you is like a dream.

speaker: Juno
text: My, my... Well, you always did tend to go overboard with things...

speaker: Roy
text: Next is Bern...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy! Part of Bern’s army is hiding in the ruins on the outskirts of Edessa!

speaker: Roy
text: Ruins?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. Apparently, in them lies a spear that was used during the Scouring.

speaker: Roy
text: What? That spear...

speaker: Merlinus
text: It is most probably a Divine Weapon.

speaker: Roy
text: We must hurry to the ruins!

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, we will attack Bern now. So may I ask...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...The rest of the story.

speaker: Roy
text: King Zephiel was an outstanding pupil is his studies, he was skilled in warcraft... He grew to be the perfect heir for the king.

speaker: Guinevere
text: That is correct.

speaker: Roy
text: But still, the former king did not look kindly at him.

speaker: Guinevere
text: In fact... Our father began to hate Zephiel because he grew to become such a brilliant and worthy youth.

speaker: Roy
text: What...is that supposed to mean...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: Our father was a man of ordinary skill and intellect. Therefore, Zephiel’s outstanding skill made our father cold towards him.

speaker: Roy
text: Jealousy...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: And then one day, our father told Zephiel that ‘the next heir to Bern would be Guinevere’s husband.'

speaker: Roy
text: What! That’s awful!

speaker: Guinevere
text: But Zephiel was very patient. He said that he did not mind even if he could not gain the throne. But the people around us, who were looking forward to Zephiel’s ability to be a good king, would not allow anyone else to be the heir. Pressured by the public, our father lost his patience at last, and...

speaker: Roy
text: Decided to kill King Zephiel...?

speaker: Guinevere
text: At a banquet, our father gave Zephiel a poisoned drink from his own hands. And that was the first and last cup that Zephiel took from our father. After returning to his room, Zephiel started to get sick. For ten days and nights, Zephiel lingered between life and death. But Murdock, Zephiel’s teacher and loyal general, saved his life.

speaker: Roy
text: ...The former king never did anything after that?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No... But I have heard that he had plans to get rid of Murdock and Zephiel’s mother as traitors. He was scheming to murder them all along with Zephiel. After hearing that, Zephiel made believe that he was dead. Our father then checked the coffin to confirm Zephiel’s death. At that moment, Zephiel rose up from the coffin and...with his sword...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I was but a child then, so naturally I could not have understood what was going on. All I knew is that after our father died, Zephiel never smiled again. Until then, he was strict at times, but he was always a kind and loving brother to me. So...

speaker: Roy
text: Princess...

speaker: Guinevere
text: So I... At the bottom of my heart, I trust that Zephiel can change, that he can become that loving brother again. I...had to take action.

speaker: Roy
text: I...see...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...But now, my brother is in a place where my words cannot reach him. Roy, please... Please stop him. Please stop him from inflicting pain and suffering to the people of Bern...and the rest of Elibe.

speaker: Roy
text: Even if it may resolve to the blade?

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...I have made my resolve when I entrusted this task to you.

speaker: Roy
text: I see. You have my word and loyalty, Princess Guinevere. I swear to the Fire Emblem that I will stop King Zephiel!

speaker: Girl
text: Excuse me...

speaker: Guinevere
text: Yes...?

speaker: Girl
text: Are you the one who saved us?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No, I am...

speaker: Girl
