text: Thank you! Thanks to you, we can now stand here safely. Please accept this token of our gratitude.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Thank you!

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...... I shall hand this to Roy...

speaker: Narcian
text: Damn...! The Lycia Alliance Army still stands! How could they come this far...!

speaker: Soldier
text: G-General Narcian... The leader of the Three Dragon Lords, Lord Murdock is here!

speaker: Narcian
text: What!? H-Hurry! Send someone out to escort him here! Make sure he gets the utmost attention...

speaker: Soldier
text: He already is here...

speaker: Murdock
text: Enough. Step aside.

speaker: Narcian
text: L-Lord Murdock... What a pleasant surprise! What brings you all the way from Ilia?

speaker: Murdock
text: Narcian, I believe you owe me an explanation.

speaker: Narcian
text: I-I’m sorry, my lord, I’m not sure I understand...

speaker: Murdock
text: Princess Guinevere has escaped, again. Flaer, your lieutenant, has failed at Western Isles. Also, you have neglected your mission of capturing the hidden village in Nabata, as given by the king himself! Narcian! I want explanations. Now!

speaker: Narcian
text: Y-Yes... Well, you see, my lord, there have been many complications, and...

speaker: Murdock
text: ...Enough. I have orders from the king. You are to be demoted from Dragon Lord status.

speaker: Narcian
text: What!?

speaker: Murdock
text: His Majesty wants Galle to take your place.

speaker: Narcian
text: M-My lord! Please wait! One more chance, please! Just give me one more chance!

speaker: Murdock
text: ...The Lycia Alliance Army is approaching this palace. Stop them to show me your worth. If you succeed, I shall negotiate with the king.

speaker: Narcian
text: Lord Murdock...

speaker: Murdock
text: Narcian... Don’t fail the king...or me, again.

speaker: Narcian
text: Rubbish! Me, demoted!? And my replacement is that Galle...! Never! I will never allow that to happen! B-But what can I do... No...! My honor, my status... It’s all collapsing!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian, the enemy is approaching...

speaker: Narcian
text: Shut up! I know that. ...Wait. The brother of that traitor, Melady, was here, wasn’t he... Ah! I can say that we failed because he was working with his sister to leak information to the enemy, and kill him off later! Hehehe...

speaker: Soldier
text: General Narcian... What are you thinking?

speaker: Narcian
text: Hm? Oh, do you know Melady’s younger brother?

speaker: Soldier
text: Do you mean Sir Zeiss?

speaker: Narcian
text: Right, Zeiss. Anyway, he’s suspected of leaking information to the Lycia Alliance Army. Capture him and bring him here.

speaker: Soldier
text: What? But Sir Zeiss would never do something like that...

speaker: Narcian
text: Shut up! All you must do is follow my orders! Now bring him here!

speaker: Arcard
text: T-The enemy is right at our doorstep!

speaker: Roartz
text: Oh...what must we do! If we get caught, we shall be prosecuted as the initiators of the coup d’etat...!

speaker: Roartz
text: ...Arcard! This is all your fault! If you had done your duty and gotten rid of the Lycia Alliance Army at Djuto...

speaker: Arcard
text: B-But Lord Roartz...! ...No! This is not the time to be arguing, my lord! We must escape!

speaker: Roartz
text: But escape to where...

speaker: Arcard
text: ...Let us turn to Bern! This was originally their plan...

speaker: Roartz
text: Y-Yes, of course! We have done what they asked of us. They would be sure to help us.

speaker: Douglas
text: ...May I ask what you intend to do with the king?

speaker: Roartz
text: Er... W-Well, I’m sure they wouldn’t harm the king. After all, King Zephiel’s mother was an Etrurian. Anyway, Douglas, you must escape as well...

speaker: Douglas
text: I refuse. I was originally fighting alongside you because King Mordred’s safety was at stake. I had no intention of going along with your plans.

speaker: Roartz
text: Hmph! Stubborn as always, I see. Suit yourself. Arcard, let us escape!

speaker: Arcard
text: Lord Roartz! Please wait...

speaker: Douglas
text: ...Dirty traitors! Fleeing at the last minute... It must have been easy for Bern to seduce them. I suppose I can leave those two to the Lycia Alliance Army... If Prince Mildain returns...Etruria will pull itself together again. And until then... I shall fight and prove my loyalty as the Great General of Etruria!

speaker: Yoder
text: Master Roy, this is the palace of Aquleia. According to the information we have gathered, the Revolutionaries have holed up inside.

speaker: Roy
text: Bishop Yoder, I thank you for your help. Thanks to the Elimine Church, we were able to avoid fighting in the city and killing innocent people.

speaker: Yoder
text: No, I must thank you. Our order was being persecuted by the Revolutionaies, so if you hadn’t come along to fight, we would have been driven out of the land a long time ago.

speaker: Roy
text: Persecuted? Why?

speaker: Yoder
text: Most likely because we were investigating into Bern’s Dragons. Saint Elimine, our founder, said this before she ascended to heaven: ‘Never allow the Dragons to be brought back to the world... It would spell death for many a people.’ Therefore, we are making our best efforts to find a way to send the Dragons back to the world in which they belong.

speaker: Roy
text: If the Revolutionaries had joined Bern, then they would naturally want to stop you...

speaker: Yoder
text: That’s right. Also, we found out this: The resurrection of the Dragons is somehow tied to the Fire Emblem, Bern’s greatest treasure. That was where I sent Saul and Dorothy to investigate.

speaker: Roy
text: I see.

speaker: Yoder
text: Master Roy, you must stop the Revolutionaries. And if you would allow me to give you further advice, I would suggest that you do not do any unnecessary killing. I am sure there are troops that had no choice but to join the Revolutionaries due to inside reasons.

speaker: Roy
text: Yes.

speaker: Yoder
text: May Saint Elimine bless you, Master Roy.

speaker: Galle
text: Zeiss. Where are you?

speaker: Zeiss
text: I’m here, Sir Galle. Is something wrong? Why did you summon me here...

speaker: Galle
text: There is no time to be explaining the details. Zeiss, you must hide.

speaker: Zeiss
text: ...What do you mean? The enemy is right in front of us!

speaker: Galle
text: Zeiss, listen to me. Just now, General Narcian gave an order to the entire army...to capture you.

speaker: Zeiss
text: What!? Does he think that I am betraying Bern?

speaker: Galle
text: He is trying to put the responsibility for all of his past failures on your shoulders. He is saying that you worked with Melady to leak information to the enemy.

speaker: Zeiss
text: With my sister? We don’t even know where she is.

speaker: Galle
text: Melady has apparently joined the Lycia Alliance Army with the Princess.

speaker: Zeiss
text: !! Melady turned to the enemy!? I don’t believe it...

speaker: Galle
text: Then get the story from her yourself. I want to go with you as well, but I have been told by Lord Murdock to observe the battle and report back to him. Zeiss, I want you escape when you see the chance and speak with Melady.

speaker: Zeiss
text: Sir Galle! I...

speaker: Galle
text: I do not intend on doing anything until we hear Melady’s story.

speaker: Hugh
text: What the? The Etrurian nobles ran off? Wait a minute, then what happens to my payment? I haven’t been paid for this mission yet!

speaker: Cath
text: The treasures are calling me! So this is the palace of the richest family in Elibe... The treasure must be something indeed. Well, they took it all from us in the first place, so I guess I’ll only be taking it back!

speaker: Hugh
text: Hey, you! You’re the leader of the army that’s attacking the castle, right? Do you have a shortage in magicians?

speaker: Roy
text: ? Well, I guess we could always use more...

speaker: Hugh
text: Really? Great! You see, there’s a Mage willing to fight for you. You think you would want to hire him?

speaker: Roy
text: Where is he?

speaker: Hugh
text: Right in front of you!

speaker: Hugh
text: Hey, don’t look at me like that! I’m pretty decent with my magic. You can hire me for 10000 gold.

speaker: Roy
text: 10000! That’s expensive...

speaker: Hugh
text: Come on! I need money for my grandma...

speaker: Roy
text: What? Is your grandmother sick or something?

speaker: Hugh
text: Er... R-Right! Something to that nature... Anyway, I need some cash. Come on, pal!

speaker: Roy
text: Well...

speaker: Roy
text: All right, if your grandmother’s sick, then I suppose you need money for medicine...

speaker: Hugh
text: You got that right! She’s really sick, you know. She’s always getting these really bad headaches around her back...

speaker: Roy
text: Huh? Headaches around her back?

speaker: Hugh
text: Um, y-you know what I mean, I was just giving an example of the pain... ...Okay, got the money. I’ll do my job well. You can count on me!

speaker: Roy
text: I’m sorry, but I can’t pay 10000 gold for just one person.

speaker: Hugh
text: What! ...W-Well, I could compensate with 8000...

speaker: Hugh
text: Come on, please?

speaker: Roy
text: Well...

speaker: Roy
text: I’m sorry, but...

speaker: Hugh
text: S-Still no good? Um...well, I guess 6000 gold would still do...

speaker: Roy
text: Er...

speaker: Hugh
text: Please. I really need the money...

speaker: Roy
text: Well...

speaker: Hugh
text: ...... All right, all right! I’m really getting desperate now... 5000! How’s that!

speaker: Hugh
text: Come on, I’m begging you! Please hire me!

speaker: Roy
text: Well...

speaker: Roy
text: ...I’m sorry.

speaker: Hugh
text: No... ...Please...I swear I’ll be really useful...

speaker: Roy
text: The money we have belongs to all of us. I have no right to use it on my own judgment.

speaker: Hugh
text: Argh! I give up! Fine! Have it your way. Just when I thought you were somebody... Ha! You’ve got some pretty nice beliefs, haven’t you, kid!

speaker: Elffin
text: Douglas!

speaker: Douglas
text: Prince Mildain! You’ve returned! You seem so well now...thank goodness.

speaker: Elffin
text: It is all thanks to you. I am sorry I put you through this.

speaker: Douglas
text: You returned safely... That is more than enough praise.

speaker: Elffin
text: Douglas, I am currently working with the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Douglas
text: Ah! Then everything will go smoothly as long as we can drive off Bern’s troops from the palace.

speaker: Elffin
text: What...are you going to do?

speaker: Douglas
text: The king is still in the enemy’s hands. If I turn against Bern now, the king would be in danger...

speaker: Douglas
text: But now that you have returned, I have no more regrets, even if I were to be defeated by the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Elffin
text: Douglas...I apologize. You are doing this all for my father...

speaker: Douglas
text: My Prince, if my life were to be used for the true benefit of Etruria, then that would be my last wish.

speaker: Douglas
text: I am glad that I could see you alive before my death.

speaker: Elffin
text: You risked your life to protect me and let me escape to the Western Isles. I shall never forget that. ...Never.

speaker: Douglas
text: ...I still have false hope. I still think of trying to take you to see the king...

speaker: Elffin
text: ...Douglas, I will not give up hope. Roy...he just might be able to...

speaker: Larum
text: Father!

speaker: Douglas
text: Larum! What are you doing here?

speaker: Larum
text: I joined the Lycia Alliance Army with Prince Mildain...

speaker: Douglas
text: ! So the prince has returned! Now Etruria has hope...

speaker: Larum
text: Father...

speaker: Douglas
text: Larum... I’m sorry I put you through this. I had to send you off along to protect the prince.

speaker: Larum
text: No! That was what I wanted to do.

speaker: Douglas
text: ...But just when I thought I had saved you from a hard life, I had to send you out to be a dancer again.

speaker: Larum
text: ...You saved me from that terrible life with no food...no money... And you even raised me as your own daughter... From that time, I made up my mind that I would one day return the gift, that I would be of some use to you.

speaker: Douglas
text: Larum...

speaker: Larum
text: So I’m really...glad, now. I’m finally being useful to you...

speaker: Douglas
text: Larum, thank you. ...Please take care of the prince from now on as well.

speaker: Larum
text: What about you? You’re not coming with us?

speaker: Douglas
text: King Mordred is still in the hands of the enemy. If I turn to Lycia Alliance Army now, then the king’s life would be in danger.

speaker: Larum
text: ...But still...

speaker: Douglas
text: Now that the prince has returned safely, I have no regrets, even I am to be taken down by the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Douglas
text: Now go. If you are seen with me, you would be suspected of treachery. No matter where you are, you will always be my true daughter. Always.

speaker: Larum
text: Father...

speaker: Douglas
text: May your life be blessed with happiness...

speaker: Douglas
text: Cecilia.

speaker: Cecilia
text: Lord Douglas... Why is someone of your stature fighting for the Revolutionaries...?

speaker: Douglas
text: I am prioritizing the king’s safety. That is all.

speaker: Cecilia
text: But if this continues, Etruria will become a puppet state for Bern! There must be a nation for there to be a king. If the nation falls, so will its power. And in the end, all will be forgotten!

speaker: Douglas
text: If this nation is doomed to collapse...then so be it. But I will assure the king’s safety!

speaker: Cecilia
text: What...! We must fight for our people, for our nation! The Etrurian army is for the people. They are not the king’s private soldiers!

speaker: Douglas
text: ...It is a matter of opinion. Cecilia, you must follow your beliefs, as I must follow mine.

speaker: Percival
text: Lord Douglas!

speaker: Douglas
text: Percival... I see no more hesitation in your eyes now.

speaker: Percival
text: Lord Douglas, it is thanks to you. Because you saved Prince Mildain, I was able to return to being an honorable knight again.

speaker: Douglas
text: Good.

speaker: Percival
text: What are you going to do, Lord Douglas?

speaker: Douglas
text: The king is still in the hands of the enemy. If I turn to Lycia Alliance Army now, then the king’s life would be in danger.

speaker: Douglas
text: Now that the prince has returned, I have no regrets, even if I am to be taken down by the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Percival
text: I knew you would say that, my lord.

speaker: Douglas
text: Well, you have walked the same path as I. Please take care of the prince...and of Etruria.

speaker: Percival
text: Yes. I shall dedicate my life to them.

speaker: Zeiss
text: Melady!

speaker: Melady
text: Zeiss!? What are you doing here?

speaker: Zeiss
text: ...I’m being accused of betraying Bern.

speaker: Melady
text: Oh...! Is it...my fault...?

speaker: Zeiss
text: Sir Galle said that you had joined the enemy. But I couldn’t believe it until now, when I can see it with my own eyes! Why! Why did you betray Bern?

speaker: Melady
text: I never betrayed Bern. I just wanted to help Princess Guinevere.

speaker: Zeiss
text: So you threw away everything...your homeland, your family, even your lover...for the princess. For that...stubborn princess who betrayed her own brother!

speaker: Melady
text: Enough, Zeiss! I will not tolerate you insulting Princess Guinevere!

speaker: Melady
text: It’s the princess, not the king, who is truly working for the good of Bern. Granted, I was angry when the princess left without consulting me at all. But now that I’m by her side, I understand more than ever...that she had not made a mistake.

speaker: Zeiss
text: ...Sir Galle was right.

speaker: Zeiss
text: He said that he didn’t intend on doing anything until he heard your story.

speaker: Melady
text: Galle said that...

speaker: Zeiss
text: I don’t fully agree with you yet, but... I know I can trust you.

speaker: Melady
text: Zeiss! Then...?

speaker: Zeiss
text: If the Lycia Alliance Army’s leader would allow it, I want to go with you. I want to see the princess’ beliefs that moved you so.

speaker: Narcian
text: I am strong...I am wise...I am handsome...and I am right. Always! More than anybody!

speaker: Narcian
text: No…No…! I will not be defeated…! Not by you…worthless… Gaaaaaaahhhhh!

speaker: Narcian
text: You...! You’re that girl that was...!

speaker: Clarine
text: ? Excuse me, have we met before?

speaker: Narcian
text: What! You have forgotten me, of all people!? That...must not be!

speaker: Narcian
text: You’re Princess Guinevere’s... Ha! So you betray your nation and turn to the enemy. Disgraceful!

speaker: Narcian
text: You...

speaker: Zeiss
text: General Narcian... No, Narcian! I heard everything from Sir Galle! Do you not...have any honor left in you at all!

speaker: Narcian
text: Galle...! Dammit, is he ever an eyesore! Well, it shall be fine... Once I get rid of you, everything will be shrouded in mystery...

speaker: Narcian
text: You’re... So, being defeated once wasn’t enough?

speaker: Cecilia
text: Zephiel was the one who defeated me. Not you.

speaker: Narcian
text: Then I shall show you my strength now!

speaker: Narcian
text: Well, if it isn’t General Percival, the traitor!

speaker: Percival
text: Joining you...was the biggest mistake of my life. And now, I shall repent for it...by defeating you!

speaker: Mordred
text: So it is you...who rescued us?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy, leader of the Lycia Alliance Army.

speaker: Mordred
text: Hm...

speaker: Mordred
text: ...I must ask you of something. The soldiers who have been working with Bern have taken over the Tower of the Saint.

speaker: Roy
text: The Tower of the Saint... That is where Saint Elimine’s altar lies.

speaker: Mordred
text: Yes... That is a national symbol of Etruria. Please, I ask you to recapture the tower.

speaker: Roy
text: I will do what I can.

speaker: Mordred
text: I am sorry. You may use anything in the tower that you find useful.

speaker: Roy
text: The king... He still mourns the prince’s death.

speaker: Merlinus
text: He must have been an easy target for Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: I want to help him...but how?

speaker: Elffin
text: Father...I am sorry. When the time comes, I will return...I promise.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere, I must speak with you.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Is it that we must attack Bern as well after Etruria?

speaker: Roy
text: ! Did someone inform you?

speaker: Guinevere
text: No. ...But I knew that it would happen eventually.

speaker: Roy
text: ...We cannot leave Bern running around freely any longer. I know that it will be hard to see your nation invaded, but...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Roy, I will give this to you.

speaker: Roy
text: What is this?

speaker: Guinevere
text: It is Bern’s greatest treasure...the Fire Emblem.

speaker: Roy
text: What!?

speaker: Guinevere
text: In the south of Bern lies a temple called the Temple of Seals. In it lies the sword that our founder, Hartmut, used.

speaker: Roy
text: Is it...one of the Divine Weapons?

speaker: Guinevere
text: I believe so. It was a sword made to slay the Dark Dragon, the leader of the Dragons during the Scouring. However, it held power so immense that it was sealed away after the war. The Fire Emblem is the key to break its seal.

speaker: Roy
text: The key...

speaker: Guinevere
text: My brother...is trying to force the world into submission through power. That is not forgivable, no matter what the reason.

speaker: Guinevere
text: To stop him, all we can do is defeat the Dragon at his side.

speaker: Roy
text: Princess Guinevere...

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...My name shall be stained in history, as the woman who betrayed her nation.

speaker: Roy
text: No...

speaker: Guinevere
text: I shall be hated all my life as a traitor. Roy, promise me one thing. When we invade Bern, promise me that you will not harm the civilians...

speaker: Roy
text: I promise. Please trust me.

speaker: Guinevere
text: ...Thank you.

speaker: Soldier
text: General Raeth, about the girl we captured earlier...

speaker: Raeth
text: Girl? That one that was scurrying around the outskirts of the castle? Are you still worrying yourself over that thing? Just throw her out.

speaker: Soldier
text: But sir, she was carrying this.

speaker: Raeth
text: ? Is this...a Dragon Stone?

speaker: Soldier
text: ...That is also what I thought, so I decided to report.

speaker: Raeth
text: Have you ever seen a Dragon Stone before?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, when we invaded Lycia. The Dragons were carrying them when they were in their human form.

speaker: Raeth
text: ...But it looks different from the ones that they have. Either way, it has to do with the Dragons. We should inform King Zephiel and follow his instructions. Make sure the girl doesn’t get away!

speaker: Douglas
text: Percival, don’t strain yourself here.

speaker: Percival
text: Lord Douglas, please do not worry about me. You must return to King Mordred’s side.

speaker: Douglas
text: Hmph, defeating the Lycia Alliance Army is not a task that requires the Knight General’s assistance. ...Roartz, that snake.

speaker: Percival
text: He is wary of my turning against him. He must be thinking that I would try and murder him in his sleep if I were stationed at Aquleia.

speaker: Douglas
text: That man, worrying about traitors? Ha! He shouldn’t be the one to talk. Why, he was first to betray his loyalty to the king! The bastard.

speaker: Percival
text: Well, Lord Douglas, it just goes to show that not many have such loyalty as you.

speaker: Douglas
text: Rubbish. Look at yourself.

speaker: Percival
text: ...I had no hesitations when Prince Mildain was alive. I never doubted my loyalty to him, or to the wellbeing of Etruria. This mission is to protect the king’s life... That...should be enough reason to fight...

speaker: Douglas
text: Do you hesitate now?

speaker: Percival
text: Yes, slightly. But it matters not. Nothing will change even if I do.

speaker: Douglas
text: I see... Percival, my speech from this point forth is merely to myself. Do not reply to it.

speaker: Douglas
text: Etruria...will most certainly fall with the king before this war ends.

speaker: Percival
text: !! Lord Douglas!?

speaker: Douglas
text: Listen! No matter what happens, I will stay by the king’s side. But you, Percival, you are different. You are the one who will lead Etruria’s future. I cannot say when, but I firmly believe that Etruria will be blessed with prosperity once more. So Percival, you must leave Etruria and wait until that time comes.

speaker: Percival
text: Lord Douglas! What does...

speaker: Soldier
text: General Percival! We have spotted the Lycia Alliance Army up ahead! What are your orders, sir?

speaker: Douglas
text: Now go! I shall return to Aquleia.

speaker: Percival
text: ... Move forth! Pursue the Lycia Alliance Army!

speaker: Roy
text: Is that the castle where Fa was taken?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes. The locals have witnessed it.

speaker: Igrene
text: Roy, I apologize on behalf of my people for the inconvenience... I know we must hurry toward Aquleia.

speaker: Roy
text: No, please don’t worry about it. If she were to fall into the hands of Bern, that in itself would be a disaster.

speaker: Igrene
text: She should be safe as long as she remains in her human form and doesn’t show anyone her Dragon Stone.

speaker: Roy
text: Dragon Stone?

speaker: Igrene
text: Yes. When Dragons are in their human form, they seal their powers into crystals called Dragon Stones. It is said that it takes vast amounts of energy for Dragons to maintain their actual form in this world, so they typically remain in human form to minimize energy consumption.

speaker: Roy
text: Maybe the ‘human not human’ was in human form for the same reason.

speaker: Igrene
text: Most likely. It is also said that Dragons only started taking human after the Scouring ended.

speaker: Roy
text: Since the Scouring...?

speaker: Igrene
text: Yes...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, the spy we sent to the castle has returned.

speaker: Roy
text: What did he find out?

speaker: Merlinus
text: He said that a large number of troops have been coming out of the castle. They seem to be fortifying their defenses.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh... Maybe they found out that Fa is a Dragon.

speaker: Merlinus
text: The border guards also seem to have noticed us...

speaker: Roy
text: We have to do this quickly.

speaker: Garret
text: This is gonna be a battlefield, too...

speaker: Bandit
text: What do we do, Boss?

speaker: Garret
text: The army’s gonna loot the villages anyway. I suppose we better ransack ’em while we can.

speaker: Bandit
text: Awright, Boss!

speaker: Garret
text: But make sure you don’t do any unnecessary killing, you got that?

speaker: Bandit
text: Got it...

speaker: Bandit
text: He’s too nice... Well, I guess we can make it the army’s fault.

speaker: Soldier
text: General Raeth, the reinforcements are ready!

speaker: Raeth
text: Good. Send them out.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Lilina
text: Wait!

speaker: Garret
text: What? Who are you?

speaker: Lilina
text: Why? Why do you attack the villages?

speaker: Garret
text: Eh? Who do you think you are?

speaker: Lilina
text: Tell me why you’re attacking the villages!

speaker: Garret
text: Why? ...Well, I could say that it’s your fault.

speaker: Lilina
text: Our fault...?

speaker: Garret
text: Yup. Because you idiots are causing wars like this, there are more and more people like me who have to steal to get food.

speaker: Lilina
text: We are fighting to help people like that.

speaker: Garret
text: Right, I’ve heard that enough times now. Look at reality, kid. They all say that they’re trying to help, but it’s all words and empty promises. Where’s the action? You got your head in the clouds, and you just can’t see what goes on on the ground. Get it? Now out of my way.

speaker: Garret
text: What!? Listen, I ain’t playing games with you. If you don’t get the hell out of my way...

speaker: Lilina
text: I won’t move. If you want to kill me, then you may do as you wish.

speaker: Garret
text: What...

speaker: Lilina
text: If I let you pass, I would just be another one of those people who you say are all talk and no action. I am telling the truth! We are fighting to help the people.

speaker: Garret
text: You... Hehe... I never thought I’d meet anyone so naive.

speaker: Lilina
text: Do you...laugh at us...?

speaker: Garret
text: But still, it’s nice to hear once in a while.

speaker: Lilina
text: Then...

speaker: Garret
text: All right, you win. I’ll stop looting. But you gotta let me fight with you guys. I gotta see with my own eyes that you’re gonna be true to your words.

speaker: Lilina
text: Thank you. If you fight alongside us, I’m sure you will understand.

speaker: Garret
text: Well, you certainly seem confident about that. I’m Garret. And you’re...

speaker: Lilina
text: Lilina.

speaker: Garret
text: Lilina? Well, then, I’m pleased to make your acquaintance, milady.

speaker: Raeth
text: Hmm… There must be a reason that you attack this castle… But what…?

speaker: Raeth
text: Gah…! That girl…she isn’t human, is she! Why…do you seek her…! To use her power…? …!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, here she is!

speaker: Roy
text: You found her? All right, I’m coming!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Now, young lady, thank Master Roy.

speaker: Fa
text: ...Sniff, sniff...

speaker: Roy
text: It’s okay, Merlinus. ...Now, why did you follow us?

speaker: Fa
text: Fa just wanted to see the outside world...

speaker: Merlinus
text: What! For such a reason... Do you know how much trouble you have caused?

speaker: Fa
text: But...but... Fa’s never, ever allowed outside! The elders say that Fa has to be hidden... Fa is always all alone...all locked up in her room...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Master Roy, what shall we do?

speaker: Roy
text: ...You’ve suffered a lot. But do you understand that you’ve worried the elders and caused a lot of inconvenience?

speaker: Fa
text: Fa’s sorry...

speaker: Roy
text: Really sorry?

speaker: Fa
text: Yes.

speaker: Roy
text: Well, then, you can come with us.

speaker: Fa
text: Really!?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Roy
text: The enemy might already know about her. In that case, it’s better to have her where we can see her rather than letting her go off on her own back to Arcadia.

speaker: Fa
text: Yay!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hush! Don’t get too excited.

speaker: Roy
text: But you mustn’t go off alone anymore. Promise?

speaker: Fa
text: Yes! Fa promises!

speaker: Soldier
text: General Percival, until further instructions are given, we will station ourselves in this castle and prepare for further attacks from the Revolutionaries.

speaker: Percival
text: Good.

speaker: Soldier
text: Here, we found this in the castle. Please take it. General Percival, please take care...of Etruria.

speaker: Percival
text: I know. Leave it to me.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes!

speaker: Cath
text: I snuck in here no problem, but there's nothing worth stealing! Hmm, looks like the north hall has all the valuables, but with that security- ...Are those footsteps?

speaker: Wagner
text: I trust everything is under control.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, milord, the soldiers are stationed all around the castle.

speaker: Wagner
text: Once they're inside and have their guard down, ambush them, just as with Lord Orun.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Wagner
text: I want Princess Guinivere alive. The rest you can do with as you wish. Now go.

speaker: Wagner
text: Ha ha ha ha... First the Silver Wolf's granddaughter, and now Princess Guinivere... With so much to offer, Bern is certain to allow us to join them.

speaker: Cath
text: Hmmm... Now isn't that interesting.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Finally we can get a good night's rest, Lord Roy!

speaker: Roy
text: I wonder. That man said he was Lord Orun's advisor...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Wagner? Did something seem wrong with him?

speaker: Roy
text: He seemed to be in control of everything, as if he were the lord. And Lord Orun is so ill he can't even meet his guests? It all seems strange...

speaker: Merlinus
text: Now that you mention it, you have a point.

speaker: Saul
text: Excuse me, Lord Roy. There seem to be an awful lot of soldiers patrolling the castle.

speaker: Dorothy
text: I think they're spying on us.

speaker: Roy
text: What? No...

speaker: Dorothy
text: You noticed? Not bad...

speaker: Roy
text: Who's there?! Show yourself, intruder!

speaker: Cath
text: Hi!

speaker: Roy
text: And...who might you be?

speaker: Cath
text: Aw, I'm not one to talk about myself. I overheard that Wagner guy in the main hall though. He said they're gonna ambush you guys.

speaker: Roy
text: Lord Orun would never do that!

speaker: Cath
text: Oh yeah, he's dead, I think. Wagner assassinated him or something.

speaker: Roy
text: What?!

speaker: Cath
text: He wants to capture you all and turn you over to Bern.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Wait, Lord Roy! We can't trust her word so easily!

speaker: Cath
text: It's up to you whether you trust me or not. But don't say I didn't warn ya!

speaker: Guinevere
text: Roy... If what she says is true...

speaker: Roy
text: Let's spring his trap. We'll pretend like we're leaving. If Wagner is after us, he'll try to persuade us to stay.

speaker: Cath
text: If you wanna get out, go through the north hall! That'll bring you to the courtyard, so you'll be outta here in no time. Good luck!

speaker: Wagner
text: Oh, Lord Roy! Where are you off to? I will escort you back into the castle, so please follow me.

speaker: Roy
text: My apologies, Sir Wagner. I have just received a report of grave importance. Please excuse us, but we must take our leave now.

speaker: Wagner
text: Surely you would appreciate a warm bed after being in the field for so long. Lord Orun would be furious with me if you left without accepting our hospitality.

speaker: Roy
text: Don't worry, I shall tell Lord Orun myself that you are not to blame. I ought to at least offer him a greeting anyway. Please show us to his room.

speaker: Wagner
text: As I said, milord, Lord Orun is ill and cannot accept guests.

speaker: Roy
text: If we cannot see him, then we must be off.

speaker: Wagner
text: There's nothing I can offer to make you stay?

speaker: Wagner
text: You leave me no choice then! Guards! Attack! Kill them all, but leave Princess Guinivere alive!

speaker: Roy
text: The girl was right! They were trying to ambush us!

speaker: Saul
text: Lord Roy! If we go this way, we'll be leaving our rear open to attack!

speaker: Roy
text: Then we'll seize the whole castle! Everyone, follow my lead!

speaker: Sue
text: All that noise... A battle? What is going on out there?

speaker: Cath
text: Hoo-boy, they're at each other's throats now. Time to pilfer what I can now that security's busy.

speaker: Roy
text: Hey! You're...

speaker: Cath
text: Oops...

speaker: Roy
text: Wait!

speaker: Cath
text: Hey, cut it out! Let go of my arm! Ow! That hurts!

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, I'm sorry. But what are you doing here?

speaker: Cath
text: Well, uh, you know, this and that. I'm a busy girl. Ha ha ha...

speaker: Roy
text: Here? In a battlefield?

speaker: Cath
text: Oh yes, precisely BECAUSE this is a battlefield- Whoops, better watch my tongue...

speaker: Roy
text: Do you have some ulterior motive?

speaker: Cath
text: Uh...

speaker: Roy
text: Wait, is that why you told us the escape route?

speaker: Cath
text: Um, what? Sorry, I'm a little deaf in this ear!

speaker: Roy
text: Just who are you?

speaker: Cath
text: Don't worry about it! Forget you saw me. Gotta go. Cheers!

speaker: Roy
text: Hey, wait!

speaker: Sue
text: Who are you?

speaker: Roy
text: What's a girl doing in here?

speaker: Sue
text: You aren't with the castle?

speaker: Roy
text: My name is Roy. Who are you?

speaker: Sue
text: I am Sue. Are you the one causing that noise outside?

speaker: Roy
text: Noise?

speaker: Sue
text: The noise of battle.

speaker: Roy
text: Oh, I guess so. We're fighting the castle guards. It's a bit of a long story...

speaker: Sue
text: I see. Then I will join your side.

speaker: Roy
text: You will? Why?

speaker: Sue
text: The soldiers of this castle have done me wrong.

speaker: Roy
text: What? What do you mean...?

speaker: Sue
text: Please give me a bow. I will fight with you.

speaker: Wagner
text: Useless guards! But very well. Witness my magic...and bow down before its power!

speaker: Wagner
text: No... My plan...was flawless...

speaker: Roy
text: ...You're the granddaughter of one of the chieftains in Sacae?

speaker: Sue
text: My grandfather is the strongest warrior in Sacae. People call him the Silver Wolf.

speaker: Roy
text: The Silver Wolf... I've heard tales of him. But what are you doing in Lycia? This is a long way from Sacae.

speaker: Sue
text: Bern invaded Sacae, so the Kutolah clan decided to take up arms. Grandfather had the women and children escape to Lycia, but...

speaker: Roy
text: But?

speaker: Sue
text: There was a traitor. The Djute clan, who turned to Bern's side, ambushed us.

speaker: Sue
text: We were all separated. I found my way into this land and I was rescued by Lord Orun. But Wagner, his advisor, assassinated Lord Orun and took over the castle.

speaker: Roy
text: And that's when you were captured...

speaker: Sue
text: Is your army fighting Bern?

speaker: Roy
text: Yes, we will fight for as long as it takes.

speaker: Sue
text: Then let me join you. Fighting Bern may lead me to Grandfather. Lord Orun deserves vengeance as well.

speaker: Roy
text: We're headed for Ostia, in the west. Sacae is in the east, the opposite direction. Is that all right?

speaker: Sue
text: I don't mind. No matter where we are, Mother Earth and Father Sky will watch over me.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Roy! The spy I sent to Ostia has just returned. He says that Ostia is in a state of anarchy!

speaker: Roy
text: What?! Why?

speaker: Merlinus
text: There's been a rebellion among those who want to surrrender to Bern.

speaker: Roy
text: Is Lilina safe?

speaker: Merlinus
text: The spy says that she has been taken hostage. The rebels already took over Castle Ostia and are fighting the loyalist soldiers.

speaker: Roy
text: We must hurry to Ostia! Lilina... Please be safe!
